p_request => $1

HELP.bodyFullText:
APEX_APPLICATION.HELP ( p_request IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_flow_id IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_flow_step_id IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_show_item_help IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'YES', p_show_regions IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'YES', p_before_page_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '

', p_after_page_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_before_region_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_after_region_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '

', p_before_prompt_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '

', p_after_prompt_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '

: ', p_before_item_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, p_after_item_html IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
HELP.descriptionText: This function outputs page and item level help text as formatted HTML. You can also use it to customize how help information is displayed in your application.

STOP_APEX_ENGINE.descriptionText: This procedure signals the Application Express engine to stop further processing and immediately exit to avoid adding additional HTML code to the HTTP buffer.

CLEAR_ALL.descriptionText: This procedure clears all values currently maintained in the APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL package.

GENERATE_APPLICATION_ID.descriptionText: This procedure generates an available application ID on the instance and sets the application ID in APEX_APPLICATION_INSTALL.

GENERATE_OFFSET.descriptionText: This procedure generates the offset value used during application import. Use the offset value to ensure that the metadata for the Application Express application definition does not collide with other metadata on the instance. For a new application installation, it is usually sufficient to call this procedure to have Application Express generate this offset value for you.

GET_APPLICATION_ALIAS.descriptionText: This function gets the application alias for the application to be imported. This is only used if the application to be imported has an alias specified. An application alias must be unique within a workspace and it is recommended to be unique within an instance.

GET_APPLICATION_ID.descriptionText: Use this function to get the application ID of the application to be imported. The application ID should either not exist in the instance or, if it does exist, must be in the workspace where the application is being imported to.

GET_APPLICATION_NAME.descriptionText: This function gets the application name of the import application.

GET_AUTO_INSTALL_SUP_OBJ.descriptionText: Use this function to get the automatic install of supporting objects setting used during the import of an application. This setting is valid only for command line installs. If the setting is set to TRUE and the application export contains supporting objects, it automatically installs or upgrades the supporting objects when an application imports from the command line.

GET_IMAGE_PREFIX.descriptionText: This function gets the image prefix of the import application. Most Application Express instances use the default image prefix of /i/.

GET_KEEP_SESSIONS.descriptionText: This function finds out if sessions and session state will be preserved or deleted on upgrades.

GET_OFFSET.descriptionText: Use function to get the offset value used during the import of an application.

GET_PROXY.descriptionText: Use this function to get the proxy server attribute of an application to be imported.

GET_SCHEMA.descriptionText: Use this function to get the parsing schema ("owner") of the Application Express application.

GET_WORKSPACE_ID.descriptionText: Use this function to get the workspace ID for the application to be imported.

SET_APPLICATION_ALIAS.descriptionText: This procedure sets the application alias for the application to be imported. This is only used if the application to be imported has an alias specified. An application alias must be unique within a workspace and it is recommended to be unique within an instance.

SET_APPLICATION_ID.descriptionText: Use this procedure to set the application ID of the application to be imported. The application ID should either not exist in the instance or, if it does exist, must be in the workspace where the application is being imported to. This number must be a positive integer and must not be from the reserved range of Application Express application IDs.

SET_APPLICATION_NAME.descriptionText: This procedure sets the application name of the import application.

SET_AUTO_INSTALL_SUP_OBJ.descriptionText: This procedure sets the automatic install of supporting objects value used during application import. This setting is valid only for command line installs. If the value is set to TRUE and the application export contains supporting objects, it automatically installs or upgrades the supporting objects when an application imports from the command line.

SET_IMAGE_PREFIX.descriptionText: This procedure sets the image prefix of the import application. Most Application Express instances use the default image prefix of /i/.

SET_KEEP_SESSIONS.descriptionText: This procedure preserves sessions associated with the application on upgrades.

SET_OFFSET.descriptionText: This procedure sets the offset value used during application import. Use the offset value to ensure that the metadata for the Application Express application definition does not collide with other metadata on the instance. For a new application installation, it is usually sufficient to call the generate_offset procedure to have Application Express generate this offset value for you.

SET_PROXY.descriptionText: Use this procedure to set the proxy server attributes of an application to be imported.

SET_SCHEMA.descriptionText: Use this function to set the parsing schema ("owner") of the Application Express application. The database user of this schema must already exist, and this schema name must already be mapped to the workspace used to import the application.

SET_WORKSPACE.descriptionText: This function is used to set the workspace ID for the application to be imported.

SET_WORKSPACE_ID.descriptionText: Use this function to set the workspace ID for the application to be imported.

CALLBACK.bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.CALLBACK ( 
    p_session_id IN NUMBER, 
    p_app_id IN NUMBER,
    p_page_id IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,                   
    p_ajax_identifier IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_x01 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x02 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x03 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x04 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x05 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x06 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x07 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x08 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x09 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x10 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL );
CALLBACK.descriptionText: This procedure is the landing resource for external login pages. Call this procedure directly from the browser.

GET_CALLBACK_URL.bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.GET_CALLBACK_URL ( 
    p_x01 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x02 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x03 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x04 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x05 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x06 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x07 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x08 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x09 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
    p_x10 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL ) 
    return VARCHAR2;
GET_CALLBACK_URL.descriptionText: This function is a plugin helper function to return a URL that is used as a landing request for external login pages. When the browser sends the request, it triggers the authentication plugin ajax callback, which can be used to log the user in.

GET_LOGIN_USERNAME_COOKIE.descriptionText: This function reads the cookie with the username from the default login page.

IS_AUTHENTICATED.descriptionText: This function checks if the user is authenticated in the session and returns TRUE if the user is already logged in or FALSE if the user of the current session is not yet authenticated.

IS_PUBLIC_USER.descriptionText: This function checks if the user is not authenticated in the session. A FALSE is returned if the user is already logged on or TRUE if the user of the current session is not yet authenticated.

LOGIN.bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.LOGIN ( 
    p_username IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_password IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_uppercase_username IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE );
LOGIN.descriptionText: This procedure authenticates the user in the current session.

LOGOUT.bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.LOGOUT ( 
    p_session_id in number, 
    p_app_id in number, 
    p_ws_app_id in number default null );
LOGOUT.descriptionText: This procedure closes the session and redirects to the applicatio\'s home page. Call this procedure directly from the browser.

POST_LOGIN.bodyFullText:
APEX_AUTHENTICATION.POST_LOGIN ( 
    p_username IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_password IN VARCHAR2, 
    p_uppercase_username IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE );
POST_LOGIN.descriptionText: This procedure authenticates the user in the current session. It runs a subset of login(), without steps 1 and 2. For steps, see "LOGIN Procedure." It is primarily useful in authentication schemes where user credentials checking is done externally to Application Express.

SEND_LOGIN_USERNAME_COOKIE.descriptionText: This procedure sends a cookie with the username.

ENABLE_DYNAMIC_GROUPS.descriptionText: This procedure enables groups in the current session. These groups do not have to be created in the Application Express workspace repository, but can, for example, be loaded from a LDAP repository. Enabling a group that exists in the workspace repository and has other groups granted to it, also enables the granted groups.

IS_AUTHORIZED.descriptionText: Determine if the current user passes the authorization with name p_authorization_name. For performance reasons, authorization results are cached. Because of this, the function may not always evaluate the authorization when called, but take the result out of the cache.

RESET_CACHE.descriptionText: This procedure resets the authorization caches for the session and forces a re-evaluation when an authorization is checked next.

ADD_MEMBER.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.ADD_MEMBER (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_c001 IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    ...
    p_c050 IN VARCHAR2 default null,
    p_n001 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n002 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n003 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n004 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_n005 IN NUMBER default null,
    p_d001 IN DATE default null,
    p_d002 IN DATE default null,
    p_d003 IN DATE default null,
    p_d004 IN DATE default null,
    p_d005 IN DATE default null,
    p_clob001 IN CLOB default empty_clob(),
    p_blob001 IN BLOB default empty_blob(),
    p_xmltype001 IN XMLTYPE default null,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2  default 'NO');
ADD_MEMBER.descriptionText: Use this procedure to add a new member to an existing collection. An error is raised if the specified collection does not exist for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID. Gaps are not used when adding a new member, so an existing collection with members of sequence IDs (1,2,5,8) adds the new member with a sequence ID of 9.

ADD_MEMBERS.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.ADD_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_c001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    p_c002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    p_c003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    ...
    p_c050 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 default empty_vc_arr,
    p_n001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n004 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_n005 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.N_ARR default empty_n_arr,
    p_d001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d004 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_d005 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.D_ARR default empty_d_arr,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2 default 'NO');
ADD_MEMBERS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to add an array of members to a collection. An error is raised if the specified collection does not exist for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID. Gaps are not used when adding a new member, so an existing collection with members of sequence IDs (1,2,5,8) adds the new member with a sequence ID of 9. The count of elements in the p_c001 PL/SQL table is used as the total number of items across all PL/SQL tables. For example, if p_c001.count is 2 and p_c002.count is 10, only 2 members are added. If p_c001 is null an application error is raised.

COLLECTION_EXISTS.descriptionText: Use this function to determine if a collection exists. A TRUE is returned if the specified collection exists for the current user in the current session for the current Application ID, otherwise FALSE is returned.

COLLECTION_HAS_CHANGED.descriptionText: Use this function to determine if a collection has changed since it was created or the collection changed flag was reset.

COLLECTION_MEMBER_COUNT.descriptionText: Use this function to get the total number of members for the named collection. If gaps exist, the total member count returned is not equal to the highest sequence ID in the collection. If the named collection does not exist for the current user in the current session, an error is raised.

CREATE_COLLECTION.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create an empty collection that does not already exist. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2 default 'NO');
CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query. The query is parsed as the application owner. This method can be used with a query with up to 50 columns in the SELECT clause. These columns in the SELECT clause populates the 50 character attributes of the collection (C001 through C050). If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY2.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY2 (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_generate_md5 IN VARCHAR2 default 'NO');
CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY2.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query. This method is identical to CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY, however, the first 5 columns of the SELECT clause must be numeric and the next 5 must be date. After the numeric and date columns, there can be up to 50 character columns in the SELECT clause. The query is parsed as the application owner. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_B.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_B (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_names IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_values IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_max_row_count IN NUMBER DEFAULT null);
CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_B.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query using bulk operations. This method offers significantly faster performance than the CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY method. The query is parsed as the application owner. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERYB2.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERYB2 (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_query IN VARCHAR2,
    p_names IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_values IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_max_row_count IN NUMBER DEFAULT null);
CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERYB2.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection from a supplied query using bulk operations. This method offers significantly faster performance than the CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_2 method. The query is parsed as the application owner. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. It is identical to the CREATE_COLLECTION_FROM_QUERY_B, however, the first five columns of the SELECT clause must be numeric and the next five columns must be date. After the date columns, there can be up to 50 character columns in the SELECT clause

CREATE_OR_TRUNCATE_COLLECTION.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create a collection. If a collection exists with the same name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, all members of the collection are removed. In other words, the named collection is truncated.

DELETE_ALL_COLLECTIONS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete all collections that belong to the current user in the current Application Express session for the current Application ID.

DELETE_ALL_COLLECTIONS_SESSION.descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete all collections that belong to the current user in the current Application Express session regardless of the Application ID.

DELETE_COLLECTION.descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete a named collection. All members that belong to the collection are removed and the named collection is dropped. If the named collection does not exist for the same user in the current session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

DELETE_MEMBER.descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete a specified member from a given named collection. If the named collection does not exist for the same user in the current session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

DELETE_MEMBERS.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.DELETE_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_attr_number IN VARCHAR2,
    p_attr_value IN VARCHAR2);
DELETE_MEMBERS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete all members from a given named collection where the attribute specified by the attribute number equals the supplied value. If the named collection does not exist for the same user in the current session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the attribute number specified is invalid or outside the range of 1 to 50, an error is raised.

GET_MEMBER_MD5.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.GET_MEMBER_MD5 (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq IN NUMBER)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_MEMBER_MD5.descriptionText: Use this function to compute and return the message digest of the attributes for the member specified by the sequence ID. This computation of message digest is equal to the computation performed natively by collections. Thus, the result of this function could be compared to the MD5_ORIGINAL column of the view apex_collections.

MERGE_MEMBERS.bodyNoDefault:
p_collection_name => $1
	, p_seq => $2
	, p_c001 => $3
	, p_c002 => $4
	, p_c003 => $5
	...
	, p_c050 => $6
	, p_null_index => $7
	, p_null_value => $8
	, p_init_query => $9
MERGE_MEMBERS.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.MERGE_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq  IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c001 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c002 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c003 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    ...
    p_c050 IN APEX_APPLICATION_GLOBAL.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_null_index  IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,
    p_null_value  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT null,
    p_init_query  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT null);
MERGE_MEMBERS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to merge members of the given named collection with the values passed in the arrays. If the named collection does not exist one is created. If a p_init_query is provided, the collection is created from the supplied SQL query. If the named collection exists, the following occurs:

MOVE_MEMBER_DOWN.descriptionText: Use this procedure to adjust the sequence ID of specified member in the given named collection down by one (subtract one), swapping sequence ID with the one it is replacing. For example, 3 becomes 2 and 2 becomes 3. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq is the lowest sequence in the collection, an application error is NOT returned.

MOVE_MEMBER_UP.descriptionText: Use this procedure to adjust the sequence ID of specified member in the given named collection up by one (add one), swapping sequence ID with the one it is replacing. For example, 2 becomes 3 and 3 becomes 2. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq is the highest sequence in the collection, an application error is not returned.

RESEQUENCE_COLLECTION.descriptionText: For a named collection, use this procedure to update the seq_id value of each member so that no gaps exist in the sequencing. For example, a collection with the following set of sequence IDs (1,2,3,5,8,9) becomes (1,2,3,4,5,6). If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

RESET_COLLECTION_CHANGED.descriptionText: Use this procedure to reset the collection changed flag (mark as not changed) for a given collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

RESET_COLLECTION_CHANGED_ALL.descriptionText: Use this procedure to reset the collection changed flag (mark as not changed) for all collections in the use\'s current session.

SORT_MEMBERS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to reorder the members of a given collection by the column number specified by p_sort_on_column_number. This sorts the collection by a particular column/attribute in the collection and reassigns the sequence IDs of each number such that no gaps exist. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

TRUNCATE_COLLECTION.descriptionText: Use this procedure to remove all members from a named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised.

UPDATE_MEMBER.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.UPDATE_MEMBER (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_c001 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_c002 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_c003 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    ...
    p_c050 IN VARCHAR DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n001 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n002 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n003 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n004 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_n005 IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d001 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d002 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d003 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d004 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
    p_d005 IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,   
    p_clob001 IN CLOB DEFAULT empty_clob(),
    p_blob001 IN BLOB DEFAULT empty-blob(),
    p_xmltype001 IN XMLTYPE DEFAULT NULL);
UPDATE_MEMBER.descriptionText: Use this procedure to update the specified member in the given named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised.

UPDATE_MEMBER_ATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.UPDATE_MEMBER_ATTRIBUTE (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq IN NUMBER,
    p_attr_number IN NUMBER,
    p_attr_value  IN VARCHAR2);
UPDATE_MEMBER_ATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: Update the specified member attribute in the given named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised. If the attribute number specified is invalid or outside the range 1-50, an error is raised. Any attribute value exceeding 4,000 bytes are truncated to 4,000 bytes.

UPDATE_MEMBERS.bodyFullText:
APEX_COLLECTION.UPDATE_MEMBERS (
    p_collection_name IN VARCHAR2,
    p_seq  IN apex_application_global.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c001 IN apex_application_global.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c002 IN apex_application_global.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_c003 IN apex_application_global.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    ...
    p_c050 IN apex_application_global.VC_ARR2 DEFAULT empty_vc_arr,
    p_n001 IN apex_application_global.N_ARR DEFAULT empty_n_arr,
    p_n002 IN apex_application_global.N_ARR DEFAULT empty_n_arr,
    p_n003 IN apex_application_global.N_ARR DEFAULT empty_n_arr,
    p_n004 IN apex_application_global.N_ARR DEFAULT empty_n_arr,
    p_n005 IN apex_application_global.N_ARR DEFAULT empty_n_arr,
    p_d001 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d002 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d003 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d004 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr,
    p_d005 IN apex_application_global.D_ARR DEFAULT empty_d_arr)
UPDATE_MEMBERS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to update the array of members for the given named collection. If a collection does not exist with the specified name for the current user in the same session and for the current Application ID, an application error is raised. The count of elements in the p_seq PL/SQL table is used as the total number of items across all PL/SQL tables. That is, if p_seq.count = 2 and p_c001.count = 10, only 2 members are updaapex_application_globalted. If p_seq is null, an application error is raised. If the member specified by sequence ID p_seq does not exist, an application error is raised.

ADD.descriptionText: This procedure adds a CSS style snippet that is included inline in the HTML output. Use this procedure to add new CSS style declarations.

ADD_3RD_PARTY_LIBRARY_FILE.bodyFullText:
add_3rd_party_library_file ( 
    p_library in varchar2, 
    p_file_name in varchar2, 
    p_directory in varchar2 default null, 
    p_version in varchar2 default null, 
    p_media_query in varchar2 default null );
ADD_3RD_PARTY_LIBRARY_FILE.descriptionText: This procedure adds the link tag to load a 3rd party css file and also takes into account the specified Content Delivery Network for the application. Supported libraries include: jQuery, jQueryUI, jQueryMobile.

ADD_FILE.bodyNoDefault:
p_name => $1
	, p_directory => $2
	, p_version => $3
	, p_skip_extension => $4
	, p_media_query => $5
	, p_ie_condition => $6
ADD_FILE.bodyFullText:
APEX_CSS.ADD_FILE (
    p_name           IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_directory      IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT APEX.G_IMAGE_PREFIX||'css/',
    p_version        IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_skip_extension IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE
    p_media_query    IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_ie_condition   IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
ADD_FILE.descriptionText: This procedure adds the link tag to load a CSS library. If a library has already been added, it will not be added a second time.

APPLICATION_PAGE_ITEM_EXISTS.descriptionText: This function checks for the existence of page-level item within the current page of an application. This function requires the parameter p_item_name. This function returns a Boolean value (TRUE or FALSE).

CURRENT_PAGE_IS_PUBLIC.descriptionText: This function checks whether the current pag\'s authentication attribute is set to Page Is Public and returns a Boolean value (TRUE or FALSE)

DEFINE_USER_SESSION.descriptionText: This procedure combines the SET_USER and SET_SESSION_ID procedures to create one call.

GET_COOKIE_PROPS.bodyFullText:
APEX_CUSTOM_AUTH.GET_COOKIE_PROPS(
    p_app_id                       IN  NUMBER,
    p_cookie_name                  OUT VARCHAR2,
    p_cookie_path                  OUT VARCHAR2,
    p_cookie_domain                OUT VARCHAR2
    p_secure                                   OUT BOOLEAN);
GET_COOKIE_PROPS.descriptionText: This procedure obtains the properties of the session cookie used in the current authentication scheme for the specified application. These properties can be viewed directly in the App Builder by viewing the authentication scheme cookie attributes.

GET_LDAP_PROPS.bodyNoDefault:
p_ldap_host => $1
	, p_ldap_port => $2
	, p_use_ssl => $3
	, p_use_exact_dn => $4
	, p_search_filter => $5
	, p_ldap_dn => $6
	, p_ldap_edit_function => $7
GET_LDAP_PROPS.bodyFullText:
APEX_CUSTOM_AUTH.GET_LDAP_PROPS(
    p_ldap_host                OUT VARCHAR2,
    p_ldap_port                OUT INTEGER,
    p_use_ssl                  OUT VARCHAR2,

    p_search_filter            OUT VARCHAR2,
    p_ldap_dn                  OUT VARCHAR2,
    p_ldap_edit_function       OUT VARCHAR2);
GET_LDAP_PROPS.descriptionText: This procedure obtains the LDAP attributes of the current authentication scheme for the current application. These properties can be viewed directly in App Builder by viewing the authentication scheme attributes.

GET_NEXT_SESSION_ID.descriptionText: This function generates the next session ID from the Oracle Application Express sequence generator. This function returns a number.

GET_SECURITY_GROUP_ID.descriptionText: This function returns a number with the value of the security group ID that identifies the workspace of the current user.

GET_SESSION_ID.descriptionText: This function returns APEX_APPLICATION.G_INSTANCE global variable. GET_SESSION_ID returns a number.

GET_SESSION_ID_FROM_COOKIE.descriptionText: This function returns the Oracle Application Express session ID located by the session cookie in a page request in the current browser session.

GET_USER.descriptionText: This function returns the APEX_APPLICATION.G_USER global variable (VARCHAR2).

GET_USERNAME.descriptionText: This function returns user name registered with the current Oracle Application Express session in the internal sessions table. This user name is usually the same as the authenticated user running the current page.

IS_SESSION_VALID.descriptionText: This function is a Boolean result obtained from executing the current applicatio\'s authentication scheme to determine if a valid session exists. This function returns the Boolean result of the authentication schem\'s page sentry.

LOGIN.descriptionText: Also referred to as the "Login API," this procedure performs authentication and session registration.

POST_LOGIN.descriptionText: This procedure performs session registration, assuming the authentication step has been completed. It can be called only from within an Oracle Application Express application page context.

SESSION_ID_EXISTS.descriptionText: This function returns a Boolean result based on the global package variable containing the current Oracle Application Express session ID. Returns TRUE if the result is a positive number and returns FALSE if the result is a negative number.

SET_SESSION_ID.descriptionText: This procedure sets APEX_APPLICATION.G_INSTANCE global variable. This procedure requires the parameter P_SESSION_ID (NUMBER) which specifies a session ID.

SET_SESSION_ID_TO_NEXT_VALUE.descriptionText: This procedure combines the operation of GET_NEXT_SESSION_ID and SET_SESSION_ID in one call.

SET_USER.descriptionText: This procedure sets the APEX_APPLICATION.G_USER global variable. SET_USER requires the parameter P_USER (VARCHAR2) which defines a user ID.

DISABLE.descriptionText: This procedure turns off debug messaging.

DISABLE_DBMS_OUTPUT.descriptionText: This procedure stops writing all debug logs also via dbms_output.

ENABLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_DEBUG.ENABLE (
    p_level    IN  T_LOG_LEVEL DEFAULT C_LOG_LEVEL_INFO );
ENABLE.descriptionText: This procedure turns on debug messaging. You can specify, by level of importance, the types of debug messages that are monitored.

ENABLE_DBMS_OUTPUT.bodyFullText:
enable_dbms_output (
    p_prefix in varchar2 default '# APEX|' );
ENABLE_DBMS_OUTPUT.descriptionText: This procedure writes all debug logs via dbms_output. If debug is disabled, this call also enables it with log level c_log_level_warn. You have to set a debug level higher than c_log_level_warn for finer grained debug output. The output 95 starts with a configurable prefix, followed by the log level, "|" and the actual debug message.

This procedure is the same as LOG_MESSAGE, except it allows logging of much longer messages, which are subsequently split into 4,000 character chunks in the debugging output (because a single debug message is constrained to 4,000 characters).

ADD_ERROR.descriptionText: This procedure adds an error message to the error stack that is used to display an error on an error page or inline in a notification. It can be called in a validation or process to add one or more errors to the error stack.

AUTO_SET_ASSOCIATED_ITEM.descriptionText: This procedure automatically sets the associated page item or tabular form column based on a constraint contained in p_error.ora_sqlerrm.This procedure performs the following:

EXTRACT_CONSTRAINT_NAME.bodyFullText:
APEX_ERROR.EXTRACT_CONSTRAINT_NAME (
    p_error          in t_error,
    p_include_schema in boolean default false )
    return varchar2;
EXTRACT_CONSTRAINT_NAME.descriptionText: This function extracts a constraint name contained in p_error.ora_sqlerrm. The constraint must match the pattern schema.constraint.

GET_ARIA_ERROR_ATTRIBUTES.descriptionText: This function is useful for item plug-in developers, to enhance screen reader usability of your item, specifically when that item is associated with an error on a page. This function is called as part of rendering of the item, where the main form element(s) are output. The returned WAI-ARIA attributes include:

GET_FIRST_ORA_ERROR_TEXT.bodyFullText:
APEX_ERROR.GET_FIRST_ORA_ERROR_TEXT (
    p_error            in t_error,
    p_include_error_no in boolean default false )
    return varchar2;
GET_FIRST_ORA_ERROR_TEXT.descriptionText: This function returns the first ORA error message text stored in p_error.ora_sqlerrm. If p_error_ora_sqlerrm does not contain a value, NULL is returned.

INIT_ERROR_RESULT.descriptionText: This function returns the t_error_result type initialized with the values stored in p_error.

HTML.descriptionText: This function escapes characters which can change the context in an html environment. It is an extended version of the well-known sys.htf.escape_sc.

HTML_ATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: Use this function to escape the values of html entity attributes. It hex escapes everything that is not alphanumeric or in one of the following characters\'\'\'\'\'\'\'\' .

HTML_TRUNC.bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.HTML_TRUNC (
    p_string IN CLOB,
    p_length IN NUMBER DEFAULT 4000 )
    return VARCHAR2;
HTML_TRUNC.descriptionText: The HTML_TRUNC function escapes html and limits the returned string to p_length bytes. This function returns the first p_length bytes of an input clob and escapes them. You can use this function if the input clob might be too large to fit in a varchar2 variable and it is sufficient to only display the first part of it.

HTML_WHITELIST.bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.HTML_WHITELIST (
    p_html IN VARCHAR2,
    p_whitelist_tags IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT c_html_whitelist_tags )
    return VARCHAR2;
HTML_WHITELIST.descriptionText: The HTML_WHITELIST function performs HTML escape on all characters in the input text except the specified whitelist tags. This function can be useful if the input text contains simple html markup but a developer wants to ensure that an attacker cannot use malicious tags for cross-site scripting.

JS_LITERAL.bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.JS_LITERAL (
    p_string IN VARCHAR2,
    p_quote  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '''' )
    return VARCHAR2;
JS_LITERAL.descriptionText: The JS_LITERAL function escapes and optionally enquotes a javascript string. This function replaces non-immune characters with\\HH or\\HHHH equivalents. The result can be injected into javascript code, within <script> tags or inline ("javascript:xxx"). Immune characters include a through z, A through Z, 0 through 9, commas ",", periods "." and underscores "_" if the output should not be enclosed in quotes when the parameter p_quote is null. If p_quote has a value, printable ASCII 7 characters except for & < > "\' ` /\\% are not escaped.

JSON.descriptionText: This function returns p_string with all special characters escaped.

LDAP_DN.bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.LDAP_DN (
    p_string IN VARCHAR2,
    p_reserved_chars IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT c_ldap_dn_reserved_chars,
    p_escaped_non_ascii IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE )
    return VARCHAR2;
LDAP_DN.descriptionText: The LDAP_DN function escapes reserved characters in an LDAP distinguished name, according to RFC 4514. The RFC describes "+,;<=\\as reserved characters (see p_reserved_chars). These are escaped by a backslash, for example, " becomes\\. Non-printable characters, ascii 0 - 31, and ones with a code > 127 (see p_escape_non_ascii) are escaped as\\x, where xx is the hexadecimal character code. The space character at the beginning or end of the string and a # at the beginning is also escaped with a backslash.

LDAP_SEARCH_FILTER.bodyFullText:
APEX_ESCAPE.LDAP_SEARCH_FILTER (
    p_string              IN VARCHAR2,
    p_reserved_chars    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT c_ldap_search_reserved_chars,
    p_escape_non_ascii IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE )
    return VARCHAR2;
LDAP_SEARCH_FILTER.descriptionText: The LDAP_SEARCH_FILTER function escapes reserved characters in an LDAP search filter, according to RFC 4515. The RFC describes *(\\ as reserved characters (see p_reserved_chars). These, non-printable characters (ascii 0 - 31) and ones with a code > 127 (see p_escape_non_ascii) are escaped as\\x, where xx is the hexadecimal character code.

NOOP.descriptionText: Return p_string unchanged. Use this function to silence automatic injection detection tests, similar to dbms_assert.noop for SQL injection.

REGEXP.descriptionText: This function escapes characters that can change the context in a regular expression. It should be used to secure user input. The following list depicts ascii characters that the function escapes with a backslash \\:

SET_HTML_ESCAPING_MODE.descriptionText: The SET_HTML_ESCAPING_MODE procedure configures HTML escaping mode for apex_escape.html.

ADD_SCHEMA.descriptionText: The ADD_SCHEMA procedure adds a schema to a workspace to schema mapping.

p_workspace_id => $1

ADD_WORKSPACE.descriptionText: The ADD_WORKSPACE procedure adds a workspace to an Application Express Instance.

CREATE_SCHEMA_EXCEPTION.descriptionText: This procedure creates an exception which allows assignment of a restricted schema to a specific workspace.

FREE_WORKSPACE_APP_IDS.descriptionText: This procedure removes the reservation of application IDs for a given workspace ID. Use this procedure to undo a reservation, when the reservation is not necessary anymore because it happened by mistake or the workspace no longer exists. To reserve application IDs for a given workspace, see "RESERVE_WORKSPACE_APP_IDS Procedure."

GET_PARAMETER.descriptionText: The GET_PARAMETER function retrieves the value of a parameter used in administering a runtime environment.

GET_SCHEMAS.descriptionText: The GET_SCHEMAS function retrieves a comma-delimited list of schemas that are mapped to a given workspace.

GET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER.bodyFullText:
get_workspace_parameter(
    p_workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
    p_parameter     IN VARCHAR2,
GET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER.descriptionText: The GET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER procedure gets the workspace parameter.

REMOVE_APPLICATION.descriptionText: The REMOVE_APPLICATION procedure removes the application specified from the Application Express instance.

REMOVE_SAVED_REPORT.descriptionText: The REMOVE_SAVED_REPORT procedure removes a specific use\'s saved interactive report settings for a particular application.

REMOVE_SAVED_REPORTS.bodyFullText:
APEX_INSTANCE_ADMIN.REMOVE_SAVED_REPORTS(
    p_application_id     IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
REMOVE_SAVED_REPORTS.descriptionText: The REMOVE_SAVED_REPORTS procedure removes all user saved interactive report settings for a particular application or for the entire instance.

REMOVE_SCHEMA.descriptionText: This REMOVE_SCHEMA procedure removes a workspace to schema mapping.

REMOVE_SCHEMA_EXCEPTION.descriptionText: This procedure removes an exception that allows the assignment of a restricted schema to a given workspace.

REMOVE_SCHEMA_EXCEPTIONS.descriptionText: This procedure removes all exceptions that allow the assignment of a given schema to workspaces.

REMOVE_SUBSCRIPTION.descriptionText: The REMOVE_SUBSCRIPTION procedure removes a specific interactive report subscription.

REMOVE_WORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
APEX_INSTANCE_ADMIN.REMOVE_WORKSPACE(
    p_workspace         IN VARCHAR2,
    p_drop_users        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'N',
    p_drop_tablespaces  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'N' );
REMOVE_WORKSPACE.descriptionText: The REMOVE_WORKSPACE procedure removes a workspace from an Application Express instance.

REMOVE_WORKSPACE_EXCEPTIONS.descriptionText: This procedure removes all exceptions that allow the assignment of restricted schemas to given workspace.

RESERVE_WORKSPACE_APP_IDS.descriptionText: This procedure permanently reserves the IDs of websheet and database applications in a given workspace. Even if the workspace and its applications get removed, developers can not create other applications with one of these IDs.

RESTRICT_SCHEMA.descriptionText: This procedure revokes the privilege to assign a schema to workspaces.

SET_LOG_SWITCH_INTERVAL.descriptionText: Set the log switch interval for each of the logs maintained by Application Express.

SET_PARAMETER.descriptionText: The SET_PARAMETER procedure sets a parameter used in administering a runtime environment. You must issue a commit for the parameter change to take affect.

SET_WORKSPACE_CONSUMER_GROUP.descriptionText: The SET_WORKSPACE_CONSUMER_GROUP procedure sets a Resource Manager Consumer Group to a workspace.

SET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER.bodyFullText:
SET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER(
    p_workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
    p_parameter     IN VARCHAR2,
    p_value         IN VARCHAR2 );
SET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER.descriptionText: The SET_WORKSPACE_PARAMETER procedure sets the designated workspace parameter.

TRUNCATE_LOG.descriptionText: The TRUNCATE_LOG procedure truncates the log entries specified by the input parameter.

UNRESTRICT_SCHEMA.descriptionText: This procedure re-grants the privilege to assign a schema to workspaces, if it has been revoked before.

ADD_LIBRARY.descriptionText: This procedure adds the script tag to load a JavaScript library. If a library has been added, it is not added a second time.

ADD_ONLOAD_CODE.descriptionText: This procedure adds a javascript code snippet to the HTML output which is executed by the onload event. If an entry with the same key exists it is ignored. If p_key is NULL the snippet is always added.

ADD_REQUIREJS.descriptionText: This procedure adds the script tag to load the RequireJS library.

ADD_REQUIREJS_DEFINE.descriptionText: This procedure adds a RequireJS define after RequireJS has been loaded to let it know about the existence of a library.

ESCAPE.descriptionText: This function escapes text to be used in JavaScript. This function uses APEX_ESCAPE.JS_LITERAL to escape characters and provide a reference to that other API.

CLOSE_ALL.descriptionText: This procedure closes all objects and arrays up to the outermost nesting level.

CLOSE_ARRAY.descriptionText: This procedure writes a close bracket symbol as follows:

CLOSE_OBJECT.descriptionText: This procedure writes a close curly bracket symbol as follows:

CREATE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING.bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.CREATE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2,
  p_translation_application_id IN NUMBER )
CREATE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING.descriptionText: Use this procedure to create the language mapping for the translation of an application. Translated applications are published as new applications, but are not directly editable in the App Builder.

DELETE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING.bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.DELETE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2 )
DELETE_LANGUAGE_MAPPING.descriptionText: Use this procedure to delete the language mapping for the translation of an application. This procedure deletes all translated strings in the translation repository for the specified language and mapping. Translated applications are published as new applications, but are not directly editable in the App Builder.

MESSAGE.descriptionText: Use this function to translate text strings (or messages) generated from PL/SQL stored procedures, functions, triggers, packaged procedures, and functions.

PUBLISH_APPLICATION.bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.PUBLISH_APPLICATION (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2 )
PUBLISH_APPLICATION.descriptionText: Use this procedure to publish the translated version of an application. This procedure creates an underlying, hidden replica of the primary application and merges the strings from the translation repository in this new application. Perform a seed and publish process each time you want to update the translated version of your application and synchronize it with the primary application.

SEED_TRANSLATIONS.bodyFullText:
APEX_LANG.SEED_TRANSLATIONS (
  p_application_id IN NUMBER,
  p_language IN VARCHAR2 )
SEED_TRANSLATIONS.descriptionText: Use this procedure to seed the translation repository for the specified application and language. This procedure populates the translation repository with all of the new, updated and removed translatable strings from your application. Perform a seed and publish process each time you want to update the translated version of your application and synchronize it with the primary application.

ADD_ATTACHMENT.bodyFullText:
APEX_MAIL.ADD_ATTACHMENT(
    p_mail_id                   IN    NUMBER,
    p_attachment                IN    BLOB,
    p_filename                  IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_mime_type                 IN    VARCHAR2);
ADD_ATTACHMENT.descriptionText: This procedure sends an outbound email message from an application as an attachment. To add multiple attachments to a single email, APEX_MAIL.ADD_ATTACHMENT can be called repeatedly for a single email message.

GET_IMAGES_URL.descriptionText: Use this function to get the image prefixed URL, if the email includes Application Express instance images.

GET_INSTANCE_URL.descriptionText: If an email includes a link to an Application Express instance, use this function to get the instance URL.

PUSH_QUEUE.descriptionText: Oracle Application Express stores unsent email messages in a table named APEX_MAIL_QUEUE. You can manually deliver mail messages stored in this queue to the specified SMTP gateway by invoking the APEX_MAIL.PUSH_QUEUE procedure.

SEND.bodyNoDefault:
p_to => $1
	, p_from => $2
	, p_body => $3
	, p_body_html => $4

	, p_cc => $6
	, p_bcc => $7
	, p_replyto => $8
SEND.bodyFullText:
APEX_MAIL.SEND(
    p_to                        IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_from                      IN    VARCHAR2,
    p_body                      IN  [ VARCHAR2 | CLOB ],
    p_body_html                 IN  [ VARCHAR2 | CLOB ] DEFAULT NULL,
    p_subj                      IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_cc                        IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_bcc                       IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_replyto                   IN    VARCHAR2);
SEND.descriptionText: This procedure sends an outbound email message from an application. Although you can use this procedure to pass in either a VARCHAR2 or a CLOB to p_body and p_body_html, the data types must be the same. In other words, you cannot pass a CLOB to P_BODY and a VARCHAR2 to p_body_html.

GET_PAGE_MODE.bodyFullText:

    p_page_id 
    RETURN VARCHAR2;

GET_UI_TYPE.descriptionText: This function returns the user interface (UI) type for which the current page has been designed.

p_application => $1
	, p_page => $2
	, p_session => $3

	, p_values => $8
	, p_printer_friendly => $9
	, p_trace => $10

GET_URL (
    p_application        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_page               IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_session            IN NUMBER   DEFAULT APEX.G_INSTANCE,
    p_request            IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_debug              IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_clear_cache        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_items              IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_values             IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_printer_friendly   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_trace              IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL )
    RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_URL.descriptionText: This function returns an Oracle Application Express f?p= URL. It is sometimes clearer to read a function call than a concatenated URL. See the example below for a comparison.

IS_DESKTOP_UI.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the current page has been designed for desktop browsers.

IS_JQM_SMARTPHONE_UI.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the current page has been designed for smartphone devices using jQuery Mobile.

IS_JQM_TABLET_UI.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the current page has been designed for tablet devices using jQuery Mobile.

IS_READ_ONLY.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the current page is rendered read-only and FALSE if it is not.

GET_AJAX_IDENTIFIER.descriptionText: This function returns the Ajax identifier used to call the Ajax callback function defined for the plug-in.

GET_INPUT_NAME_FOR_PAGE_ITEM.descriptionText: Use this function when you want to render an HTML input element in the rendering function of an item type plug-in.For the HTML input element, for example, <input type="text" id="P1_TEST" name="xxx">, you have to provide a value for the name attribute so that Oracle Application Express can map the submitted value to the actual page item in session state. This function returns the mapping name for your page item. If the HTML input element has multiple values, such as a select list with multiple="multiple", then set p_is_multi_value to TRUE.

CLEAR_COMPONENT_VALUES.descriptionText: This procedure clears the component specific Session State set by apex_plugin_util.set_component_values.

DEBUG_DYNAMIC_ACTION.descriptionText: This procedure writes the data of the dynamic action meta data to the debug output if debugging is enabled.

DEBUG_PAGE_ITEM.descriptionText: This procedure writes the data of the page item meta data to the debug output if debugging is enabled.

DEBUG_PROCESS.descriptionText: This procedure writes the data of the process meta data to the debug output if debugging is enabled.

DEBUG_REGION.descriptionText: This procedure writes the data of the region meta data to the debug output if debugging is enabled.

ESCAPE.bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.ESCAPE (
    p_value  IN VARCHAR2,
    p_escape IN BOOLEAN)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
ESCAPE.descriptionText: This function is used if you have checked the standard attribute "Has Escape Output Attribute" option for your item type plug-in which allows a developer to decide if the output should be escaped or not.

EXECUTE_PLSQL_CODE.descriptionText: This procedure executes a PL/SQL code block and performs binding of bind variables in the provided PL/SQL code. This procedure is usually used for plug-in attributes of type PL/SQL Code.

Use this function in plug-in PL/SQL source for custom attributes of type NUMBER instead of the built-in to_number function.

APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_DATA (
    p_sql_statement    IN VARCHAR2,
    p_min_columns      IN NUMBER,
    p_max_columns      IN NUMBER,
    p_component_name   IN VARCHAR2,
    p_search_type      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 2,
    p_search_column_no IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 2,
    p_search_string    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    p_first_row        IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
    p_max_rows         IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN t_column_value_list;
GET_DATA.descriptionText: Executes the specified SQL query restricted by the provided search string (optional) and returns the values for each column. All column values are returned as a string, independent of their data types. The search column is identified by providing a column number in the p_search_column_no parameter. This function takes into account character value comparison globalization attributes defined for the application.

This function takes into account character value comparison globalization attributes defines for the application.

GET_PLSQL_EXPRESSION_RESULT.descriptionText: This function executes a PL/SQL expression and returns a result. This function also performs the binding of any bind variables in the provided PL/SQL expression. This function is usually used for plug-in attributes of type PL/SQL Expression.

GET_PLSQL_FUNCTION_RESULT.descriptionText: This function executes a PL/SQL function block and returns the result. This function also performs binding of bind variables in the provided PL/SQL Function Body. This function is usually used for plug-in attributes of type PL/SQL Function Body.

    p_list IN apex_application_global.vc_arr2,
    p_value IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN NUMBER;
GET_POSITION_IN_LIST.descriptionText: This function returns the position in the list where p_value is stored. If it is not found, null is returned.

GET_SEARCH_STRING.bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.GET_SEARCH_STRING(
    p_search_type IN VARCHAR2,
    p_search_string IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_SEARCH_STRING.descriptionText: Based on the provided value in p_search_type the passed in value of p_search_string is returned unchanged or is converted to uppercase. Use this function with the p_search_string parameter of get_data and get_data2.

GET_VALUE_AS_VARCHAR2.bodyFullText:
get_value_as_varchar2 (
   p_data_type in varchar2,
   p_value in t_value,
   p_format_mask in varchar2 default null )
   return varchar2;
GET_VALUE_AS_VARCHAR2.descriptionText: This function can be used if you use GET_DATA2 to read the column values along with their original data types. It will convert and return the passed in p_value as VARCHAR2.

IS_EQUAL.bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.IS_EQUAL (
    p_value1 IN VARCHAR2
    p_value2 IN VARCHAR2)
RETURN BOOLEAN;
IS_EQUAL.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if both values are equal and FALSE if not. If both values are NULL, TRUE is returned.

PAGE_ITEM_NAMES_TO_JQUERY.descriptionText: This function returns a jQuery selector based on a comma delimited string of page item names. For example, you could use this function for a plug-in attribute called "Page Items to Submit" where the JavaScript code has to read the values of the specified page items.

PRINT_DISPLAY_ONLY.bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.PRINT_DISPLAY_ONLY (
    p_item_name        IN VARCHAR2,
    p_display_value    IN VARCHAR2,
    p_show_line_breaks IN BOOLEAN,
    p_attributes       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_id_postfix       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '_DISPLAY');
PRINT_DISPLAY_ONLY.descriptionText: This procedure outputs a SPAN tag for a display only field.

PRINT_ESCAPED_VALUE.descriptionText: This procedure outputs the value in an escaped form and chunks big strings into smaller outputs.

PRINT_HIDDEN_IF_READ_ONLY.bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.PRINT_HIDDEN_IF_READ_ONLY (
    p_item_name   IN VARCHAR2,
    p_value       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_is_readonly IN BOOLEAN,

    p_id_postfix  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
PRINT_HIDDEN_IF_READ_ONLY.descriptionText: This procedure outputs a hidden field to store the page item value if the page item is rendered as readonly and is not printer friendly. If this procedure is called in an item type plug-in, the parameters of the plug-in interface should directly be passed in.

PRINT_JSON_HTTP_HEADER.descriptionText: This procedure outputs a standard HTTP header for a JSON output.

    p_escape                IN BOOLEAN,
    p_replace_substitutions IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
PRINT_LOV_AS_JSON.descriptionText: This procedure outputs a JSON response based on the result of a two column LOV in the format:

PRINT_OPTION.bodyFullText:
APEX_PLUGIN_UTIL.PRINT_OPTION (
    p_display_value       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_return_value        IN VARCHAR2,
    p_is_selected         IN BOOLEAN,
    p_attributes          IN VARCHAR2,
    p_escape              IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
PRINT_OPTION.descriptionText: This procedure outputs an OPTION tag.

REPLACE_SUBSTITUTIONS.bodyFullText:
apex_plugin_util.replace_substitutions (
    p_value    in varchar2,
    p_escape   in boolean default true )
    return varchar2;
REPLACE_SUBSTITUTIONS.descriptionText: This function replaces any &ITEM. substitution references with their actual value. If p_escape is set to TRUE, any special characters contained in the value of the referenced item are escaped to prevent Cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

SET_COMPONENT_VALUES.descriptionText: This procedure extends Session State to include the column values of a specific row number. By doing so, columns can be referenced using substitution syntax or the V function in the same way as you can reference page or application items.

SET_DEBUG.descriptionText: This procedure sets debug level for all future requests in a session.

SET_TRACE.descriptionText: This procedure sets trace mode in all future requests of a session.

APEX_SPATIAL.CHANGE_GEOM_METADATA (

    p_column_name       IN VARCHAR2,

    p_diminfo           IN mdsys.sdo_dim_array,
    p_srid              IN t_srid );
CHANGE_GEOM_METADATA.descriptionText: This procedure modifies a spatial metadata record.

CIRCLE_POLYGON.bodyFullText:
APEX_SPATIAL.CIRCLE_POLYGON (
    p_lon        IN NUMBER,
    p_lat        IN NUMBER,
    p_radius     IN NUMBER,
    p_arc_tolerance  IN NUMBER DEFAULT 20,
    p_srid        IN t_srid DEFAULT c_wgs_84 )
RETURN mdsys.sdo_geometry;
CIRCLE_POLYGON.descriptionText: This function creates a polygon that approximates a circle at (p_lon, p_lat) with radius of p_radius. See mdsys.sdo_util.circle_polygon for details.

DELETE_GEOM_METADATA.bodyFullText:
APEX_SPATIAL.DELETE_GEOM_METADATA (
    p_table_name        IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_drop_index        IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE );
DELETE_GEOM_METADATA.descriptionText: This procedure deletes a spatial metadata record.

INSERT_GEOM_METADATA.bodyFullText:
APEX_SPATIAL.INSERT_GEOM_METADATA (
    p_table_name        IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_diminfo           in mdsys.sdo_dim_array,
    p_srid              in t_srid,
    p_create_index_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL );
INSERT_GEOM_METADATA.descriptionText: This procedure inserts a spatial metadata record and optionally creates a spatial index.

INSERT_GEOM_METADATA_LONLAT.bodyFullText:
APEX_SPATIAL.INSERT_GEOM_METADATA_LONLAT (

    p_column_name       IN VARCHAR2,
    p_tolerance         IN NUMBER DEFAULT 1,
    p_create_index_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL );
INSERT_GEOM_METADATA_LONLAT.descriptionText: This procedure inserts a spatial metadata record that is suitable for longitude/latitude and optionally creates a spatial index.

POINT.bodyFullText:
APEX_SPATIAL.POINT (
    p_lon        IN NUMBER,
    p_lat        IN NUMBER,
    p_srid       IN t_srid DEFAULT c_wgs_84 )
RETURN mdsys.sdo_geometry;
POINT.descriptionText: This function creates a point at (p_lon, p_lat).

RECTANGLE.bodyFullText:
APEX_SPATIAL.RECTANGLE (
    p_lon1        IN NUMBER,

    p_lon2        IN NUMBER,
    p_lat2        IN NUMBER,
    p_srid        IN t_srid DEFAULT c_wgs_84 )
RETURN mdsys.sdo_geometry;
RECTANGLE.descriptionText: This function creates a rectangle from point at (p_lon1, p_lat1) to (p_lon2, p_lat2).

GET_INITIALS.bodyFullText:
get_initials (
   p_str in varchar2,
   p_cnt in number default 2 )
   return varchar2
GET_INITIALS.descriptionText: Get N letter initials from the first N words.

GREP.bodyFullText:
grep (
   p_table         in apex_t_varchar2,
   p_pattern       in varchar2,
   p_modifier      in varchar2    default null,
   p_subexpression in varchar2    default '0',
   p_limit         in pls_integer default null )
   return apex_t_varchar2;
GREP.descriptionText: Returns the values of the input table that match a regular expression.

JOIN.bodyFullText:
join (
   p_table in apex_t_varchar2,
   p_sep in varchar2 default apex_application.LF)
   return varchar2
JOIN.descriptionText: Returns the values of the apex_t_varchar2 input table p_table as a concatenated varchar2, separated by p_sep.

JOIN_CLOB.bodyFullText:
join_clob (
    p_table in apex_t_varchar2,
    p_sep   in varchar2    default apex_application.LF,
    p_dur   in pls_integer default sys.dbms_lob.call )
    return clob
JOIN_CLOB.descriptionText: Returns the values of the apex_t_varchar2 input table p_table as a concatenated clob, separated by p_sep.

PLIST_DELETE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the property list key from the table, by setting it to null.

PLIST_GET.bodyFullText:
plist_get (
     p_table in apex_t_varchar2,
     p_key in varchar2 )
     return varchar2
PLIST_GET.descriptionText: This function gets the property list value for a key.

PLIST_PUT.bodyFullText:
plist_put (
     p_table in out nocopy apex_t_varchar2,
     p_key   in varchar2,
     p_value in varchar2 );
PLIST_PUT.descriptionText: This function inserts or updates property list value for a key.

PUSH.descriptionText: This procedure appends value to apex_t_varchar2 table.

SHUFFLE.descriptionText: Returns the input table values, re-ordered.

SPLIT.bodyFullText:
split (
    p_str   in varchar2,
    p_sep   in varchar2 default apex_application.LF,
    p_limit in pls_integer default null )
    return apex_t_varchar2;
SPLIT.descriptionText: Use this function to split input string at separator.

SPLIT_NUMBERS.bodyFullText:
split_numbers (
     p_str in varchar2,
     p_sep in varchar2 default apex_application.LF )
     return apex_t_number;
SPLIT_NUMBERS.descriptionText: Use this function to split input at separator, values must all be numbers.

CLEAR_ALL_USERS_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure clears all theme style user preferences for an application and theme.

CLEAR_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure clears the theme style user preference for user and application.

DISABLE_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure disables theme style selection by end users. End users will not be able to customize the theme style on their own. Note that this only affects the Customization link for end users. APEX_THEME API calls are independent.

ENABLE_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure enables theme style selection by end users. When enabled and there is at least one theme style marked as Public, end users will see a Customize link which allows to choose the theme style. End user theme style selection is enabled or disabled at the User Interface level. When providing a theme number, the theme must be the Current Theme for a user interface. Note that this only affects the Customization link for end users. APEX_THEME API calls are independent.

GET_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This function returns the theme style user preference for the user and application. If no user preference is present, NULL is returned.

SET_CURRENT_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets current theme style for the current application.

SET_SESSION_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the theme style dynamically for the current session. This is typically being called after successful authentication.

SET_SESSION_STYLE_CSS.descriptionText: This procedure sets the theme style CSS urls dynamically for the current session. Theme style CSS URLs are being directly passed in; a persistent style definition is not needed. This is typically being called after successful authentication.

SET_USER_STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure sets a theme style user preference for the current user and application. Theme Style User Preferences are automatically picked up and precede any style set with SET_SESSION_STYLE.

	, p_syn_name3 => $14
ADD_AD_COLUMN.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.ADD_AD_COLUMN (
    p_column_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_label                 IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_format_mask           IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_format_mask      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_width    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_height   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_data_type        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_format_mask    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_col_alignment  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name1             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name2             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_syn_name3             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
ADD_AD_COLUMN.descriptionText: Adds a User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary entry with the provided definition. Up to three synonyms can be provided during the creation. Additional synonyms can be added post-creation using apex_ui_default_update.add_ad_synonym. Synonyms share the column definition of their base column.

ADD_AD_SYNONYM.descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym provided is created and associated with that column. Synonyms share the column definition of their base column.

DEL_AD_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the column, along with any associated synonyms, is deleted.

DEL_AD_SYNONYM.descriptionText: If the synonym name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym name is deleted.

DEL_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the provided table and column exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it are deleted.

DEL_GROUP.descriptionText: If the provided table and group exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it are deleted and any column within the table that references that group has the group_id set to null.

DEL_TABLE.descriptionText: If the provided table exists within the use\'s schem\'s table based User Interface Defaults, the UI Defaults for it is deleted. This includes the deletion of any groups defined for the table and all the columns associated with the table.

SYNCH_TABLE.descriptionText: If the Table Based User Interface Defaults for the table do not already exist within the use\'s schema, they are defaulted. If they do exist, they are synchronized, meaning, the columns in the table is matched against the column in the UI Defaults Table Definitions. Additions and deletions are used to make them match.

UPD_AD_COLUMN.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_AD_COLUMN (
    p_column_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
    p_new_column_name       IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_label                 IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_format_mask           IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_format_mask      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_width    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_display_height   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_form_data_type        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_format_mask    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_report_col_alignment  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
UPD_AD_COLUMN.descriptionText: If the column name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the column entry is updated using the provided parameters. If\'null\' is passed in, the value of the associated parameter is set to null.

UPD_AD_SYNONYM.descriptionText: If the synonym name is found within the User Interface Default Attribute Dictionary, the synonym name is updated.

UPD_COLUMN.bodyFullText:
APEX_UI_DEFAULT_UPDATE.UPD_COLUMN (
    p_table_name            IN VARCHAR2,
    p_column_name           IN VARCHAR2,
    p_group_id              IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_label                 IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_help_text             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_in_form       IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_seq_form      IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_mask_form             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_default_value         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_required              IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_display_width         IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_max_width             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
    p_height                IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
