SET_TASK_PARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure modifies a user parameter within an Advisor task or a template. A user parameter is a simple variable that stores various attributes that affect workload collection, tuning decisions and reporting.

TUNE_MVIEW.descriptionText: This procedure shows how to decompose a materialized view into two or more materialized views and to restate the materialized view in a way that is more advantageous for fast refresh and query rewrite. It also shows how to fix materialized view logs and to enable query rewrite.

REGISTER.descriptionText: This procedure lets a session register interest in an alert.

REMOVE.descriptionText: This procedure enables a session that is no longer interested in an alert to remove that alert from its registration list. Removing an alert reduces the amount of work done by signalers of the alert.

REMOVEALL.descriptionText: This procedure removes all alerts for this session from the registration list. You should do this when the session is no longer interested in any alerts.

SET_DEFAULTS.descriptionText: In case a polling loop is required, use the SET_DEFAULTS procedure to set the polling interval.

SIGNAL.descriptionText: This procedure signals an alert. The effect of the SIGNAL call only occurs when the transaction in which it is made commits. If the transaction rolls back, SIGNAL has no effect.

WAITANY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_ALERT.WAITANY (
   name      OUT  VARCHAR2,
   message   OUT  VARCHAR2,
   status    OUT  INTEGER,
   timeout   IN   NUMBER DEFAULT MAXWAIT);
WAITANY.descriptionText: Call this procedure to wait for an alert to occur for any of the alerts for which the current session is registered.

WAITONE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_ALERT.WAITONE (
   name      IN   VARCHAR2,
   message   OUT  VARCHAR2,
   status    OUT  INTEGER,
   timeout   IN   NUMBER DEFAULT MAXWAIT);
WAITONE.descriptionText: This procedure waits for a specific alert to occur. An implicit COMMIT is issued before this procedure is executed. A session that is the first to signal an alert can also wait for the alert in a subsequent transaction. In this case, remember to commit after the signal and before the wait; otherwise, DBMS_LOCK.REQUEST (which is called by DBMS_ALERT) returns status 4.

GET_LTXID_OUTCOME.bodyFullText:

 client_ltxid          IN    RAW, 
 committed             OUT   BOOLEAN, 
 user_call_completed   OUT   BOOLEAN)
GET_LTXID_OUTCOME.descriptionText: This procedure lets customer applications and third party application servers determine the transactional status of the last session when that session becomes unavailable.

READ_CLIENT_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure reads the value of the client_info field of the current session.

READ_MODULE.descriptionText: This procedure reads the values of the module and action fields of the current session.

SET_ACTION.descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the current action within the current module.

SET_CLIENT_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure supplies additional information about the client application.

SET_MODULE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the name of the current application or module.

Some Oracle functions, such as parallel execution and Server Managed Recovery, use rows in this view to indicate the status of, for example, a database backup.

COMPARE_OLD_VALUES.descriptionText: This procedure specifies whether to compare the old values of one or more columns in a row logical change record (row LCR) with the current values of the corresponding columns at the destination site during apply. This procedure is relevant only for UPDATE and DELETE operations because only these operations result in old column values in row LCRs. The default is to compare old values for all columns.

DROP_OBJECT_DEPENDENCY.descriptionText: This procedure drops an object dependency. An object dependency is a virtual dependency definition that defines a parent-child relationship between two objects at a destination database.

EXECUTE_ALL_ERRORS.descriptionText: This procedure reexecutes the error transactions in the error queue for the specified apply component.

SET_EXECUTE.descriptionText: This procedure specifies whether a message that satisfies the specified rule is executed by an apply component.

This procedure overwrites any existing instantiation SCN for the database, and, if it sets the instantiation SCN for a schema or a table, then it overwrites any existing instantiation SCN for the schema or table.

STOP_APPLY.descriptionText: This procedure stops the apply component from applying messages and rolls back any unfinished transactions being applied.

ENQUEUE_ARRAY.descriptionText: This function enqueues an array of payloads using a corresponding array of message properties. The output will be an array of message IDs of the enqueued messages.

LISTEN.descriptionText: This procedure listens on one or more queues on behalf of a list of agents. The address field of the agent indicates the queue the agent wants to monitor. Only local queues are supported as addresses. Protocol is reserved for future use.

PLSQLCALLBACK.bodyFullText:
plsqlcallback(
  context  IN  RAW, 
  reginfo  IN  SYS.AQ$_REG_INFO, 
  descr    IN  SYS.AQ$_DESCRIPTOR, 
  payload  IN  RAW,
  payloadl IN  NUMBER);

POST.descriptionText: This procedure posts to a list of anonymous subscriptions that allows all clients who are registered for the subscriptions to get notifications.

REGISTER.descriptionText: This procedure registers an e-mail address, user-defined PL/SQL procedure, or HTTP URL for message notification.

UNBIND_AGENT.descriptionText: This procedure removes the entry for an Oracle Database Advanced Queuing agent from the LDAP server.

UNREGISTER.descriptionText: This procedure unregisters a subscription which turns off notifications.

ADD_ALIAS_TO_LDAP.descriptionText: This procedure creates an alias for a queue, agent, or a JMS ConnectionFactory in LDAP. The alias will be placed directly under the database serve\'s distinguished name in LDAP hierarchy.

ADD_SUBSCRIBER.bodyNoDefault:
queue_name => $1
	, subscriber => $2
	, rule => $3
	, transformation => $4
	, queue_to_queue => $5
	, delivery_mode => $6
ADD_SUBSCRIBER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ADD_SUBSCRIBER (
   queue_name      IN    VARCHAR2,
   subscriber      IN    sys.aq$_agent,
   rule            IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   transformation  IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL
   queue_to_queue  IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   delivery_mode   IN    PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT DBMS_AQADM.PERSISTENT);
ADD_SUBSCRIBER.descriptionText: This procedure adds a default subscriber to a queue.

ALTER_AQ_AGENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ALTER_AQ_AGENT (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2,
  certificate_location      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
  enable_http               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  enable_smtp               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  enable_anyp               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE )
ALTER_AQ_AGENT.descriptionText: This procedure alters an agent registered for Oracle Database Advanced Queuing Internet access. It is also used to alter an Oracle Database Advanced Queuing agent that accesses secure queues.

ALTER_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.bodyNoDefault:
queue_name => $1
	, destination => $2
	, duration => $3
	, next_time => $4
	, latency => $5
	, destination_queue => $6
ALTER_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ALTER_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE ( 
   queue_name           IN    VARCHAR2, 
   destination          IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   duration             IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL, 
   next_time            IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   latency              IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT 60,
   destination_queue    IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
ALTER_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.descriptionText: This procedure alters parameters for a propagation schedule.

ALTER_QUEUE.bodyNoDefault:
queue_name => $1
	, max_retries => $2
	, retry_delay => $3
	, retention_time => $4
	, auto_commit => $5
	, comment => $6
ALTER_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ALTER_QUEUE (
   queue_name        IN    VARCHAR2,
   max_retries       IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
   retry_delay       IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
   retention_time    IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_commit       IN    BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE,
   comment           IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
ALTER_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure alters existing properties of a queue. The parameters max_retries, retention_time, and retry_delay are not supported for nonpersistent queues.

ALTER_QUEUE_TABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ALTER_QUEUE_TABLE (
   queue_table          IN   VARCHAR2, 
   comment              IN   VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL,
   primary_instance     IN   BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL, 
   secondary_instance   IN   BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
ALTER_QUEUE_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure alters the existing properties of a queue table.

ALTER_SUBSCRIBER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ALTER_SUBSCRIBER (
   queue_name     IN    VARCHAR2,
   subscriber     IN    sys.aq$_agent,
   rule           IN    VARCHAR2
   transformation IN    VARCHAR2);
ALTER_SUBSCRIBER.descriptionText: This procedure alters existing properties of a subscriber to a specified queue. Only the rule can be altered.

CREATE_AQ_AGENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.CREATE_AQ_AGENT (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2,
  certificate_location      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
  enable_http               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  enable_smtp               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
  enable_anyp               IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE )
CREATE_AQ_AGENT.descriptionText: This procedure registers an agent for Oracle Database Advanced Queuing Internet access using HTTP/SMTP protocols. It is also used to create an Oracle Database Advanced Queuing agent to access secure queues.

CREATE_NP_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.CREATE_NP_QUEUE ( 
   queue_name              IN        VARCHAR2, 
   multiple_consumers      IN        BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE, 
   comment                 IN        VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CREATE_NP_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a nonpersistent RAW queue.

CREATE_QUEUE.bodyNoDefault:
queue_name => $1
	, queue_table => $2
	, queue_type => $3
	, max_retries => $4
	, retry_delay => $5
	, retention_time => $6
	, dependency_tracking => $7
	, comment => $8
	, auto_commit => $9
CREATE_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.CREATE_QUEUE (
   queue_name          IN       VARCHAR2,
   queue_table         IN       VARCHAR2,
   queue_type          IN       BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NORMAL_QUEUE,
   max_retries         IN       NUMBER         DEFAULT NULL,
   retry_delay         IN       NUMBER         DEFAULT 0,
   retention_time      IN       NUMBER         DEFAULT 0,
   dependency_tracking IN       BOOLEAN        DEFAULT FALSE,
   comment             IN       VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_commit         IN       BOOLEAN        DEFAULT TRUE);
CREATE_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a queue in the specified queue table.

CREATE_QUEUE_TABLE.bodyNoDefault:
queue_table => $1
	, queue_payload_type => $2
	, storage_clause => $3
	, sort_list => $4
	, multiple_consumers => $5
	, message_grouping => $6
	, comment => $7
	, auto_commit => $8
	, primary_instance => $9
	, secondary_instance => $10
	, compatible => $11
	, secure => $12
CREATE_QUEUE_TABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.CREATE_QUEUE_TABLE (
   queue_table          IN      VARCHAR2,
   queue_payload_type   IN      VARCHAR2,
   storage_clause       IN      VARCHAR2        DEFAULT NULL,
   sort_list            IN      VARCHAR2        DEFAULT NULL,
   multiple_consumers   IN      BOOLEAN         DEFAULT FALSE,
   message_grouping     IN      BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NONE,
   comment              IN      VARCHAR2        DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_commit          IN      BOOLEAN         DEFAULT TRUE,
   primary_instance     IN      BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT 0, 
   secondary_instance   IN      BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT 0,
   compatible           IN      VARCHAR2        DEFAULT NULL,
   secure               IN      BOOLEAN         DEFAULT FALSE);
CREATE_QUEUE_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a queue table for messages of a predefined type.

CREATE_SHARDED_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
CREATE_SHARDED_QUEUE (
    queue_name             IN VARCHAR2,
    storage_clause         IN VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL,
    multiple_consumers     IN BOOLEAN        DEFAULT FALSE,
    max_retries            IN NUMBER         DEFAULT NULL,
    comment                IN VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL);
CREATE_SHARDED_QUEUE.descriptionText: CREATE_SHARDED_QUEUE is a new API in 12c Release 1 (12.1) to create a queue and its queue table as appropriate for a JMS sharded queue. This API cannot be used to create unsharded queues. JMS sharded queues must be created using this single integrated API that will automatically set AQ properties as needed for JMS.

DISABLE_DB_ACCESS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DISABLE_DB_ACCESS (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2,
  db_username               IN VARCHAR2)
DISABLE_DB_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure revokes the privileges of a specific database user from an Oracle Database Advanced Queuing Internet agent.

DISABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DISABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE ( 
   queue_name            IN   VARCHAR2, 
   destination           IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   destination_queue  IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
DISABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.descriptionText: This procedure disables a propagation schedule.

DROP_AQ_AGENT.descriptionText: This procedure drops an agent that was previously registered for Oracle Database Advanced Queuing Internet access.

DROP_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure drops an existing queue.

DROP_QUEUE_TABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DROP_QUEUE_TABLE (
   queue_table       IN    VARCHAR2,
   force             IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit       IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
DROP_QUEUE_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure drops an existing queue table.

DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE( 
       queue_name IN VARCHAR2, 
       force      IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE )
DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure drops an existing sharded queue from the database queuing system. You must stop the queue before calling DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE. User must stop the queue explicitly if force is set to FALSE before calling DROP_SHARDED_QUEUE. If force is set to TRUE then queue will be stopped internally and then dropped.

ENABLE_DB_ACCESS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ENABLE_DB_ACCESS (
  agent_name                IN VARCHAR2,
  db_username               IN VARCHAR2)
ENABLE_DB_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure grants an Oracle Database Advanced Queuing Internet agent the privileges of a specific database user.

ENABLE_JMS_TYPES.descriptionText: Enqueue of JMS types and XML types does not work with Oracle Streams Sys.Anydata queues unless you call this procedure after DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.SET_UP_QUEUE. Enabling an Oracle Streams queue for these types may affect import/export of the queue table.

ENABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.ENABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE ( 
   queue_name         IN   VARCHAR2, 
   destination        IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   destination_queue  IN   VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
ENABLE_PROPAGATION_SCHEDULE.descriptionText: This procedure enables a previously disabled propagation schedule.

GET_MAX_STREAMS_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the value of Oracle Database Advanced Queuing maximum streams pool memory limit.

GET_MIN_STREAMS_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the value of Oracle Database Advanced Queuing minimum streams pool memory limit.

GET_WATERMARK.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the value of watermark set by SET_WATERMARK.

GRANT_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GRANT_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE (
   privilege        IN    VARCHAR2,
   queue_name       IN    VARCHAR2,
   grantee          IN    VARCHAR2,
   grant_option     IN    BOOLEAN := FALSE);
GRANT_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure grants privileges on a queue to users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE or DEQUEUE. Initially, only the queue table owner can use this procedure to grant privileges on the queues.

GRANT_SYSTEM_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.GRANT_SYSTEM_PRIVILEGE (
   privilege         IN    VARCHAR2,
   grantee           IN    VARCHAR2,
   admin_option      IN    BOOLEAN := FALSE);
GRANT_SYSTEM_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure grants Oracle Database Advanced Queuing system privileges to users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE_ANY, DEQUEUE_ANY, and MANAGE_ANY. Initially, only SYS and SYSTEM can use this procedure successfully.

MIGRATE_QUEUE_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure upgrades an 8.0-compatible queue table to an 8.1-compatible or higher queue table, or downgrades an 8.1-compatible or higher queue table to an 8.0-compatible queue table.

PURGE_QUEUE_TABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.PURGE_QUEUE_TABLE(
   queue_table        IN   VARCHAR2,
   purge_condition    IN   VARCHAR2,
   purge_options      IN   aq$_purge_options_t);
PURGE_QUEUE_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure purges messages from queue tables. You can perform various purge operations on both single-consumer and multiconsumer queue tables for persistent and buffered messages.

QUEUE_SUBSCRIBERS.descriptionText: This function returns the subscribers to an 8.0-compatible multiconsumer queue in the PL/SQL index by table collection type DBMS_AQADM.AQ$_subscriber_list_t. Each element of the collection is of type sys.aq$_agent. This functionality is provided for 8.1-compatible queues by the AQ$queue_table_name_S view.

REMOVE_SUBSCRIBER.descriptionText: This procedure removes a default subscriber from a queue. This operation takes effect immediately, and the containing transaction is committed. All references to the subscriber in existing messages are removed as part of the operation.

REVOKE_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.REVOKE_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE (
   privilege         IN      VARCHAR2,
   queue_name        IN      VARCHAR2,
   grantee           IN      VARCHAR2);
REVOKE_QUEUE_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure revokes privileges on a queue from users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE or DEQUEUE.

REVOKE_SYSTEM_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure revokes Oracle Database Advanced Queuing system privileges from users and roles. The privileges are ENQUEUE_ANY, DEQUEUE_ANY and MANAGE_ANY. The ADMIN option for a system privilege cannot be selectively revoked.

SCHEDULE_PROPAGATION.bodyNoDefault:
queue_name => $1
	, destination => $2
	, start_time => $3
	, duration => $4
	, next_time => $5
	, latency => $6
	, destination_queue => $7
SCHEDULE_PROPAGATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.SCHEDULE_PROPAGATION (
   queue_name          IN    VARCHAR2,
   destination         IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   start_time          IN    DATE     DEFAULT SYSDATE,
   duration            IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
   next_time           IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   latency             IN    NUMBER   DEFAULT 60,
   destination_queue   IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
SCHEDULE_PROPAGATION.descriptionText: This procedure schedules propagation of messages from a queue to a destination identified by a specific database link.

SET_MAX_STREAMS_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure is used for Oracle Database Advanced Queuing to specify and limit maximum streams pool memory use.

SET_MIN_STREAMS_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure is used for Oracle Database AQ to specify and limit minimum streams pool memory use.

SET_WATERMARK.descriptionText: This procedure is used for Oracle Database Advanced Queuing notification to specify and limit memory use.

START_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.START_QUEUE ( 
   queue_name      IN     VARCHAR2,
   enqueue         IN     BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   dequeue         IN     BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
START_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure enables the specified queue for enqueuing or dequeuing.

STOP_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.STOP_QUEUE (   
   queue_name      IN   VARCHAR2,
   enqueue         IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   dequeue         IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   wait            IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
STOP_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure disables enqueuing or dequeuing on the specified queue.

UNSCHEDULE_PROPAGATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.UNSCHEDULE_PROPAGATION (
   queue_name         IN  VARCHAR2,
   destination        IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL
   destination_queue  IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
UNSCHEDULE_PROPAGATION.descriptionText: This procedure unschedules previously scheduled propagation of messages from a queue to a destination identified by a specific database link.

VERIFY_QUEUE_TYPES.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AQADM.VERIFY_QUEUE_TYPES (
   src_queue_name    IN    VARCHAR2,
   dest_queue_name   IN    VARCHAR2,
   destination       IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   rc                OUT   BINARY_INTEGER);
VERIFY_QUEUE_TYPES.descriptionText: This procedure verifies that the source and destination queues have identical types. The result of the verification is stored in the table sys.aq$_message_types, overwriting all previous output of this command.

SET_MAILHOST.descriptionText: This procedure sets the host name for the SMTP server. The database uses this SMTP server host name to send out e-mail notifications.

SET_MAILPORT.descriptionText: This procedure sets the port number for the SMTP server.

SET_SENDFROM.descriptionText: This procedure sets the sent-from e-mail address. This e-mail address is used in the sent-from field in all the e-mail notifications sent out by the database to the registered e-mail addresses.

ENQUOTE_LITERAL.descriptionText: This function adds leading and trailing single quotes to a string literal.

ENQUOTE_NAME.bodyFullText:
DBMS_ASSERT.ENQUOTE_NAME (
   str            VARCHAR2, 
   capitalize     BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
ENQUOTE_NAME.descriptionText: This function encloses the provided string within quotation marks. However, additional quotation marks are not added if the string is already in quotation marks. The quoted string is then checked to see if it is a valid identifier.

NOOP.descriptionText: This function returns the value without any checking.

QUALIFIED_SQL_NAME.descriptionText: This function verifies that the input string is a qualified SQL name.

SCHEMA_NAME.descriptionText: This function verifies that the input string is an existing schema name.

SIMPLE_SQL_NAME.descriptionText: This function verifies that the input string is a simple SQL name.

SQL_OBJECT_NAME.descriptionText: This function verifies that the input parameter string is a qualified SQL identifier of an existing SQL object.

CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL(
   audit_trail_type         IN PLS_INTEGER,
   use_last_arch_timestamp  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   container                IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT,
   database_id              IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   container_guid           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL.descriptionText: This procedure deletes audit trail records. The CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL procedure is usually called after the SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP Procedure has been used to set the last archived timestamp for the audit records.

CLEAR_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.CLEAR_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY(
   audit_trail_type        IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_property    IN PLS_INTEGER,
   use_default_values      IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE) ;
CLEAR_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY.descriptionText: This procedure clears the value for the audit trail property that is specified. Audit trail properties are set using the SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY Procedure.

CLEAR_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.CLEAR_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP(
   audit_trail_type         IN PLS_INTEGER,
   rac_instance_number      IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   container                IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT,
   database_id              IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   container_guid           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CLEAR_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.descriptionText: This procedure clears the timestamp set by the SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP Procedure.

CREATE_PURGE_JOB.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.CREATE_PURGE_JOB(
   audit_trail_type            IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_purge_interval  IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_purge_name      IN VARCHAR2,
   use_last_arch_timestamp     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   container                   IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT) ;
CREATE_PURGE_JOB.descriptionText: This procedure creates a purge job for periodically deleting the audit trail records.

DEINIT_CLEANUP.descriptionText: This procedure undoes the setup and initialization performed by the INIT_CLEANUP Procedure. The DEINIT_CLEANUP procedure clears the value of the default_cleanup_interval parameter. However, when used for audit tables, it does not move the audit trail tables back to their original tablespace.

DROP_OLD_UNIFIED_AUDIT_TABLES.descriptionText: This procedure drops old unified audit tables following the cloning of a pluggable database (PDB).

DROP_PURGE_JOB.descriptionText: This procedure drops the purge job created using the CREATE_PURGE_JOB Procedure. The name of the purge job is passed as an argument.

FLUSH_UNIFIED_AUDIT_TRAIL.descriptionText: This procedure writes the unified audit trail records in the SGA queue to disk.

GET_AUDIT_COMMIT_DELAY.descriptionText: This function returns the audit commit delay time as the number of seconds. audit commit delay time is the maximum time that it takes to COMMIT an audit record to the database audit trail. If it takes more time to COMMIT an audit record than defined by the audit commit delay time, then a copy of the audit record is written to the operating system (OS) audit trail.

GET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.GET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP(
   audit_trail_type         IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_property     IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN NUMBER;
GET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.descriptionText: This procedure returns the property value set by the SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY Procedure.

INIT_CLEANUP.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.INIT_CLEANUP(
   audit_trail_type          IN PLS_INTEGER,
   default_cleanup_interval  IN PLS_INTEGER
   container                 IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT);
INIT_CLEANUP.descriptionText: This procedure sets up the audit management infrastructure and a default cleanup interval for the audit trail records. If the audit trail tables are in the SYSTEM tablespace, then the procedure moves them to the SYSAUX tablespace. If you are using unified auditing, you do not need to run this procedure because the unified audit trail tables are in the SYSAUX tablespace by default. If you are not using unified auditing, refer to Oracle Database Upgrade Guide for documentation which references an environment without unified auditing.

IS_CLEANUP_INITIALIZED.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.IS_CLEANUP_INITIALIZED(
   audit_trail_type  IN PLS_INTEGER
   container         IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
IS_CLEANUP_INITIALIZED.descriptionText: This function checks to see if the INIT_CLEANUP Procedure has been run for an audit trail type. The IS_CLEANUP_INITIALIZED function returns TRUE if the procedure has already been run for the audit trail type. It returns FALSE if the procedure has not been run for the audit trail type.

LOAD_UNIFIED_AUDIT_FILES.descriptionText: This procedure loads the data from the spillover OS audit files in a unified audit trail into the designated unified audit trail tablespace.

SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_LOCATION.descriptionText: This procedure moves the audit trail tables from their current tablespace to a user-specified tablespace.

SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY(
   audit_trail_type            IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_property        IN PLS_INTEGER,
   audit_trail_property_value  IN PLS_INTEGER) ;
SET_AUDIT_TRAIL_PROPERTY.descriptionText: This procedure sets an audit trail property for the audit trail type that is specified.

SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.bodyNoDefault:
audit_trail_type => $1
	, last_archive_time => $2
	, rac_instance_number => $3
	, container => $4
	, database_id => $5
	, container_guid => $6
SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUDIT_MGMT.SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP(
   audit_trail_type         IN PLS_INTEGER,
   last_archive_time        IN TIMESTAMP,
   rac_instance_number      IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   container                IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT CONTAINER_CURRENT,
   database_id              IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   container_guid           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
SET_LAST_ARCHIVE_TIMESTAMP.descriptionText: This procedure sets a timestamp indicating when the audit records were last archived. The audit administrator provides the timestamp to be attached to the audit records. The CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL Procedure uses this timestamp to decide on the audit records to be deleted.

SET_PURGE_JOB_INTERVAL.descriptionText: This procedure sets the interval at which the CLEAN_AUDIT_TRAIL Procedure is called for the purge job specified. The purge job must have already been created using the CREATE_PURGE_JOB Procedure.

SET_PURGE_JOB_STATUS.descriptionText: This procedure enables or disables the specified purge job. The purge job must have already been created using the CREATE_PURGE_JOB Procedure.

FINISH_REPORT_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure ends the complete capture of SQL monitor data that was started with the START_REPORT_CAPTURE Procedure. This subprogram runs a last capture cycle immediately to capture any new data and then ends the per-minute complete capture.

REPORT_REPOSITORY_DETAIL.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_REPORT.REPORT_REPOSITORY_DETAIL (
   rid              IN NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL,
   type             IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'XML',
   base_path        IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURNS CLOB
REPORT_REPOSITORY_DETAIL.descriptionText: This procedure obtains the stored report for a given report ID in the specified format such as XML or HTML.

REPORT_REPOSITORY_DETAIL_XML.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_REPORT.REPORT_REPOSITORY_DETAIL_XML (
   rid              IN NUMBER    DEFAULT NULL,
   base_path        IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURNS XMLTYPE
REPORT_REPOSITORY_DETAIL_XML.descriptionText: This procedure obtains the stored XML report for a given report ID.

REPORT_REPOSITORY_LIST_XML.bodyNoDefault:
active_since => $1
	, active_upto => $2
	, snapshot_id => $3
	, dbid => $4
	, inst_id => $5
	, con_dbid => $6
	, session_id => $7
	, session_serial => $8
	, component_name => $9
	, key1 => $10
	, key2 => $11
	, key3 => $12
	, report_level => $13
	, base_path => $14
REPORT_REPOSITORY_LIST_XML.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_REPORT.REPORT_REPOSITORY_LIST_XML (
    active_since              IN DATE     DEFAULT NULL,
    active_upto               IN DATE     DEFAULT NULL,
    snapshot_id               IN NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
    dbid                      IN NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
    inst_id                   IN NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
    con_dbid                  IN NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
    session_id                IN NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
    session_serial            IN NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
    component_name            IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    key1                      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    key2                      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    key3                      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
    report_level              IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'TYPICAL',
    base_path                 IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURNS XMLTYPE
REPORT_REPOSITORY_LIST_XML.descriptionText: This procedure obtains an XML report of the list of SQL Monitor and Real-time ADDM data captured in AWR. The input parameters can be used to select and restrict which captured data will be included in the list report. All parameters are optional.

START_REPORT_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure captures SQL monitor data of any newly monitored SQLs every minute since the last run of the capture cycle, and stores it in AWR. Every capture cycle attempts to capture data for SQLs that are not currently executing or queued. This is a complete capture since data of all newly monitored SQLs is captured. It continues to run every minute until it is explicitly ended with the FINISH_REPORT_CAPTURE Procedure. In the case of a RAC system, the capture will start on each node of the cluster.

EXECUTE_AUTO_TUNING_TASK.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_SQLTUNE.EXECUTE_AUTO_TUNING_TASK(
   execution_name    IN VARCHAR2               := NULL,
   execution_params  IN dbms_advisor.argList   := NULL,
   execution_desc    IN VARCHAR2               := NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
 
DBMS_AUTO_SQLTUNE.EXECUTE_AUTO_TUNING_TASK(
   execution_name    IN VARCHAR2               := NULL,
   execution_params  IN dbms_advisor.argList   := NULL,
   execution_desc    IN VARCHAR2               := NULL);
EXECUTE_AUTO_TUNING_TASK.descriptionText: This function and procedure executes the Automatic SQL Tuning task (SYS_AUTO_SQL_TUNING_TASK). Both the function and the procedure run in the context of a new task execution. The difference is that the function returns that new execution name. Note that only SYS can invoke this subprogram.

REPORT_AUTO_TUNING_TASK.bodyNoDefault:
begin_exec => $1
	, end_exec => $2
	, type => $3
	, level => $4
	, section => $5
	, object_id => $6
	, result_limit => $7
REPORT_AUTO_TUNING_TASK.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_SQLTUNE.REPORT_AUTO_TUNING_TASK(
   begin_exec      IN   VARCHAR2   := NULL,
   end_exec        IN   VARCHAR2   := NULL,
   type            IN   VARCHAR2   := 'TEXT',
   level           IN   VARCHAR2   := 'TYPICAL',
   section         IN   VARCHAR2   := ALL,
   object_id       IN   NUMBER     := NULL,
   result_limit    IN   NUMBER     := NULL)
RETURN CLOB;
REPORT_AUTO_TUNING_TASK.descriptionText: This procedure displays the results of an Automatic SQL Tuning task.

SET_AUTO_TUNING_TASK_PARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure updates the value of a SQL tuning parameter of type VARCHAR2 or NUMBER as used for the reserved auto tuning task, SYS_AUTO_SQL_TUNING_TASK.

DISABLE.descriptionText: This procedure prevents AUTOTASK from executing any requests from a specified client or operation.

ENABLE.descriptionText: This procedure allows a previously disabled client, operation, target type, or individual target to be enabled under AUTOTASK control. Specifying the DEFERRED option postpones the effect of the call until the start of the next maintenance window. If IMMEDIATE option is specified the effect of this call is immediate  as long as there is a currently open maintenance window.

GET_CLIENT_ATTRIBUTES.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_TASK_ADMIN.GET_CLIENT_ATTRIBUTES(
   client_name        IN    VARCHAR2,   service_name       OUT   VARCHAR2,   window_group       OUT   VARCHAR2);
GET_CLIENT_ATTRIBUTES.descriptionText: This procedure returns values of select client attributes.

GET_P1_RESOURCES.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_TASK_ADMIN.GET_P1_RESOURCES(
   stats_group_pct     OUT   NUMBER,
   seg_group_pct       OUT   NUMBER,
   tune_group_pct      OUT   NUMBER,
   health_group_pct    OUT   NUMBER);
GET_P1_RESOURCES.descriptionText: This procedure returns percent of resources allocated to each AUTOTASK High Priority Consumer Group.

OVERRIDE_PRIORITY.descriptionText: This procedure is used to manually override task priority. This can be done at the client, operation or individual task level. This priority assignment is honored during the next maintenance window in which the named client is active. Specifically, setting the priority to URGENT causes a high priority job to be generated at the start of the maintenance window. Setting priority to CLEAR removes the override.

SET_CLIENT_SERVICE.descriptionText: This procedure associates an AUTOTASK Client with a specified Service.

SET_P1_RESOURCES.bodyFullText:
DBMS_AUTO_TASK_ADMIN.SET_P1_RESOURCES(
   stats_group_pct     OUT   NUMBER,
   seg_group_pct       OUT   NUMBER,
   tune_group_pct      OUT   NUMBER,
   health_group_pct    OUT   NUMBER);
SET_P1_RESOURCES.descriptionText: This procedure sets percentage-based resource allocation for each High Priority Consumer Group used by AUTOTASK Clients.

ANALYZE.descriptionText: This procedure generates optimizer statistics on a cube or a cube dimension. These statistics are used to generate some execution plans, as described in "Using DBMS_AW_STATS".

CLEAR.descriptionText: Clears the statistics generated by the ANALYZE Procedure.

ABORT_GLOBAL_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure reverses the effects of running the PREPARE_GLOBAL_INSTANTIATION, PREPARE_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION, and PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION procedures.

ABORT_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure reverses the effects of running the PREPARE_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION procedure. It also reverses the effects of running the PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION procedure on tables in the specified schema.

ABORT_SYNC_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure reverses the effects of running the PREPARE_SYNC_INSTANTIATION procedure. Specifically, this procedure removes data dictionary information related to the table instantiation.

ABORT_TABLE_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure reverses the effects of running the PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION procedure.

BUILD.descriptionText: This procedure extracts the data dictionary of the current database to the redo log and automatically specifies database supplemental logging by running the following SQL statement:

INCLUDE_EXTRA_ATTRIBUTE.bodyFullText:

   capture_name    IN  VARCHAR2,
   attribute_name  IN  VARCHAR2,
   include         IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE);
INCLUDE_EXTRA_ATTRIBUTE.descriptionText: This procedure includes or excludes an extra attribute in logical change records (LCRs) captured by the specified capture process or synchronous capture.

PREPARE_GLOBAL_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating all the tables in the database at another database and can enable supplemental logging for key columns or all columns in these tables. This procedure prepares the tables in the database for instantiation when a capture process will be used to capture changes to the tables in the database.

PREPARE_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.PREPARE_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION(
   schema_name           IN  VARCHAR2,
   supplemental_logging  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'KEYS',
   container             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
PREPARE_SCHEMA_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating all tables in the schema at another database and can enable supplemental logging for key columns or all columns in these tables. This procedure prepares the tables in the schema for instantiation when a capture process will be used to capture changes to the tables in the schema.

PREPARE_SYNC_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This function performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating one or more tables at another database. This function returns the prepare system change number (SCN) for the table or tables being prepared for instantiation.

PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION(
   table_name            IN  VARCHAR2,
   supplemental_logging  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'KEYS',
   container             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
PREPARE_TABLE_INSTANTIATION.descriptionText: This procedure performs the synchronization necessary for instantiating the table at another database and can enable supplemental logging for key columns or all columns in the table. This procedure prepares the table for instantiation when a capture process will be used to capture changes to the table.

SET_PARAMETER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CAPTURE_ADM.SET_PARAMETER(

   parameter     IN  VARCHAR2,
   value         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
SET_PARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure sets a capture process parameter to the specified value.

START_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure starts the capture process, which mines redo logs and enqueues the mined redo information into the associated queue.

STOP_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure stops the capture process from mining redo logs.

CONFIGURE_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure configures the pool with advanced options.

RESTORE_DEFAULTS.descriptionText: This procedure restores the pool to default settings.

START_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure starts the pool for operations. It is only after this call that the pool could be used by connection classes for creating sessions.

STOP_POOL.descriptionText: This procedure stops the pool and makes it unavailable for the registered connection classes.

CQ_NOTIFICATION_QUERYID.descriptionText: This function returns the queryid of the most recent query that was attempted to be registered in a registration block.

DEREGISTER.descriptionText: This procedure desubscribes the client with the specified registration identifier (ID).

ENABLE_REG.descriptionText: This procedure adds objects to an existing registration identifier (ID). It is similar to the interface for creating a new registration, except that it takes an existing regid to which to add objects.Subsequent execution of queries causes the objects referenced in the queries to be added to the specified regid, and the registration is completed on invoking the REG_END Procedure.

NEW_REG_START.descriptionText: This procedure begins a new registration block. Any objects referenced by queries executed within the registration block are considered interesting objects and added to the registration. The registration block ends upon calling the REG_END procedure.

REG_END.descriptionText: This procedure marks the end of the registration block. No newly executed queries are tracked.

SET_ROWID_THRESHOLD.descriptionText: This procedure configures the maximum number of rows of a table published in a change notification if the rows of the table are modified in a transaction.

 RETURN RAW;

   src IN RAW,

HASH.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.Hash (
   src IN RAW,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.Hash (
   src IN BLOB,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.Hash (
   src IN CLOB CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER)
 RETURN RAW;
HASH.descriptionText: A one-way hash function takes a variable-length input string, the data, and converts it to a fixed-length (generally smaller) output string called a hash value. The hash value serves as a unique identifier (like a fingerprint) of the input data. You can use the hash value to verify whether data has been changed or not.

MAC.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CRYPTO.MAC (
   src IN RAW,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER,
   key IN RAW)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.MAC (
   src IN BLOB,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER
   key IN RAW)
 RETURN RAW;

DBMS_CRYPTO.MAC (
   src IN CLOB CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   typ IN PLS_INTEGER
   key IN RAW)
 RETURN RAW;
MAC.descriptionText: A Message Authentication Code, or MAC, is a key-dependent one-way hash function. MACs have the same properties as the one-way hash function described in "HASH Function", but they also include a key. Only someone with the identical key can verify the hash. Also refer to "When to Use Hash or Message Authentication Code (MAC) Functions" for more information about using MACs.

RANDOMBYTES.descriptionText: This function returns a RAW value containing a cryptographically secure pseudo-random sequence of bytes, which can be used to generate random material for encryption keys. The RANDOMBYTES function is based on the RSA X9.31 PRNG (Pseudo-Random Number Generator).

RANDOMINTEGER.descriptionText: This function returns an integer in the complete range available for the Oracle BINARY_INTEGER datatype.

RANDOMNUMBER.descriptionText: This function returns an integer in the Oracle NUMBER datatype in the range of [0..2**128-1].

       nested                IN  BOOLEAN         DEFAULT FALSE);

BUILD.descriptionText: This procedure loads data into one or more cubes and dimensions, and generates aggregate values in the cubes. The results are automatically committed to the database.

          preserve_table_owners  IN      BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
          metadata_changes       IN      CLOB      DEFAULT NULL);
CREATE_EXPORT_OPTIONS.descriptionText: This procedure creates an input XML document that describes processing options for the EXPORT_XML Procedure and the EXPORT_XML_TO_FILE Procedure.

CREATE_IMPORT_OPTIONS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE.CREATE_IMPORT_OPTIONS (
          out_options_xml  IN/OUT  CLOB,
          validate_only    IN      BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
          rename_table     IN      VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
CREATE_IMPORT_OPTIONS.descriptionText: This procedure creates an input XML document that describes processing options for the IMPORT_XML Procedure.

CREATE_MVIEW.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE.CREATE_MVIEW (
          mvowner        IN  VARCHAR2,
          mvname         IN  VARCHAR2,
          sam_parameters IN  CLOB  DEFAULT NULL)
     RETURN VARCHAR2;
CREATE_MVIEW.descriptionText: This function creates a cube materialized view from the definition of a relational materialized view.

DERIVE_FROM_MVIEW.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE.DERIVE_FROM_MVIEW (
          mvowner        IN  VARCHAR2,
          mvname         IN  VARCHAR2,
          sam_parameters IN  CLOB  DEFAULT NULL)
     RETURN CLOB;
DERIVE_FROM_MVIEW.descriptionText: This function generates an XML template that defines a cube with materialized view capabilities, using the information derived from an existing relational materialized view.

DROP_MVIEW.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE.DROP_MVIEW (
          mvowner        IN  VARCHAR2,
          mvname         IN  VARCHAR2,
          sam_parameters IN  CLOB  DEFAULT NULL);
DROP_MVIEW.descriptionText: This procedure drops a cube materialized view and all associated objects from the database. These objects include the dimension materialized views, cubes, cube dimensions, levels, hierarchies, and the analytic workspace.

EXPORT_XML_TO_FILE.descriptionText: This procedure exports OLAP metadata to a file. This file can be imported into a new or existing analytic workspace using the IMPORT_XML procedure. In this way, you can create a copy of the analytic workspace in another schema or database.

IMPORT_XML.bodyFullText:

DBMS_CUBE.IMPORT_XML

DBMS_CUBE.IMPORT_XML

DBMS_CUBE.IMPORT_XML

IMPORT_XML.descriptionText: This procedure creates, modifies, or drops an analytic workspace by using an XML template.

INITIALIZE_CUBE_UPGRADE.descriptionText: This procedure processes analytic workspaces created in Oracle OLAP 10g so they can be used by Oracle OLAP 12c clients. It processes all analytic workspaces in the current schema. Run this procedure once for each schema in which there are 10g analytic workspaces.

DBMS_CUBE.REFRESH_MVIEW (
          mvowner              IN  VARCHAR2,
          mvname               IN  VARCHAR2,
          method               IN  VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL,
          refresh_after_errors IN  BOOLEAN        DEFAULT FALSE,

          scheduler_job        IN  VARCHAR2       DEFAULT NULL,
          sam_parameters       IN  CLOB           DEFAULT NULL,
          nested               IN  BOOLEAN        DEFAULT FALSE );
REFRESH_MVIEW.descriptionText: This procedure refreshes the data in a cube materialized view.

UPGRADE_AW.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE.UPGRADE_AW
       (sourceaw              IN  VARCHAR2,
        destaw                IN  VARCHAR2,
        upgoptions            IN  CLOB DEFAULT NULL);
UPGRADE_AW.descriptionText: This procedure creates an Oracle OLAP 12c analytic workspace from a copy of the metadata contained in an OLAP 10g analytic workspace. The original OLAP 10g analytic workspace is not affected and can exist at the same time and in the same schema as the OLAP 12c analytic workspace.

VALIDATE_XML.descriptionText: This procedure checks the XML to assure that it is valid without committing the results to the database. It does not create an analytic workspace.

MV_CUBE_ADVICE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_ADVISE.MV_CUBE_ADVICE (
          owner        IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT USER,
          mvname       IN  VARCHAR2,
          reqtype      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT '0',
          validate     IN  NUMBER    DEFAULT 0)
     RETURN COAD_ADVICE_T  PIPELINED;
MV_CUBE_ADVICE.descriptionText: This table function evaluates the metadata for a specified cube materialized view. It generates recommendations and returns them as a SQL result set. These SQL statements can be used to create constraints, SQL dimension objects, and materialized view logs that allow the broadest range of query rewrite transformations and log-based fast refresh of the cube materialized view.

SET_CNS_EXCEPTION_LOG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_ADVISE.SET_CNS_EXCEPTION_LOG (
       exceptlogtab     IN   VARCHAR2  DEFAULT user.EXCEPTIONS);
SET_CNS_EXCEPTION_LOG.descriptionText: This procedure identifies the name of an exception log used in validated constraints generated by MV_CUBE_ADVICE.

TRACE.descriptionText: This procedure turns on and off diagnostic messages to server output for the MV_CUBE_ADVICE function.

DEFAULT_NAME.descriptionText: This function returns the default table names of the various log types.

DISABLE.descriptionText: This procedure turns logging off for the duration of a session, unless logging is explicitly turned on again with the ENABLE procedure.

ENABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_LOG.ENABLE (
          LOG_TYPE       IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL,
          LOG_TARGET     IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL,
          LOG_LEVEL      IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL);

DBMS_CUBE_LOG.ENABLE (
          LOG_TYPE       IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL,
          LOG_TARGET     IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL,
          LOG_LEVEL      IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL, 
          LOG_LOCATION   IN     VARCHAR2        DEFAULT NULL);

DBMS_CUBE_LOG.ENABLE (
          LOG_TYPE       IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL,
          LOG_TARGET     IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL,
          LOG_LEVEL      IN     BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT NULL, 
          LOG_LOCATION   IN/OUT CLOB );
ENABLE.descriptionText: This procedure turns on logging for the duration of a session or until it is turned off using the DISABLE procedure.

FLUSH.descriptionText: This procedure forces all buffered messages to be written to the logs. The buffers are flushed automatically throughout a session, but manually flushing them before viewing the logs assures that you can view all of the messages.

GET_LOG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_LOG.GET_LOG (
          LOG_TYPE       IN   BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT TYPE_OPERATIONS,
          LOG_TARGET     IN   BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT TARGET_TABLE,
          LOG_LEVEL      OUT  BINARY_INTEGER,
          LOG_LOCATION   OUT  VARCHAR2 );
GET_LOG.descriptionText: This procedure returns the current settings for the level and location of a particular log.

GET_LOG_SPEC.descriptionText: This function retrieves a description of all active Cube Operations logs, Cube Rejected Records logs, and Cube Dimension Compile logs.

GET_PARAMETER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_LOG.GET_PARAMETER (
          LOG_TYPE       IN   BINARY_INTEGER,
          LOG_PARAMETER  IN   BINARY_INTEGER )
     RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
GET_PARAMETER.descriptionText: This function returns the current values of the options that control various aspects of logging. To set these options, use the SET_PARAMETER function.

LEVEL_HIGH.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the high verbosity level.

LEVEL_HIGHEST.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the highest verbosity level.

LEVEL_LOW.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the low verbosity level.

LEVEL_LOWEST.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the lowest verbosity level. This level logs the status of each command used to build the cube dimensions and cubes, the use of slave processes, and summary records.

LEVEL_MEDIUM.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the medium verbosity level.

SET_LOG_SPEC.descriptionText: This procedure sets all logging to the values specified in the input string.

SET_PARAMETER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_LOG.SET_PARAMETER (
          LOG_TYPE       IN   BINARY_INTEGER,
          LOG_PARAMETER  IN   BINARY_INTEGER,
          VALUE          IN   BINARY_INTEGER );
SET_PARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure sets options that control various aspects of logging. To obtain the current value of these options, use the GET_PARAMETER function.

TABLE_CREATE.descriptionText: This procedure creates the table targets for the OLAP logs. You must have the CREATE TABLE privilege to use this procedure.

TARGET_FILE.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of a file target in DBMS_CUBE_LOG subprograms.

TARGET_LOB.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of a LOB target.

TARGET_TABLE.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of a table target.

TARGET_TRACE.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of a trace file target.

TYPE_BUILD.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the Cube Build log.

TYPE_DIMENSION_COMPILE.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the Cube Dimension Compile log.

TYPE_OPERATIONS.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the Cube Operations log.

TYPE_REJECTED_RECORDS.descriptionText: This function returns the integer value of the cube Cube Rejected Records log.

VERSION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_CUBE_LOG.VERSION (
          LOG_TYPE       IN   BINARY_INTEGER  DEFAULT 1,
          TBLNAME        IN   VARCHAR2        DEFAULT NULL)
     RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
VERSION.descriptionText: This function returns the version number of a specific log table or the current version number of a specific log type.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_AI.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of an Attribute Importance model.

RETURN DM_CLUSTERS PIPELINED;

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_EM_COMP.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide details about the parameters of an Expectation Maximization model.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_EM_PROJ.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide statistics about the projections produced by an Expectation Maximization model.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_GLM.descriptionText: This table function returns the coefficient statistics for a Generalized Linear Model.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_GLOBAL.descriptionText: This table function returns statistics about the model as a whole. Global details are available for Generalized Linear Models, Association Rules, Singular Value Decomposition, and Expectation Maximization.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_KM.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a k-Means clustering model.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_NB.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a Naive Bayes model.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_NMF.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a Non-Negative Matrix Factorization model.

 RETURN DM_SVD_MATRIX_SET PIPELINED;
GET_MODEL_DETAILS_SVD.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a Singular Value Decomposition model.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_SVM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.GET_MODEL_DETAILS_SVM (
        model_name        VARCHAR2,
        reverse_coef      NUMBER DEFAULT 0)
 RETURN DM_SVM_LINEAR_COEFF_SET PIPELINED;
GET_MODEL_DETAILS_SVM.descriptionText: This table function returns a set of rows that provide the details of a linear Support Vector Machine (SVM) model. If invoked for nonlinear SVM, it returns ORA-40215.

GET_MODEL_DETAILS_XML.descriptionText: This function returns an XML object that provides the details of a Decision Tree model.

GET_MODEL_TRANSFORMATIONS.descriptionText: This function returns the transformation expressions embedded in the specified model.

GET_TRANSFORM_LIST.descriptionText: This procedure converts transformation expressions specified as DM_TRANSFORMS to a transformation list (TRANSFORM_LIST) that can be used in creating a model. DM_TRANSFORMS is returned by the GET_MODEL_TRANSFORMATIONS function.

IMPORT_MODEL.descriptionText: This procedure imports one or more data mining models. The procedure is overloaded. You can call it to import mining models from a dump file set, or you can call it to import a single mining model from a PMML document.

RANK_APPLY.descriptionText: This procedure ranks the results of an APPLY operation based on a top-N specification for predictive and descriptive model results. For classification models, you can provide a cost matrix as input, and obtain the ranked results with costs applied to the predictions.

REMOVE_COST_MATRIX.descriptionText: Removes the default scoring matrix from a classification model.

RENAME_MODEL.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.RENAME_MODEL (
     model_name            IN VARCHAR2,
     new_model_name        IN VARCHAR2,
     versioned_model_name  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
RENAME_MODEL.descriptionText: This procedure changes the name of the mining model indicated by model_name to the name that you specify as new_model_name. If a model with new_model_name already exists, then the procedure optionally renames new_model_name to versioned_model_name before renaming model_name to new_model_name.

GET_MODEL_SETTINGS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DATA_MINING.GET_MODEL_SETTINGS(
        MODEL_NAME IN VARCHAR2 
)
return TABLE

CREATE_BIN_CAT.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for categorical binning. The columns are described in Table 46-4.

CREATE_BIN_NUM.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for numerical binning. The columns are described in Table 46-6.

CREATE_CLIP.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for clipping or winsorizing to minimize the effect of outliers. The columns are described in Table 46-8.

CREATE_COL_REM.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for removing columns from the data table. The columns are described in Table 46-10.

CREATE_MISS_CAT.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for replacing categorical missing values. The columns are described in Table 46-12.

CREATE_MISS_NUM.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for replacing numerical missing values. The columns are described in Table 46-14.

CREATE_NORM_LIN.descriptionText: This procedure creates a transformation definition table for linear normalization. The columns are described in Table 46-16.

DESCRIBE_STACK.bodyFullText:

     data_table_name      IN  VARCHAR2,
     describe_list        OUT DESCRIBE_LIST,
     data_schema_name     IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
DESCRIBE_STACK.descriptionText: This procedure describes the columns of the data table after a list of transformations has been applied. Only the columns that are specified in the transformation list are transformed. The remaining columns in the data table are included in the output without changes.

GET_EXPRESSION.descriptionText: This function returns a row from a VARCHAR2 array that stores a transformation expression. The array is built by calls to the SET_EXPRESSION Procedure.

Only the columns that are specified in the definition table are transformed; the remaining columns from the data table are present in the view, but they are not changed.

XFORM_STACK.descriptionText: This procedure creates a view that implements the transformations specified by the stack. Only the columns and nested attributes that are specified in the stack are transformed. Any remaining columns and nested attributes from the data table appear in the view without changes.

   path           IN     VARCHAR2,

   operation      IN     VARCHAR2,
   principal      IN     VARCHAR2,

  RETURN  BOOLEAN;
CHECKACCESS.descriptionText: This function reports if the user (principal) can perform the specified operation on the given path. This enables verifying the validity of an operation without attempting to perform the operation. If CHECKACCESS returns 0, then the subprogram invoked to implement that operation should fail with an error.

   store_name  IN              VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
   principal   IN              VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL);
CREATEREFERENCE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a physical link, srcPath, to an already existing file system element, dstPath (such as file or directory). The resulting entry shares the same metadata structures as the value of the dstPath parameter, and so is similar to incrementing a reference count on the file system element. This is analogous to a UNIX file system hard link.

SETDEFAULTACL.descriptionText: This procedure sets the ACL parameter of the default context. This information can be inserted explicitly by way of argument into other method calls, allowing for a more fine-grained control.

SETDEFAULTASOF.descriptionText: This procedure sets the "as of" parameter of the default context. This information can be inserted explicitly by way of argument into other method calls, allowing for a more fine-grained control.

SETDEFAULTCONTEXT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.SETDEFAULTCONTEXT (
   principal    IN     VARCHAR2,
   owner        IN     VARCHAR2,
   acl          IN     VARCHAR2,
   asof         IN     TIMESTAMP);
SETDEFAULTCONTEXT.descriptionText: This procedure sets the default context. The information contained in the context can be inserted explicitly by way of arguments to the various method calls, allowing for fine-grained control over individual operations.

SETDEFAULTOWNER.descriptionText: This procedure sets the "owner" parameter of the default context. This information can be inserted explicitly by way of argument into other method calls, allowing for a more fine-grained control.

SETDEFAULTPRINCIPAL.descriptionText: This procedure sets the "principal" parameter of the default context. This information contained can be inserted explicitly by way of argument into other method calls, allowing for a more fine-grained control.

SETPATH.descriptionText: This procedure assigns a path name to a path item represented by contentID.

SETSTATS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT.SETSTATS (
   enable          IN    BOOLEAN,
   flush_time      IN    INTEGER,
   flush_count     IN    INTEGER);
SETSTATS.descriptionText: This procedure enables and disables statistics collection. The client can optionally control the flush settings by specifying non-NULL values for the time, count or both parameters.

SETTRACE.descriptionText: This procedure sets the DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT tracing severity to the given level, 0 being "off".

UNREGISTERSTORE.descriptionText: This procedure unregisters a previously registered store (invalidating all mount points associated with it).

CHECKACCESS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_SPI.CHECKACCESS (
   store_name     IN     VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   path           IN     VARCHAR2,
   pathtype       IN     INTEGER,
   operation      IN     VARCHAR2,
   principal      IN     VARCHAR2)
  RETURN  INTEGER;
CHECKACCESS.descriptionText: This function reports if the user (principal) can perform the specified operation on the given path. This enables verifying the validity of an operation without attempting to perform the operation. If CHECKACCESS returns 0, then the subprogram invoked to implement that operation should fail with an error.

	, srcPath => $2

	, ctx => $6
CREATELINK.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_SPI.CREATELINK (
   store_name    IN              VARCHAR2,
   srcPath       IN              VARCHAR2,
   dstPath       IN              VARCHAR2,
   properties    IN OUT NOCOPY   DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T,
   prop_flags    IN              INTEGER,
   ctx           IN              DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_CONTEXT_T);
CREATELINK.descriptionText: This procedure creates a physical link to an already existing file system element (such as file or directory). The resulting entry shares the same metadata structures as the value of the srcPath parameter, and so is similar to incrementing a reference count on the file system element. This is analogous to a UNIX file system hard link.

	, dstPath => $2

   srcPath       IN              VARCHAR2,
   dstPath       IN              VARCHAR2,
   properties    IN OUT NOCOPY   DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_PROPERTIES_T,
   prop_flags    IN              INTEGER,
   store_name    IN              VARCHAR2,
   ctx           IN              DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_CONTEXT_T);
CREATEREFERENCE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a new reference to the source file system element (such as a file, or directory). The resulting reference points to the source element but does not directly share metadata with the source element. This is analogous to a UNIX file system symbolic link.

   store_name     IN     VARCHAR2,
   path           IN     VARCHAR2,
   ctx            IN     DBMS_DBFS_CONTENT_CONTEXT_T);
UNLOCKPATH.descriptionText: This procedure unlocks path items that were previously locked with the LOCKPATH Procedure.

CLEANUPUNUSEDBACKUPFILES.descriptionText: This procedure removes files created on the external storage device that hold no currently used data in them.

CREATEBUCKET.descriptionText: This procedure creates an AWS bucket, associated with a store of type STORETYPE_AMAZONS3 into which the Hierarchical Store can then move data.

CREATESTORE.bodyNoDefault:
store_name => $1
	, store_type => $2
	, tbl_name => $3
	, tbs_name => $4
	, cache_size => $5
	, lob_cache_quota => $6
	, optimal_tarball_size => $7
	, schema_name => $8
CREATESTORE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_HS.CREATESTORE  (
   store_name              IN     VARCHAR2,
   store_type              IN     VARCHAR2,
   tbl_name                IN     VARCHAR2,
   tbs_name                IN     VARCHAR2,
   cache_size              IN     NUMBER,
   lob_cache_quota         IN     NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   optimal_tarball_size    IN     NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   schema_name             IN     VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CREATESTORE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a new hierarchical store store_name of type STORE_TYPE (STORETYPE_TAPE or STORETYPE_AMAZONS3) in schema schema_name (defaulting to current schema) under the ownership of the invoking session user.

DEREGSTORECOMMAND.descriptionText: This procedure removes a command that had been previously associated with a store through the REGISTERSTORECOMMAND Procedure.

DROPSTORE.descriptionText: This procedure deletes a previously created hierarchical store specified by name and owned by the invoking session user.

FLUSHCACHE.descriptionText: This procedure flushes out dirty contents from level-1 cache, which can be locked, to level-2 cache, thereby freeing-up space in level 1 cache.

GETSTOREPROPERTY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_HS.GETSTOREPROPERTY  (
   store_name      IN     VARCHAR2,
   property_name   IN     VARCHAR2,
   noexcp          IN     BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE) RETURN VARCHAR2;
GETSTOREPROPERTY.descriptionText: This function retrieves the values of a property.

RECONFIGCACHE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_HS.RECONFIGCACHE (
   store_name              IN    VARCHAR2,
   cache_size              IN    NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   lobcache_quota          IN    NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   optimal_tarball_size    IN    NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
RECONFIGCACHE.descriptionText: This procedure reconfigures the parameters of the database cache being used by the store.

REGISTERSTORECOMMAND.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_HS.REGISTERSTORECOMMAND (
   store_name      IN     VARCHAR2,
   message         IN     VARCHAR2,
   flags           IN     NUMBER);
REGISTERSTORECOMMAND.descriptionText: This procedure registers commands for a store with the Hierarchical Store. These commands are sent to the Media Manager for the external storage device associated with the store.

SENDCOMMAND.descriptionText: This procedure sends a command to be executed on the external storage devic\'s Media Manager.

SETSTOREPROPERTY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_HS.SETSTOREPROPERTY  (
   store_name      IN     VARCHAR2,
   property_name   IN     VARCHAR2,
   property_value  IN     VARCHAR2);
SETSTOREPROPERTY.descriptionText: This procedure stores properties of a store in the database as name-value pairs.

STOREPUSH.descriptionText: This procedure pushes locally staged data to the remote storage.

CREATEFILESYSTEM.descriptionText: This procedure creates a file system store.

CREATESTORE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DBFS_SFS.CREATESTORE  (
   store_name     IN     VARCHAR2,
   tbl_name       IN     VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   tbs_name       in     VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   use_bf         in     BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   stgopts        in     VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '');
CREATESTORE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a new DBFS SFS store owned by the invoking session user.

DROPFILESYSTEM.descriptionText: This procedure drops the DBFS SFS store, purging all dictionary information associated with the store, and dropping the underlying file system table.

INITFS.descriptionText: This procedure initialize a POSIX file system store. The table associated with the POSIX file system store store_name is truncated and reinitialized with a single "root" directory entry.

ALTER_COMPILE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.ALTER_COMPILE (
   type             VARCHAR2, 
   schema           VARCHAR2, 
   name             VARCHAR2
   reuse_settings   BOOLEAN := FALSE);
ALTER_COMPILE.descriptionText: This procedure is equivalent to the following SQL statement:

ALTER_TABLE_NOT_REFERENCEABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.ALTER_TABLE_NOT_REFERENCEABLE (
   table_name        IN           VARCHAR2,
   table_schema      IN  DEFAULT  NULL,
   affected_schema   IN  DEFAULT  NULL);
ALTER_TABLE_NOT_REFERENCEABLE.descriptionText: This procedure alters the given object table table_schema.table_name so it becomes not the default referenceable table for the schema affected_schema. This is equivalent to SQL

ALTER_TABLE_REFERENCEABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.ALTER_TABLE_REFERENCEABLE
   table_name       IN  VARCHAR2,
   table_schema     IN  DEFAULT  NULL,
   affected_schema  IN  DEFAULT  NULL);
ALTER_TABLE_REFERENCEABLE.descriptionText: This procedure alters the given object table table_schema.table_name so it becomes the referenceable table for the given schema affected_schema. This is equivalent to SQL

CREATE_WRAPPED.descriptionText: The procedure takes as input a single CREATE OR REPLACE statement that specifies creation of a PL/SQL package specification, package body, function, procedure, type specification or type body. It then generates a CREATE OR REPLACE statement with the PL/SQL source text obfuscated and executes the generated statement. In effect, this procedure bundles together the operations of wrapping the text and creating the PL/SQL unit.

IS_TRIGGER_FIRE_ONCE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.IS_TRIGGER_FIRE_ONCE
   trig_owner         IN  VARCHAR2,
   trig_name          IN  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
IS_TRIGGER_FIRE_ONCE.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if the specified DML or DDL trigger is set to fire once. Otherwise, it returns FALSE.

SET_TRIGGER_FIRING_PROPERTY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.SET_TRIGGER_FIRING_PROPERTY (
   trig_owner         IN  VARCHAR2,
   trig_name          IN  VARCHAR2,
   fire_once          IN  BOOLEAN);

DBMS_DDL.SET_TRIGGER_FIRING_PROPERTY (
   trig_owner         IN  VARCHAR2,
   trig_name          IN  VARCHAR2,
   property           IN INTEGER,
   setting            IN BOOLEAN);
SET_TRIGGER_FIRING_PROPERTY.descriptionText: This procedure sets the specified DML or DDL trigge\'s firing property whether or not the property is set for the trigger. Use this procedure to control a DML or DDL trigge\'s firing property for changes:

WRAP.descriptionText: This function takes as input a single CREATE OR REPLACE statement that specifies creation of a PL/SQL package specification, package body, function, procedure, type specification or type body and returns a CREATE OR REPLACE statement where the text of the PL/SQL unit has been obfuscated.

GET_MODEL_SIGNATURE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_DDL.GET_MODEL_SIGNATURE(
        MODEL_NAME IN VARCHAR2 
)
return TABLE
