DBMS_SQL.PARSE (
   c                           IN   INTEGER,
   statement                   IN   VARCHAR2,
   language_flag               IN   INTEGER,
   edition                     IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   apply_crossedition_trigger  IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   fire_apply_trigger          IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   schema                      IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   container                   IN   VARCHAR2);
DBMS_SQL.PARSE (
   c                           IN   INTEGER,
   statement                   IN   CLOB,
   language_flag               IN   INTEGER,
   edition                     IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   apply_crossedition_trigger  IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   fire_apply_trigger          IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   schema                      IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   container                   IN   VARCHAR2);
DBMS_SQL.PARSE (
   c                           IN   INTEGER, 
   statement                   IN   VARCHAR2A,
   lb                          IN   INTEGER, 
   ub                          IN   INTEGER,
   lfflg                       IN   BOOLEAN, 
   language_flag               IN   INTEGER,
   edition                     IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   apply_crossedition_trigger  IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   fire_apply_trigger          IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   schema                      IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   container                   IN   VARCHAR2);

DBMS_SQL.PARSE (
   c                           IN   INTEGER, 
   statement                   IN   VARCHAR2s,
   lb                          IN   INTEGER, 
   ub                          IN   INTEGER,
   lfflg                       IN   BOOLEAN, 
   language_flag               IN   INTEGER,
   edition                     IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   apply_crossedition_trigger  IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   fire_apply_trigger          IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   schema                      IN   VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   container                   IN   VARCHAR2);
PARSE.descriptionText: This procedure parses the given statement in the given cursor. All statements are parsed immediately. In addition, DDL statements are run immediately when parsed.

RETURN_RESULT.descriptionText: This procedure returns the result of an executed statement to the client application.

TO_CURSOR_NUMBER.descriptionText: This function takes an OPENed strongly or weakly-typed ref cursor and transforms it into a DBMS_SQL cursor number.

TO_REFCURSOR.descriptionText: This function takes an OPENed, PARSEd, and EXECUTEd cursor and transforms/migrates it into a PL/SQL manageable REF CURSOR (a weakly-typed cursor) that can be consumed by PL/SQL native dynamic SQL switched to use native dynamic SQL. This subprogram is only used with SELECT cursors.

VARIABLE_VALUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_SQL.VARIABLE_VALUE (
   c               IN  INTEGER,
   name            IN  VARCHAR2,
   value           OUT NOCOPY <datatype>);
VARIABLE_VALUE.descriptionText: This procedure returns the value of the named variable for a given cursor. It is used to return the values of bind variables inside PL/SQL blocks or DML statements with returning clause.

REPORT_SQL_MONITOR.bodyFullText:
DBMS_SQL_MONITOR.REPORT_SQL_MONITOR (
   sql_id                    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT  NULL,

CAPTURE_CURSOR_CACHE_SQLSET.descriptionText: Over a specified time interval this procedure incrementally captures a workload from the shared SQL area into a SQL tuning set. The procedure captures a workload from the shared SQL area into a SQL tuning set, polling the cache multiple times over a time period and updating the workload data stored there. It can execute over as long a period as required to capture an entire system workload.

CREATE.bodyFullText:
CREATE TYPE sqlset_row AS object (
  sql_id                   VARCHAR(13),
  force_matching_signature NUMBER,
  sql_text                 CLOB,
  object_list              sql_objects,
  bind_data                RAW(2000),
  parsing_schema_name      VARCHAR2(30),
  module                   VARCHAR2(48),
  action                   VARCHAR2(32),
  elapsed_time             NUMBER,
  cpu_time                 NUMBER,
  buffer_gets              NUMBER,
  disk_reads               NUMBER,
  direct_writes            NUMBER,
  rows_processed           NUMBER,
  fetches                  NUMBER,
  executions               NUMBER,
  end_of_fetch_count       NUMBER,
  optimizer_cost           NUMBER,
  optimizer_env            RAW(2000),
  priority                 NUMBER,
  command_type             NUMBER,
  first_load_time          VARCHAR2(19),
  stat_period              NUMBER,
  active_stat_period       NUMBER,
  other                    CLOB,
  plan_hash_value          NUMBER,
  sql_plan                 sql_plan_table_type,
  bind_list                sql_binds)
CREATE.descriptionText: The SQLSET_ROW object models the content of a SQL tuning set for the user. Logically, a SQL tuning set is a collection of SQLSET_ROWs where each SQLSET_ROW contains a single SQL statement along with its execution context, statistics, binds, and plan. The SELECT_XXX subprograms each model a data source as a collection of SQLSET_ROWs, unique by (sql_id, plan_hash_value). Similarly, the LOAD_SQLSET procedure takes as input a cursor whose row type is SQLSET_ROW, treating each SQLSET_ROW in isolation according to the policies requested by the user.

ALTER_STATS_HISTORY_RETENTION.descriptionText: This procedure changes the statistics history retention value. Statistics history retention is used by both the automatic purge and PURGE_STATS Procedure.

CONVERT_RAW_VALUE.descriptionText: This procedure converts the internal representation of a minimum value, maximum value, or histogram endpoint actual value into a datatype-specific value. The minval, maxval, and eavals fields of the StatRec structure as filled in by GET_COLUMN_STATS or PREPARE_COLUMN_VALUES are appropriate values for input.

CONVERT_RAW_VALUE_NVARCHAR.descriptionText: This procedure converts the internal representation of a a minimum value, maximum value, or histogram end point actual value. The minval, maxval and eavals fields of the StatRec structure as filled in by GET_COLUMN_STATS or PREPARE_COLUMN_VALUES are appropriate values for input.

CONVERT_RAW_VALUE_ROWID.descriptionText: This procedure converts the internal representation of a a minimum value, maximum value, or histogram end point actual value. The minval, maxval and eavals fields of the StatRec structure as filled in by GET_COLUMN_STATS or PREPARE_COLUMN_VALUES are appropriate values for input.

	, flags => $6

COPY_TABLE_STATS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STATS.COPY_TABLE_STATS (
   ownname          VARCHAR2, 
   tabname          VARCHAR2, 
   srcpartname      VARCHAR2,
   dstpartname      VARCHAR2, 
   scale_factor     VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 1,
   flags            NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   force            BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
COPY_TABLE_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure copies the statistics of the source [sub] partition to the destination [sub] partition. It also copies statistics of all dependent object such as columns and local indexes. If the statistics for source are not available then nothing is copied. It can optionally scale the statistics (such as the number of blks, or number of rows) based on the given scale_factor.

CREATE_EXTENDED_STATS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STATS.CREATE_EXTENDED_STATS (
   ownname    VARCHAR2, 
   tabname    VARCHAR2,
   extension  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;

DBMS_STATS.CREATE_EXTENDED_STATS (
   ownname    VARCHAR2, 
   tabname    VARCHAR2,
   extension  VARCHAR2)
 RETURN CLOB;
CREATE_EXTENDED_STATS.descriptionText: This function creates a column statistics entry in the system for a user specified column group or an expression in a table. Statistics for this extension will be gathered when user or auto statistics gathering job gathers statistics for the table. We call statistics for such an extension, "extended statistics". This function returns the name of this newly created entry for the extension.

CREATE_STAT_TABLE.bodyFullText:

   tblspace            VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   global_temporary    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
CREATE_STAT_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a table with name stattab in ownnam\'s schema which is capable of holding statistics. The columns and types that compose this table are not relevant as it should be accessed solely through the procedures in this package.

FLUSH_DATABASE_MONITORING_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure flushes in-memory monitoring information for all tables in the dictionary. Corresponding entries in the *_TAB_MODIFICATIONS, *_TAB_STATISTICS and *_IND_STATISTICS views are updated immediately, without waiting for the Oracle database to flush them periodically. This procedure is useful when you need up-to-date information in those views. Because the GATHER_*_STATS procedures internally flush monitoring information, it is not necessary to run this procedure before gathering the statistics.

The granularity and no_invalidate arguments are not relevant to these types of indexes.

LOCK_SCHEMA_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure locks the statistics of all tables of a schema.

LOCK_TABLE_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure locks the statistics on the table.

MERGE_COL_USAGE.descriptionText: This procedure merges column usage information from a source database by means of a dblink into the local database. If column usage information already exists for a given table or column MERGE_COL_USAGE will combine both the local and the remote information.

   detail_level       VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'TYPICAL',
   format             VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'TEXT',

   since              TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NULL,

   auto_only          BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,

 RETURN CLOB;
REPORT_STATS_OPERATIONS.descriptionText: This function generates a report of all statistics operations that take place between two timestamps which may or may not have been provided. It allows the scope of the report to be narrowed down so that report will include only auto statistics gathering runs. Furthermore, in a multitenant environment, users may optionally provide a set of pluggable database (PDB) IDs so that only statistics operations from the specified pluggable databases will be reported.

RESET_GLOBAL_PREF_DEFAULTS.descriptionText: This procedures sets global preference, such as CASCADE, ESTIMATE_PERCENT and GRANULARITY, to default values. This reverses the global preferences set by the SET_GLOBAL_PREFS Procedure.

RESET_PARAM_DEFAULTS.descriptionText: This procedure resets the default values of all parameters to Oracle recommended values.

                                                    (GET_PARAM('NO_INVALIDATE')));
RESTORE_TABLE_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure restores statistics of a table as of a specified timestamp (as_of_timestamp). The procedure will restore statistics of associated indexes and columns as well. If the table statistics were locked at the specified timestamp the procedure will lock the statistics. The procedure will not restore user defined statistics.

SEED_COL_USAGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STATS.SEED_COL_USAGE (
   sqlset_name    IN    VARCHAR2,
   owner_name     IN    VARCHAR2,
   time_limit     IN    POSITIVE DEFAULT NULL);
SEED_COL_USAGE.descriptionText: This procedure seeds column usage information from a statements in the specified SQL tuning set. It iterates over the SQL statements in the specified SQL tuning set, compiles them and seeds column usage information for the columns that appear in these statements. You can monitor the workload on the system for given amount of time and seed the and seed the column usage information based on the columns that appear in statements executed during the monitoring window.

SET_COLUMN_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure sets column-related information. In the version of this procedure that deals with user-defined statistics, the statistics type specified is the type to store in the dictionary, in addition to the actual user-defined statistics. If this statistics type is NULL, the statistics type associated with the index or column is stored.

SET_GLOBAL_PREFS.descriptionText: This procedure is used to set the global statistics preferences.

SHOW_EXTENDED_STATS_NAME.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the statistics entry that is created for the user-specified extension. It raises an error if no extension has been created.

TRANSFER_STATS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STATS.TRANSFER_STATS (
   ownname     IN     VARCHAR2,
   tabname     IN     VARCHAR2,
   dblink      IN     VARCHAR2,   options     IN     NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
TRANSFER_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure transfers statistics for specified table(s) from a remote database specified by dblink to the local database. The statistics at the source database are retained. It likewise transfers statistics-related structures such as synopses and DML monitoring information.

UNLOCK_PARTITION_STATS.bodyFullText:

UNLOCK_PARTITION_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure enables the user to unlock statistics for a partition.

UNLOCK_SCHEMA_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure unlocks the statistics on all the tables in schema.

UNLOCK_TABLE_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure unlocks the statistics on the table.

UPGRADE_STAT_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure upgrades a user statistics table from an older version.

DROP_ALL.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STORAGE_MAP.DROP_ALL(
      dictionary_update IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
DROP_ALL.descriptionText: This function drops all mapping information in the shared memory of the instance.

DROP_ELEMENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STORAGE_MAP.DROP_ELEMENT(
   elemname          IN VARCHAR2,
   cascade           IN BOOLEAN,
   dictionary_update IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
DROP_ELEMENT.descriptionText: This function drops the mapping information for the element defined by elemname.

DROP_FILE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STORAGE_MAP.DROP_FILE(
   filename          IN VARCHAR2,
   cascade           IN BOOLEAN,
   dictionary_update IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
DROP_FILE.descriptionText: This function drops the file mapping information defined by filename.

LOCK_MAP.descriptionText: This procedure locks the mapping information in the shared memory of the instance. This is useful when you need a consistent snapshot of the V$MAP tables. Without locking the mapping information, V$MAP_ELEMENT and V$MAP_SUBELEMENT, for example, may be inconsistent.

MAP_ALL.descriptionText: This function builds the entire mapping information for all types of Oracle files (except archive logs), including all directed acyclic graph (DAG) elements. It obtains the latest mapping information because it explicitly synchronizes all mapping libraries.

MAP_ELEMENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STORAGE_MAP.MAP_ELEMENT(
   elemname          IN VARCHAR2,
   cascade           IN BOOLEAN,
   dictionary_update IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
MAP_ELEMENT.descriptionText: This function builds mapping information for the element identified by elemname. It may not obtain the latest mapping information if the element being mapped, or any one of the elements within its I/O stack (if cascade is TRUE), is owned by a library that must be explicitly synchronized.

MAP_FILE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STORAGE_MAP.MAP_FILE(
   filename           IN VARCHAR2, 
   filetype           IN VARCHAR2,
   cascade            IN BOOLEAN,
   max_num_fileextent IN NUMBER DEFAULT 100,
   dictionary_update  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
MAP_FILE.descriptionText: This function builds mapping information for the file identified by filename. Use this function if the mapping of one particular file has changed. The Oracle database server does not have to rebuild the entire mapping.

MAP_OBJECT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STORAGE_MAP.MAP_OBJECT(
   objname  IN  VARCHAR2,
   owner    IN  VARCHAR2,
   objtype  IN  VARCHAR2);
MAP_OBJECT.descriptionText: This function builds the mapping information for the Oracle object identified by the object name, owner, and type.

RESTORE.descriptionText: This function loads the entire mapping information from the data dictionary into the shared memory of the instance. You can invoke RESTORE only after a SAVE operation. You must explicitly call RESTORE in a warm startup scenario.

SAVE.descriptionText: This function saves information needed to regenerate the entire mapping into the data dictionary.

UNLOCK_MAP.descriptionText: This procedure unlocks the mapping information in the shared memory of the instance.

COMPATIBLE_10_1.descriptionText: This function returns the DBMS_STREAMS.COMPATIBLE_10_1 constant.

COMPATIBLE_10_2.descriptionText: This function returns the DBMS_STREAMS.COMPATIBLE_10_2 constant.

COMPATIBLE_11_1.descriptionText: This function returns the DBMS_STREAMS.COMPATIBLE_11_1 constant.

COMPATIBLE_11_2.descriptionText: This function returns the DBMS_STREAMS.COMPATIBLE_11_2 constant.

COMPATIBLE_12_1.descriptionText: This function returns the DBMS_STREAMS.COMPATIBLE_12_1 constant.

COMPATIBLE_9_2.descriptionText: This function returns the DBMS_STREAMS.COMPATIBLE_9_2 constant.

CONVERT_ANYDATA_TO_LCR_DDL.descriptionText: This function converts a ANYDATA object into a SYS.LCR$_DDL_RECORD object.

CONVERT_ANYDATA_TO_LCR_ROW.descriptionText: This function converts a ANYDATA object into a SYS.LCR$_ROW_RECORD object.

CONVERT_LCR_TO_XML.descriptionText: This function converts a logical change record (LCR) encapsulated in a ANYDATA object into an XML object that conforms to the XML schema for LCRs. The LCR can be a row LCR or a DDLLCR.

CONVERT_XML_TO_LCR.descriptionText: This function converts an XML object that conforms to the XML schema for logical change records (LCRs) into an LCR encapsulated in a ANYDATA object. The LCR can be a row or DDL LCR.

GET_INFORMATION.descriptionText: This function returns information about various Oracle Streams attributes.

GET_STREAMS_NAME.descriptionText: This function gets the Oracle Streams name of the invoker if the invoker is one of the following Oracle Streams types:

GET_STREAMS_TYPE.descriptionText: This function gets the Oracle Streams type of the invoker and returns one of the following types:

GET_TAG.descriptionText: This function gets the binary tag for all redo entries generated by the current session.

MAX_COMPATIBLE.descriptionText: This function returns an integer that is greater than the highest possible compatibility constant for the current release of Oracle Database.

SET_TAG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS.SET_TAG(
   tag  IN  RAW  DEFAULT NULL);
SET_TAG.descriptionText: This procedure sets the binary tag for all redo entries subsequently generated by the current session. Each redo entry generated by DML or DDL statements in the current session has this tag. This procedure affects only the current session.

PURGE_SOURCE_CATALOG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.PURGE_SOURCE_CATALOG(
   source_database     IN  VARCHAR2,
   source_object_name  IN  VARCHAR2,
   source_object_type  IN  VARCHAR2);
PURGE_SOURCE_CATALOG.descriptionText: This procedure removes all Oracle Streams data dictionary information at the local database for the specified object. You can use this procedure to remove Oracle Streams metadata that is not needed currently and will not be needed in the future.

RECOVER_OPERATION.descriptionText: This procedure provides options for operations that stopped because they encountered an errors. These operations include split and merge operations, Oracle Streams replication configuration operations, and Oracle Streams change table configuration operations. This procedure either rolls forward the operation, rolls back the operation, or purges all of the metadata about the operation.

REMOVE_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.REMOVE_QUEUE(
   queue_name               IN  VARCHAR2,
   cascade                  IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE,
   drop_unused_queue_table  IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE);
REMOVE_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the specified ANYDATA queue.

REMOVE_RULE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.REMOVE_RULE(
   rule_name         IN  VARCHAR2,
   streams_type      IN  VARCHAR2,
   streams_name      IN  VARCHAR2,
   drop_unused_rule  IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE,
   inclusion_rule    IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE);
REMOVE_RULE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the specified rule or all rules from the rule set associated with the specified capture process, synchronous capture, apply process, propagation, or messaging client.

REMOVE_STREAMS_CONFIGURATION.descriptionText: This procedure removes the Oracle Streams configuration at the local database.

streams_name => $1
	, notification_action => $2

	, include_notification => $5

SET_MESSAGE_NOTIFICATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.SET_MESSAGE_NOTIFICATION(
   streams_name          IN  VARCHAR2,
   notification_action   IN  VARCHAR2,
   notification_type     IN  VARCHAR2     DEFAULT 'PROCEDURE',
   notification_context  IN  ANYDATA      DEFAULT NULL,
   include_notification  IN  BOOLEAN      DEFAULT TRUE,
   queue_name            IN  VARCHAR2     DEFAULT 'streams_queue');
SET_MESSAGE_NOTIFICATION.descriptionText: This procedure sets a notification for messages that can be dequeued by a specified Oracle Streams messaging client from a specified queue. A notification is sent when a message is enqueued into the specified queue and the specified messaging client can dequeue the message because the message satisfies its rule sets.

SET_MESSAGE_TRACKING.descriptionText: Sets the tracking label for logical change records (LCRs) produced by the current session. This procedure affects only the current session. Any LCRs produced by the current session are tracked, including captured LCRs and persistent LCRs.

SET_RULE_TRANSFORM_FUNCTION.descriptionText: This procedure sets or removes the transformation function name for a custom rule-based transformation.

SET_TAG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.SET_TAG(
   tag  IN RAW  DEFAULT NULL);
SET_TAG.descriptionText: This procedure sets the binary tag for all redo entries subsequently generated by the current session. Each redo entry generated by DML or DDL statements in the current session will have this tag. This procedure affects only the current session.

SET_UP_QUEUE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_ADM.SET_UP_QUEUE(
   queue_table     IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'streams_queue_table',
   storage_clause  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,

   queue_user      IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   comment         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
SET_UP_QUEUE.descriptionText: This procedure creates a queue table and a ANYDATA queue.

GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:

   grantee           IN  VARCHAR2,
   grant_privileges  IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   file_name         IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   directory_name    IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL);
GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure either grants the privileges needed by a user to be an Oracle Streams administrator directly, or generates a script that you can use to grant these privileges.

GRANT_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure enables a remote Oracle Streams administrator to perform administrative actions at the local database by connecting to the grantee using a database link.

REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure either revokes Oracle Streams administrator privileges from a user directly, or generates a script that you can use to revoke these privileges.

REVOKE_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure disables a remote Oracle Streams administrator from performing administrative actions by connecting to the grantee using a database link.

CREATE_STMT_HANDLER.descriptionText: This procedure creates a statement DML handler.

DROP_STMT_HANDLER.descriptionText: This procedure drops a statement DML handler.

REMOVE_STMT_FROM_HANDLER.descriptionText: This procedure removes a statement from a statement DML handler.

DETACH_SIMPLE_TABLESPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_STREAMS_TABLESPACE_ADM.DETACH_SIMPLE_TABLESPACE(

DETACH_TABLESPACES.bodyFullText:

   datapump_job_name         IN OUT VARCHAR2,

datapump_job_name => $1
	, database_link => $2

PULL_TABLESPACES.bodyFullText:

PULL_TABLESPACES.descriptionText: This procedure copies a set of self-contained tablespaces from a remote database and attaches the tablespaces to the current database. All of the tablespaces in the specified tablespace set at the remote database must be online.

ABORT_REFRESH.descriptionText: This procedure undoes all the changes made by PREPARE_REFRESH or EXECUTE_REFRESH for the specified sync refresh groups. It helps you to recover to a state where the tables and materialized views are usable and consistent in case they encounter unexpected errors.

ALTER_REFRESH_STATS_RETENTION.descriptionText: This procedure alters the refresh history retention value, specified in days. It is intended for use in conjunction with PURGE_REFRESH_HISTORY. It also requires the SYSDBA privilege in addition to the privilege to execute it.

CAN_SYNCREF_TABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.CAN_SYNCREF_TABLE (
    schema_name    IN VARCHAR2,
    table_name     IN VARCHAR2,
    statement_id   IN VARCHAR2);

DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.CAN_SYNCREF_TABLE (
    schema_name    IN VARCHAR2,
    table_name     IN VARCHAR2,
    output_array   IN OUT Sys.CanSyncRefTypeArray);
CAN_SYNCREF_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure advises on whether a table and its dependent materialized views are eligible for sync refresh. It provides an explanation of its analysis. If not eligible, you can examine the reasons and take appropriate action if possible.

EXECUTE_REFRESH.descriptionText: This procedure executes sync refresh on the sync refresh groups prepared by DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.PREPARE_REFRESH. These groups are identified by their group IDs. Note this procedure will only perform the refresh on those materialized views that have been registered for synch refresh; any other materialized views will become stale once this procedure completes.

GET_ALL_GROUP_IDS.descriptionText: This function returns the group IDs of all the sync refresh groups in the database.

GET_GROUP_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the group ID of a materialized view. The group ID identifies the sync refresh group the table belongs to. A sync refresh group is a group of related tables and their dependent materialized views which must be all refreshed together jointly to ensure consistency and correctness.

GET_GROUP_ID_LIST.descriptionText: This function returns the group IDs of the tables in a given list of objects (materialized views).

PREPARE_REFRESH.descriptionText: This procedure prepares for refresh the sync refresh groups identified by the group ID in the input. A sync refresh group consists of a set of related tables and all materialized views dependent on those base tables. Note this procedure will only prepare for refresh those dependent materialized views that have been registered for synchronous refresh.

PREPARE_STAGING_LOG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.PREPARE_STAGING_LOG (
   schema_name      IN VARCHAR2,
   base_table_name  IN VARCHAR2,
   psl_mode         IN NUMBER DEFAULT
   DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.ENFORCED);
PREPARE_STAGING_LOG.descriptionText: This procedure collects statistics on the data in the staging log of the base table and validates the data in the log. It can be run in several different modes ranging from the enforced mode in which strict checking of the data is done to trusted mode in which no checking is done. You should run this procedure after loading the staging log and before running PREPARE_REFRESH.

PURGE_REFRESH_STATS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.PURGE_REFRESH_STATS (
   before_timestamp IN TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE);
PURGE_REFRESH_STATS.descriptionText: This procedure purges the refresh history of sync refreshes that took place before the value specified by the BEFORE_TIMESTAMP parameter. This procedure requires the SYSDBA privilege in addition to the privilege to execute it.

REGISTER_MVIEWS.descriptionText: This procedure registers a list of materialized views for synchronous refresh. It checks each materialized view in the list for eligibility and places it in the sync refresh group it belongs to. A sync refresh group is a set of related tables and materialized views defined on top of them. Two tables are considered related if there is a referential constraint between them.

REGISTER_PARTITION_OPERATION.bodyNoDefault:
partition_op => $1
	, schema_name => $2
	, base_table_name => $3
	, partition_name => $4
	, outside_partn_table_schema => $5

   outside_partn_table_schema  IN VARCHAR2,
   outside_partn_table_name    IN VARCHAR2);
REGISTER_PARTITION_OPERATION.descriptionText: This procedure registers a partition-maintenance operation (PMOP) on a partition of a base table.

UNREGISTER_MVIEWS.descriptionText: This procedure unregisters a list of materialized views from synchronous refresh. Once a materialized view is unregistered, it can be maintained by the user with any of the traditional refresh methods, such as complete or PCT, refresh.

UNREGISTER_PARTITION_OPERATION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_SYNC_REFRESH.UNREGISTER_PARTITION_OPERATION (
   partition_op     IN VARCHAR2,
   schema_name      IN VARCHAR2,
   base_table_name  IN VARCHAR2,
   partition_name   IN VARCHAR2);
UNREGISTER_PARTITION_OPERATION.descriptionText: This procedure unregisters a partition-maintenance operation (PMOP) that had been previously registered with REGISTER_PARTITION_OPERATION on a base table. The three kinds of change operations that can be specified on partitions are DROP, TRUNCATE, and EXCHANGE.

CHECK_DB.descriptionText: This function checks whether a database can be transported to a target platform. It tests whether transport is supported at all for a given source and destination platform, and whether the database is currently in the correct state for transport.

CHECK_EXTERNAL.descriptionText: This function determines whether a database has external tables, directories, or BFILEs.

CLEAR_PLSQL_TRACE.descriptionText: This procedure disables trace data collection.

GET_PLSQL_TRACE_LEVEL.descriptionText: This procedure returns the current trace level as the sum of one or more of the constants as listed in Table 167-1, "DBMS_TRACE Event Constants".

PLSQL_TRACE_VERSION.descriptionText: This procedure gets the version number of the trace package. It returns the major and minor version number of the DBMS_TRACE package.

SET_PLSQL_TRACE.descriptionText: This procedure enables PL/SQL trace data collection.

LOCAL_TRANSACTION_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the local (to instance) unique identifier for the current transaction. It returns null if there is no current transaction.

PURGE_LOST_DB_ENTRY.descriptionText: When a failure occurs during commit processing, automatic recovery consistently resolves the results at all sites involved in the transaction. However, if the remote database is destroyed or re-created before recovery completes, then the entries used to control recovery in DBA_2PC_PENDING and associated tables are never removed, and recovery will periodically retry. Procedure PURGE_LOST_DB_ENTRY enables removal of such transactions from the local site.

PURGE_MIXED.descriptionText: When in-doubt transactions are forced to commit or rollback (instead of letting automatic recovery resolve their outcomes), there is a possibility that a transaction can have a mixed outcome: Some sites commit, and others rollback. Such inconsistency cannot be resolved automatically by Oracle; however, Oracle flags entries in DBA_2PC_PENDING by setting the MIXED column to a value of\'ye\'.

CREATE_ALTER_TYPE_ERROR_TABLE.descriptionText: This procedure creates an error table to be used in the EXCEPTION clause of the ALTER TYPE statement.

CURRENT_INSTANCE.descriptionText: This function returns the current connected instance number. It returns NULL when connected instance is down.

DATA_BLOCK_ADDRESS_BLOCK.descriptionText: This function gets the block number part of a data block address.

DATA_BLOCK_ADDRESS_FILE.descriptionText: This function gets the file number part of a data block address.

DB_VERSION.descriptionText: This procedure returns version information for the database.

EXEC_DDL_STATEMENT.descriptionText: This procedure executes the DDL statement in parse_string.

EXPAND_SQL_TEXT.descriptionText: This procedure recursively replaces any view references in the input SQL query with the corresponding view subquery.

FORMAT_CALL_STACK.descriptionText: This function formats the current call stack. This can be used on any stored procedure or trigger to access the call stack. This can be useful for debugging.

FORMAT_ERROR_BACKTRACE.descriptionText: This function displays the call stack at the point where an exception was raised, even if the subprogram is called from an exception handler in an outer scope. The output is similar to the output of the SQLERRM function, but not subject to the same size limitation.

FORMAT_ERROR_STACK.descriptionText: This function formats the current error stack. This can be used in exception handlers to look at the full error stack.

GET_CPU_TIME.descriptionText: This function returns a measure of current CPU processing time in hundredths of a second. The difference between the times returned from two calls measures the CPU processing time (not the total elapsed time) between those two points.

GET_TIME.descriptionText: This function determines the current time in 100t\'s of a second. This subprogram is primarily used for determining elapsed time. The subprogram is called twice  at the beginning and end of some process  and then the first (earlier) number is subtracted from the second (later) number to determine the time elapsed.

IS_CLUSTER_DATABASE.descriptionText: This function finds out if this database is running in cluster database mode.

ADD_WARNING_SETTING_CAT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WARNING.ADD_WARNING_SETTING_CAT (
   warning_category    IN    VARCHAR2,
   warning_value       IN    VARCHAR2,
   scope               IN    VARCHAR2);
ADD_WARNING_SETTING_CAT.descriptionText: You can modify the current sessio\'s or syste\'s warning settings with the value supplied. The value will be added to the existing parameter setting if the value for the warning_category or warning_value has not been set, or override the existing value. The effect of calling this function is same as adding the qualifier (ENABLE/DISABLE/ERROR) on the category specified to the end of the current session or system setting.

ADD_WARNING_SETTING_NUM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WARNING.ADD_WARNING_SETTING_NUM (
   warning_number      IN    NUMBER,
   warning_value       IN    VARCHAR2,
   scope               IN    VARCHAR2);
ADD_WARNING_SETTING_NUM.descriptionText: You can modify the current session or system warning settings with the value supplied. If the value was already set, you will override the existing value. The effect of calling this function is same as adding the qualifier (ENABLE / DISABLE/ ERROR) on the category specified to the end of the current session or system setting.

GET_CATEGORY.descriptionText: This function returns the category name, given the message number.

GET_WARNING_SETTING_CAT.descriptionText: This function returns the specific warning category setting for the current session.

GET_WARNING_SETTING_NUM.descriptionText: This function returns the specific warning number setting for the current session.

GET_WARNING_SETTING_STRING.descriptionText: This function returns the entire warning string for the current session.

SET_WARNING_SETTING_STRING.descriptionText: This procedure replaces previous settings with the new value. The warning string may contain mix of category and warning numbers using the same syntax as used on the right hand side of\'\' when issuing an ALTER SESSION or SYSTEM SET PLSQL_WARNINGS command. This will have same effect as ALTER SESSION OR ALTER SYSTEM command.

   enforce_unique_constraints  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,

COMMITDDL.descriptionText: Commits DDL (data definition language) changes made during a DDL session for a specified table, and ends the DDL session.

COMMITRESOLVE.descriptionText: Ends a conflict resolution session and saves (makes permanent) any changes in the workspace since the BeginResolve procedure was executed.

COMPRESSWORKSPACE.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, compress_view_wo_overwrite => $2
	, secondSP => $3
	, auto_commit => $4
	, commit_in_batches => $5
	, batch_size => $6
	, remove_latest_deleted_rows => $7
COMPRESSWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.CompressWorkspace(
   workspace                   IN VARCHAR2,
   compress_view_wo_overwrite  IN BOOLEAN
   firstSP                     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   secondSP                    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_commit                 IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   commit_in_batches           IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   batch_size                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'PRIMARY_KEY_RANGE',
   remove_latest_deleted_rows  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
COMPRESSWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Deletes removable savepoints in a workspace and minimizes the Workspace Manager metadata structures for the workspace. (Removable savepoints are explained in Section 1.1.2.)

COMPRESSWORKSPACETREE.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, compress_view_wo_overwrite => $2
	, auto_commit => $3
	, commit_in_batches => $4
	, batch_size => $5
	, remove_latest_deleted_rows => $6
COMPRESSWORKSPACETREE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.CompressWorkspaceTree(
   workspace                   IN VARCHAR2,
   compress_view_wo_overwrite  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit                 IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   commit_in_batches           IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   batch_size                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'PRIMARY_KEY_RANGE',
   remove_latest_deleted_rows  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
COMPRESSWORKSPACETREE.descriptionText: Deletes removable savepoints in a workspace and all its descendant workspaces. (Removable savepoints are explained in Section 1.1.2.) It also minimizes the Workspace Manager metadata structures for the affected workspaces, and eliminates any redundant data that might arise from the deletion of the savepoints.

COPYFORUPDATE.descriptionText: Allows LOB columns (BLOB, CLOB, or NCLOB) in version-enabled tables to be modified. Use this procedure only if a version-enabled table has any LOB columns.

CREATESAVEPOINT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.CreateSavepoint(
   workspace       IN VARCHAR2,
   savepoint_name  IN VARCHAR2,
   description     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_commit     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
CREATESAVEPOINT.descriptionText: Creates a savepoint for the current version.

CREATEWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.CreateWorkspace(
   workspace    IN VARCHAR2,
   description  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   auto_commit  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
CREATEWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Creates a new workspace in the database.

DELETESAVEPOINT.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, savepoint_name => $2
	, compress_view_wo_overwrite => $3
	, auto_commit => $4
	, commit_in_batches => $5
	, batch_size => $6
DELETESAVEPOINT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.DeleteSavepoint(
   workspace                   IN VARCHAR2,
   savepoint_name              IN VARCHAR2,
   compress_view_wo_overwrite  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit                 IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   commit_in_batches           IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   batch_size                  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'PRIMARY_KEY_RANGE');
DELETESAVEPOINT.descriptionText: Deletes a savepoint and associated rows in version-enabled tables.

DISABLEVERSIONING.bodyNoDefault:
table_name => $1
	, force => $2
	, ignore_last_error => $3
	, isTopology => $4
	, keepWMValid => $5
	, undo_space => $6
DISABLEVERSIONING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.DisableVersioning(
   table_name         IN VARCHAR2,
   force              IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   ignore_last_error  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   isTopology         IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   keepWMValid        IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   undo_space         IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL;
DISABLEVERSIONING.descriptionText: Deletes all support structures that were created to enable the table to support versioned rows.

DROPREPLICATIONSUPPORT.descriptionText: Deletes replication support objects that were created by the GenerateReplicationSupport procedure.

ENABLEVERSIONING.bodyNoDefault:
table_name => $1
	, hist => $2
	, isTopology => $3
	, validTime => $4
	, undo_space => $5
	, validTimeRange => $6
ENABLEVERSIONING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.EnableVersioning(
   table_name     IN VARCHAR2,
   hist           IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'NONE',
   isTopology     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   validTime      IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   undo_space     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   validTimeRange IN WM_PERIOD DEFAULT NULL);
ENABLEVERSIONING.descriptionText: Version-enables a table, creating the necessary structures to enable the table to support multiple versions of rows.

EXPORT.bodyNoDefault:
table_name => $1
	, staging_table => $2
	, workspace => $3
	, where_clause => $4

	, after_savepoint_name => $6

	, auto_commit => $12
EXPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.Export(
   table_name          IN VARCHAR2,
   staging_table       IN VARCHAR2,
   workspace           IN VARCHAR2,
   where_clause        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   export_scope        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT DBMS_WM.EXPORT_MODIFIED_DATA_ONLY,
   after_savepoint_name  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   as_of_savepoint_name  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   after_instant       IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
   as_of_instant       IN DATE DEFAULT NULL,
   versioned_db        IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   overwrite_existing_data  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit         IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
EXPORT.descriptionText: Exports data from a version-enabled table (all rows, or as limited by any combination of several parameters) to a staging table.

EXPORT_SCHEMAS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.Export_Schemas(
   job_name           IN VARCHAR2,
   alt_schema         IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'WMSYS_N',
   ignore_last_error  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
EXPORT_SCHEMAS.descriptionText: Creates a dump file containing everything related to Workspace Manager. Uses the Oracle Data Pump Export utility.

FINDRICSET.descriptionText: Finds tables that need to be version-enabled along with a specified table, due to referential integrity constraint relationships.

FREEZEWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.FreezeWorkspace(
   workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
   freezemode    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'NO_ACCESS',
   freezewriter  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   force         IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
FREEZEWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Restricts access to a workspace and the ability of users to make changes in the workspace.

GENERATEREPLICATIONSUPPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.GenerateReplicationSupport(
   mastersites       IN VARCHAR2,
   groupname         IN VARCHAR2,
   groupdescription  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'Replication Group for OWM');
GENERATEREPLICATIONSUPPORT.descriptionText: Creates necessary structures for multimaster replication of Workspace Manager objects, and starts the master activity for the newly created master group.

GETSYTSTEMPARAMETER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.GetSytstemParameter(
   name   IN VARCHAR2) RETURN VARCHAR2;
GETSYTSTEMPARAMETER.descriptionText: Returns the value of a Workspace Manager system parameter.

GOTODATE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.GotoDate(
   in_date   IN VARCHAR2,
   fmt       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'mmddyyyyhh24miss',
   nlsparam  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   tsWtz     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
GOTODATE.descriptionText: Goes to a point at or near the specified date and time in the current workspace.

GOTOSAVEPOINT.descriptionText: Goes to the specified savepoint in the current workspace.

GOTOWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Moves the current session to the specified workspace.

GRANTGRAPHPRIV.bodyNoDefault:
priv_types => $1
	, leaf_workspace => $2
	, grantee => $3
	, node_types => $4
	, grant_option => $5
	, auto_commit => $6
GRANTGRAPHPRIV.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.GrantGraphPriv(
   priv_types      IN VARCHAR2,
   leaf_workspace  IN VARCHAR2,
   grantee         IN VARCHAR2,
   node_types      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '(''R'',''I'',''L'')',
   grant_option    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'NO',
   auto_commit     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
GRANTGRAPHPRIV.descriptionText: Grants privileges on multiparent graph workspaces to users and roles. The grant_option parameter enables the grantee to grant the specified privileges to other users and roles.

GRANTPRIVSONPOLICY.descriptionText: Grants the privileges required to call the EnableVersioning procedure on a table that contains the specified Oracle Label Security (OLS) policy.

GRANTSYSTEMPRIV.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.GrantSystemPriv(
   priv_types    IN VARCHAR2,
   grantee       IN VARCHAR2,
   grant_option  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'NO',
   auto_commit   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
GRANTSYSTEMPRIV.descriptionText: Grants system-level privileges (not restricted to a particular workspace) to users and roles. The grant_option parameter enables the grantee to grant the specified privileges to other users and roles.

GRANTWORKSPACEPRIV.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.GrantWorkspacePriv(
   priv_types    IN VARCHAR2,
   workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
   grantee       IN VARCHAR2,
   grant_option  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'NO',
   auto_commit   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
GRANTWORKSPACEPRIV.descriptionText: Grants workspace-level privileges to users and roles. The grant_option parameter enables the grantee to grant the specified privileges to other users and roles.

IMPORT.bodyNoDefault:
staging_table => $1
	, to_table => $2
	, to_workspace => $3
	, from_workspace => $4
	, where_clause => $5
	, import_scope => $6
	, ancestor_savepoint_workspace => $7
	, ancestor_savepoint_name => $8
	, apply_locks => $9
	, enforceUCFlag => $10
	, enforceRICFlag => $11
	, auto_commit => $12
IMPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.Import(
   staging_table   IN VARCHAR2,
   to_table        IN VARCHAR2,
   to_workspace    IN VARCHAR2,
   from_workspace  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   where_clause    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,

   ancestor_savepoint_workspace  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   ancestor_savepoint_name       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   apply_locks     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   enforceUCFlag   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   enforceRICFlag  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   auto_commit     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
IMPORT.descriptionText: Imports data from a staging table (all rows, or as limited by any combination of several parameters) into a version-enabled table in a specified workspace.

IMPORT_SCHEMAS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.Import_Schemas(
   job_name           IN VARCHAR2,
   alt_schema         IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'WMSYS_N',
   ignore_last_error  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
IMPORT_SCHEMAS.descriptionText: Imports the entire Workspace Manager installation from a dump file that had been created by the Export_Schemas procedure. Uses the Oracle Data Pump Import utility.

ISWORKSPACEOCCUPIED.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.IsWorkspaceOccupied(
   workspace  IN VARCHAR2) RETURN VARCHAR2;
ISWORKSPACEOCCUPIED.descriptionText: Checks whether or not a workspace has any active sessions.

LOCKROWS.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, table_name => $2
	, where_clause => $3
	, lock_mode => $4
	, Xmin => $5
	, Ymin => $6
	, Xmax => $7
	, Ymax => $8
LOCKROWS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.LockRows(
   workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
   table_name    IN VARCHAR2,
   where_clause  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '',
   lock_mode     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'E',
   Xmin          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   Ymin          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   Xmax          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   Ymax          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
LOCKROWS.descriptionText: Controls access to versioned rows in a specified table and to corresponding rows in the parent workspace.

MERGETABLE.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, table_id => $2
	, where_clause => $3
	, create_savepoint => $4
	, remove_data => $5
	, auto_commit => $6
MERGETABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.MergeTable(
   workspace         IN VARCHAR2,
   table_id          IN VARCHAR2,
   where_clause      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '',
   create_savepoint  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   remove_data       IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit       IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
MERGETABLE.descriptionText: Applies changes to one or more tables (all rows or as specified in the WHERE clause) in a workspace to its parent workspace.

MERGEWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.MergeWorkspace(
   workspace         IN VARCHAR2,
   create_savepoint  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   remove_workspace  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit       IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
MERGEWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Applies all changes in a workspace to its parent workspace, and optionally removes the workspace.

MOVE_PROC.descriptionText: Moves the Workspace Manager metadata to a specified tablespace.

PURGETABLE.bodyNoDefault:
table_id => $1
	, archive_table => $2
	, where_clause => $3
	, workspace => $4
	, savepoint_name => $5
	, instant => $6
	, purgeAfter => $7
PURGETABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.PurgeTable(
   table_id       IN VARCHAR2,
   archive_table  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   where_clause   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   workspace      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'LIVE',
   savepoint_name IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   instant        IN TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NULL,
   purgeAfter     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
PURGETABLE.descriptionText: Removes rows (all rows, or as limited by any combination of several parameters) from a version-enabled table, and optionally inserts them into an archive table.

RECOVERALLMIGRATINGTABLES.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RecoverAllMigratingTables(
   ignore_last_error IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
RECOVERALLMIGRATINGTABLES.descriptionText: Attempts to complete the migration process on all tables that were left in an inconsistent state after the Workspace Manager migration procedure failed.

RECOVERFROMDROPPEDUSER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RecoverFromDroppedUser(
   ignore_last_error IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
RECOVERFROMDROPPEDUSER.descriptionText: Performs necessary operations after the dropping of one or more database users that owned one or more version-enabled tables.

RECOVERMIGRATINGTABLE.descriptionText: Attempts to complete the migration process on a table that was left in an inconsistent state after the Workspace Manager migration procedure failed.

REFRESHTABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RefreshTable(
   workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
   table_id      IN VARCHAR2,
   where_clause  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '',
   auto_commit   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
REFRESHTABLE.descriptionText: Applies to a workspace all changes made to a table (all rows or as specified in the WHERE clause) in its parent workspace.

REFRESHWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RefreshWorkspace(
   workspace    IN VARCHAR2,
   auto_commit  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   copy_data    IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
REFRESHWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Applies to a workspace all changes made in its parent workspace.

RELOCATEWRITERSITE.descriptionText: Makes one of the nonwriter sites the new writer site in a Workspace Manager replication environment. (The old writer site becomes one of the nonwriter sites.)

REMOVEASPARENTWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RemoveAsParentWorkspace(
   mp_leafworkspace  IN VARCHAR2,
   parent_workspace  IN VARCHAR2,
   auto_commit       IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
REMOVEASPARENTWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Removes a workspace as a parent workspace in a multiparent workspace environment.

REMOVEUSERDEFINEDHINT.descriptionText: Removes a user-defined hint: that is, causes the default optimizer hint to be used with SQL statements executed by the DBMS_WM package on a specified version-enabled table or all version-enabled tables.

REMOVEWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Discards all row versions associated with a workspace and deletes the workspace.

REMOVEWORKSPACETREE.descriptionText: Discards all row versions associated with a workspace and its descendant workspaces, and deletes the affected workspaces.

RENAMESAVEPOINT.descriptionText: Renames a savepoint in a specified workspace.

RESOLVECONFLICTS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.ResolveConflicts(
   workspace       IN VARCHAR2,
   table_name      IN VARCHAR2,
   where_clause    IN VARCHAR2,
   keep            IN VARCHAR2,
   resolve_base_ne IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);

REVOKEGRAPHPRIV.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RevokeGraphPriv(
   priv_types      IN VARCHAR2,
   leaf_workspace  IN VARCHAR2,
   grantee         IN VARCHAR2.
   node_types      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '(''R'',''I'',''L'')',
   auto_commit     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
REVOKEGRAPHPRIV.descriptionText: Revokes (removes) privileges on multiparent graph workspaces from users and roles for a specified leaf workspace.

REVOKESYSTEMPRIV.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RevokeSystemPriv(
   priv_types   IN VARCHAR2,
   grantee      IN VARCHAR2,
   auto_commit  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
REVOKESYSTEMPRIV.descriptionText: Revokes (removes) system-level privileges from users and roles.

REVOKEWORKSPACEPRIV.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RevokeWorkspacePriv(
   priv_types   IN VARCHAR2,
   workspace    IN VARCHAR2,
   grantee      IN VARCHAR2.
   auto_commit  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
REVOKEWORKSPACEPRIV.descriptionText: Revokes (removes) workspace-level privileges from users and roles for a specified workspace.

ROLLBACKBULKLOADING.descriptionText: Rolls back changes made to a version-enabled table during a bulk load operation.

ROLLBACKDDL.descriptionText: Rolls back (cancels) DDL (data definition language) changes made during a DDL session for a specified table, and ends the DDL session.

ROLLBACKRESOLVE.descriptionText: Quits a conflict resolution session and discards all changes in the workspace since the BeginResolve procedure was executed.

ROLLBACKTABLE.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, table_id => $2
	, sp_name => $3
	, where_clause => $4
	, remove_locks => $5
	, auto_commit => $6
ROLLBACKTABLE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RollbackTable(
   workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
   table_id      IN VARCHAR2,
   sp_name       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '',
   where_clause  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '',
   remove_locks  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   auto_commit   IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
ROLLBACKTABLE.descriptionText: Discards all changes made in the workspace to a specified table (all rows or as specified in the WHERE clause).

ROLLBACKTOSP.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.RollbackToSP(
   workspace       IN VARCHAR2,
   savepoint_name  IN VARCHAR2,
   auto_commit     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
ROLLBACKTOSP.descriptionText: Discards all data changes made in the workspace to version-enabled tables since the specified savepoint.

ROLLBACKWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Discards all data changes made in the workspace to version-enabled tables.

SETCAPTUREEVENT.descriptionText: Enables or disables the capture of all Workspace Manager events or events of a specific type.

SETCOMPRESSWORKSPACE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.SetCompressWorkspace(
   workspace  IN VARCHAR2,
   firstSP    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   secondSP   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
SETCOMPRESSWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Creates rows in the WM_COMPRESSIBLE_TABLES metadata view with information about version-enabled tables that need to be compressed if workspace compression operations are performed.

SETCONFLICTWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Determines whether or not conflicts exist between a workspace and its parent.

SETDIFFVERSIONS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.SetDiffVersions(
   workspace1   IN VARCHAR2,
   workspace2   IN VARCHAR2,
   onlyModified IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
SETDIFFVERSIONS.descriptionText: Finds differences in values in version-enabled tables for two savepoints and their common ancestor (base). It modifies the contents of the differences views that describe these differences.

SETLOCKINGOFF.descriptionText: Disables Workspace Manager locking for the current session.

SETLOCKINGON.descriptionText: Enables Workspace Manager locking for the current session.

SETMULTIWORKSPACES.descriptionText: Makes the specified workspace or workspaces visible in the multiworkspace views for version-enabled tables.

SETSYSTEMPARAMETER.descriptionText: Sets the value of a Workspace Manager system parameter.

SETTRIGGEREVENTS.descriptionText: Enables the execution of a trigger for a specified set of triggering events. The trigger will not be executed for events not specified

SETVALIDTIME.descriptionText: Sets the session valid time period. (Valid time support is described in Chapter 3.)

SETVALIDTIMEFILTEROFF.descriptionText: Removes the valid time filter for the current session.

SETVALIDTIMEFILTERON.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.SetValidTimeFilterON(
   filtertime  IN TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE DEFAULT NULL);
SETVALIDTIMEFILTERON.descriptionText: Sets a valid time filter for the current session (that is, a time to be applied to version-enabled tables.

SETWMVALIDUPDATEMODEOFF.descriptionText: Disables sequenced and nonsequenced update operations and sequenced delete operations on tables that have valid time support.

SETWMVALIDUPDATEMODEON.descriptionText: Enables sequenced and nonsequenced update operations and sequenced delete operations on tables that have valid time support.

SETWOOVERWRITEOFF.descriptionText: Disables the VIEW_WO_OVERWRITE history option that was enabled by the EnableVersioning or SetWoOverwriteON procedure, changing the option to VIEW_W_OVERWRITE (with overwrite).

SETWOOVERWRITEON.descriptionText: Enables the VIEW_WO_OVERWRITE history option that was disabled by the SetWoOverwriteOFF procedure.

SETWORKSPACELOCKMODEOFF.descriptionText: Disables Workspace Manager locking for the specified workspace.

SETWORKSPACELOCKMODEON.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.SetWorkspaceLockModeON(
   workspace    IN VARCHAR2,
   lockmode     IN VARCHAR2,
   override     IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   auto_commit  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE);
SETWORKSPACELOCKMODEON.descriptionText: Enables Workspace Manager locking for the specified workspace.

SYNCHRONIZESITE.descriptionText: Brings the local site (the old writer site) up to date in the Workspace Manager replication environment after the writer site was moved using the RelocateWriterSite procedure.

UNFREEZEWORKSPACE.descriptionText: Enables access and changes to a workspace, reversing the effect of the FreezeWorkspace procedure.

UNLOCKROWS.bodyNoDefault:
workspace => $1
	, table_name => $2
	, where_clause => $3
	, all_or_user => $4
	, lock_mode => $5
	, Xmin => $6
	, Ymin => $7
	, Xmax => $8
	, Ymax => $9
UNLOCKROWS.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WM.UnlockRows(
   workspace     IN VARCHAR2,
   table_name    IN VARCHAR2,
   where_clause  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT '',
   all_or_user   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'USER',
   lock_mode     IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'ES',
   Xmin          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   Ymin          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   Xmax          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   Ymax          IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
UNLOCKROWS.descriptionText: Enables access to versioned rows in a specified table and to corresponding rows in the parent workspace.

USEDEFAULTVALUESFORNULLS.descriptionText: Determines whether or not Workspace Manager, for the current session, uses the default value for a column when the user either specifies a null value or does not specify any value for the column in an insert operation on a version-enabled table.

ADD_FILTER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_CAPTURE.ADD_FILTER (
   fname           IN   VARCHAR2 NOT NULL, 
   fattribute      IN   VARCHAR2 NOT NULL, 
   fvalue          IN   VARCHAR2 NOT NULL);
DBMS_WORKLOAD_CAPTURE.ADD_FILTER (
   fname           IN   VARCHAR2 NOT NULL, 
   fattribute      IN   VARCHAR2 NOT NULL, 
   fvalue          IN   NUMBER NOT NULL);
ADD_FILTER.descriptionText: This procedure adds a filter to capture a subset of the workload.

DELETE_CAPTURE_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure deletes the rows in the DBA_WORKLOAD_CAPTURES and DBA_WORKLOAD_FILTERS views that corresponds to the given workload capture ID.

DELETE_FILTER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_CAPTURE.DELETE_FILTER (
   filter_name           IN   VARCHAR2(40) NOT NULL);
DELETE_FILTER.descriptionText: This procedure deletes a specified filter.

EXPORT_AWR.descriptionText: This procedure exports the AWR snapshots associated with a given capture ID.

FINISH_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure signals all connected sessions to stop the workload capture and stops future requests to the database from being captured.

GET_CAPTURE_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves all information regarding a workload capture present in the stipulated directory, imports the information into the DBA_WORKLOAD_CAPTURES and DBA_WORKLOAD_FILTERS views, and returns the appropriate DBA_WORKLOAD_CAPTURES.ID

IMPORT_AWR.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_CAPTURE.IMPORT_AWR (
   capture_id       IN   NUMBER,
   staging_schema   IN   VARCHAR2,
   force_cleanup    IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE)
 RETURN NUMBER;
IMPORT_AWR.descriptionText: This procedure imports the AWR snapshots associated with a given capture ID provided those AWR snapshots were exported earlier from the original capture system using the EXPORT_AWR Procedure.

REPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_CAPTURE.REPORT (
   capture_id      IN   NUMBER,
   format          IN   VARCHAR2)
 RETURN CLOB;
REPORT.descriptionText: This function generates a report on the stipulated workload capture.

START_CAPTURE.bodyNoDefault:
name => $1
	, dir => $2
	, duration => $3
	, default_action => $4
	, auto_unrestrict => $5
	, capture_sts => $6
	, sts_cap_interval => $7
START_CAPTURE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_CAPTURE.START_CAPTURE (
   name              IN  VARCHAR2,
   dir               IN  VARCHAR2,
   duration          IN  NUMBER   DEFAULT NULL,
   default_action    IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'INCLUDE',
   auto_unrestrict   IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE,
   capture_sts       IN  BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval  IN  NUMBER   DEFAULT 300);
START_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure initiates workload capture on all instances.

ADD_CAPTURE.bodyNoDefault:
capture_dir_name => $1
	, start_delay_seconds => $2
	, stop_replay => $3
	, take_begin_snapshot => $4
	, take_end_snapshot => $5
	, query_only => $6
ADD_CAPTURE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.ADD_CAPTURE (
   capture_dir_name      IN    VARCHAR2,
   start_delay_seconds   IN    NUMBER  DEFAULT 0,
   stop_replay           IN    BOOLEAN FALSE,
   take_begin_snapshot   IN    BOOLEAN TRUE,
   take_end_snapshot     IN    BOOLEAN TRUE,
   query_only            IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE)
 RETURN NUMBER;

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.ADD_CAPTURE (
   capture_dir_name      IN    VARCHAR2,
   start_delay_seconds   IN    NUMBER  DEFAULT 0,
   stop_replay           IN    BOOLEAN FALSE,
   take_begin_snapshot   IN    BOOLEAN TRUE,
   take_end_snapshot     IN    BOOLEAN TRUE,
   query_only            IN    VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'N')
 RETURN NUMBER;
ADD_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This function adds the given capture to the current schedule. The directory has to be a valid capture processed in the current databas\'s version. It returns a unique ID that identifies this capture within this schedule.

ADD_FILTER.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.ADD_FILTER (
   fname          IN VARCHAR2,
   fattribute     IN VARCHAR2,
   fvalue         IN VARCHAR2);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.ADD_FILTER (
   fname          IN VARCHAR2,
   fattribute     IN VARCHAR2,
   fvalue         IN NUMBER);
ADD_FILTER.descriptionText: This procedure adds a filter to replay only a subset of the captured workload.

ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING (
   schedule_capture_id     IN VARCHAR2,
   waitfor_capture_id      IN VARCHAR2)
  RETURN NUMBER;
ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING.descriptionText: This function adds a schedule order between two captures. Together, schedule_capture_id and waitfor_capture_id form a schedule ordering that previously added by the ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING Function. The order is that replay of capture indicated by schedule_capture_id will not start unless the replay of capture indicated by waiting_for_capture_id finishes.

BEGIN_REPLAY_SCHEDULE.descriptionText: This procedure initiates the creation of a reusable replay schedule.

CALIBRATE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.CALIBRATE (
   capture_dir          IN VARCHAR2,
   process_per_cpu      IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 4,
   threads_per_process  IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 50)
  RETURN CLOB;
CALIBRATE.descriptionText: This function operates on a processed workload capture directory to estimate the number of hosts and workload replay clients needed to faithfully replay the given workload. This function returns the results as an XML CLOB.

CANCEL_REPLAY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.CANCEL_REPLAY (
   error_msg    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
CANCEL_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure cancels workload replay in progress. All the external replay clients (WRC) will automatically be notified to stop issuing the captured workload and exit.

COMPARE_PERIOD_REPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.COMPARE_PERIOD_REPORT (
   replay_id1   IN   NUMBER,
   replay_id2   IN   NUMBER,
   format       IN   VARCHAR2,
   result       OUT  CLOB );
COMPARE_PERIOD_REPORT.descriptionText: This procedure generates a report comparing a replay to its capture or to another replay of the same capture.

COMPARE_SQLSET_REPORT.bodyNoDefault:
replay_id1 => $1
	, replay_id2 => $2
	, format => $3
	, r_level => $4
	, r_sections => $5
	, result => $6
COMPARE_SQLSET_REPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.COMPARE_SQLSET_REPORT (
   replay_id1    IN NUMBER,
   replay_id2    IN NUMBER,
   format        IN VARCHAR2,
   r_level       IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'ALL',
   r_sections    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'ALL',
   result        OUT CLOB )
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
COMPARE_SQLSET_REPORT.descriptionText: This procedure generates a report comparing a sqlset captured during replay to one captured during workload capture or to one captured during another replay of the same capture.

CREATE_FILTER_SET.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.CREATE_FILTER_SET(
   replay_dir       IN  VARCHAR2,
   filter_set       IN  VARCHAR2,
   default_action   IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'INCLUDE');
CREATE_FILTER_SET.descriptionText: This procedure creates a new filter set for the replays at replay_dir. It includes all the replay filters that have already been added by the ADD_FILTER Procedure. After the procedure has completed and replay initiated, the newly-created filter set can be used to filter the replay in replay_dir by calling the USE_FILTER_SET Procedure.

DELETE_FILTER.descriptionText: This procedure deletes the named filter.

DELETE_REPLAY_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure deletes the rows in DBA_WORKLOAD_REPLAYS that correspond to the given workload replay ID.

END_REPLAY_SCHEDULE.descriptionText: This procedure wraps up the creation of the current schedule. The schedule is now saved and associated with the replay directory and can be used for a replay.

EXPORT_AWR.descriptionText: This procedure exports the AWR snapshots associated with a stipulated replay ID.

GENERATE_CAPTURE_SUBSET.bodyNoDefault:
input_capture_dir => $1
	, output_capture_dir => $2
	, new_capture_name => $3
	, begin_time => $4
	, begin_include_incomplete => $5
	, end_time => $6
	, end_include_incomplete => $7
	, parallel_level => $8
GENERATE_CAPTURE_SUBSET.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GENERATE_CAPTURE_SUBSET (
   input_capture_dir          IN   VARCHAR2,
   output_capture_dir         IN   VARCHAR2,
   new_capture_name           IN   VARCHAR2,
   begin_time                 IN   NUMBER,
   begin_include_incomplete   IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE,
   end_time                   IN   NUMBER,
   end_include_incomplete     IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE,
   parallel_level             IN   NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
GENERATE_CAPTURE_SUBSET.descriptionText: This procedure creates a new capture from an existing workload capture.

GET_DIVERGING_STATEMENT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GET_DIVERGING_STATEMENT (
   replay_id    IN NUMBER,
   stream_id    IN NUMBER,
   call_counter IN NUMBER)
  RETURN CLOB;
GET_DIVERGING_STATEMENT.descriptionText: This function retrieves information about a diverging call, including the statement text, the SQL ID, and the binds. If the replay of a recorded user call has data or error divergence, it is a diverging call.

GET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY.descriptionText: This function returns the current replay directory set by the SET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY Procedure. It returns NULL if no replay directory has been set.

GET_REPLAY_INFO.descriptionText: This function retrieves information about the workload capture and the history of all the workload replay attempts from the stipulated directory.

GET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.GET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT (
   enabled       OUT  BOOLEAN, 
   min_delay     OUT  NUMBER,
   max_delay     OUT  NUMBER,
   delay_factor  OUT  NUMBER);
GET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT.descriptionText: This procedure gets the replay timeout setting.

IMPORT_AWR.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.IMPORT_AWR (
   replay_id       IN   NUMBER,
   staging_schema  IN   VARCHAR2)
  RETURN NUMBER;
IMPORT_AWR.descriptionText: This procedure imports the AWR snapshots from a given replay.

INITIALIZE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure puts the database state in INIT for a multiple-capture replay. It uses the replay_dir which has already been defined by the SET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY Procedure, pointing to a directory that contains all the capture directories involved in the schedule. It reads data about schedule schedule_name from the directory, and loads required connection data into the replay system.

INITIALIZE_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure puts the database state in INIT for REPLAY mode, and loads data into the replay system that is required before preparing for the replay (by executing the PAUSE_REPLAY Procedure).

IS_REPLAY_PAUSED.descriptionText: This function reports whether the replay is currently paused.

PAUSE_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure pauses the in-progress workload replay. All subsequent user calls from the replay clients will be stalled until either a call to the RESUME_REPLAY Procedure is issued or the replay is cancelled.

POPULATE_DIVERGENCE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.POPULATE_DIVERGENCE (
   replay_id    IN   NUMBER,
   stream_id    IN   NUMBER DEFAULT NULL,
   call_counter IN   NUMBER DEFAULT NULL);
POPULATE_DIVERGENCE.descriptionText: This procedure precomputes the divergence information for the given call, stream, or the whole replay so that the GET_DIVERGING_STATEMENT Function returns as quickly as possible for the precomputed calls.

PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY.bodyNoDefault:
synchronization => $1
	, connect_time_scale => $2
	, think_time_scale => $3
	, think_time_auto_correct => $4
	, capture_sts => $5
	, sts_cap_interval => $6
PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN BOOLEAN,
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'OBJECT_ID',,
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);
PREPARE_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY.descriptionText: Similar to the PREPARE_REPLAY Procedure, this procedure puts the database in a special "Prepare" mode for a multiple-capture replay. The difference is that this subprogram should be used only for consolidated replays.

PREPARE_REPLAY.bodyNoDefault:
synchronization => $1
	, connect_time_scale => $2
	, think_time_scale => $3
	, think_time_auto_correct => $4
	, scale_up_multiplier => $5
	, capture_sts => $6
	, sts_cap_interval => $7
PREPARE_REPLAY.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   scale_up_multiplier       IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 1,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.PREPARE_REPLAY (
   synchronization           IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'OBJECT_ID',
   connect_time_scale        IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_scale          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 100,
   think_time_auto_correct   IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   scale_up_multiplier       IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 1,
   capture_sts               IN BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   sts_cap_interval          IN NUMBER    DEFAULT 300);
PREPARE_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure puts the database state in PREPARE FOR REPLAY mode.

PROCESS_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure processes the workload capture found in capture_dir in place.

REMAP_CONNECTION.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REMAP_CONNECTION (
   connection_id         IN  NUMBER,
   replay_connection     IN  VARCHAR2);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REMAP_CONNECTION (
   capture_number        IN  VARCHAR2,
   connection_id         IN  NUMBER,
   replay_connection     IN  VARCHAR2);
REMAP_CONNECTION.descriptionText: This procedure remaps the captured connection to a new one so that the user sessions can connect to the database in a desired way during workload replay.

REMOVE_CAPTURE.descriptionText: This procedure removes the given capture from the current schedule.

REMOVE_SCHEDULE_ORDERING.descriptionText: This procedure removes an existing schedule order from the current replay schedule. Together, schedule_capture_id and waitfor_capture_id form a schedule ordering that previously added by the ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING Function (schedule_capture_id, waitfor_capture_id). The order is that replay of capture indicated by schedule_capture_id will not start unless the replay of capture indicated by waiting_for_capture_id finishes.

REPORT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.REPORT (
   replay_id          IN NUMBER,
   format             IN VARCHAR2)
  RETURN CLOB;
REPORT.descriptionText: This function generates a report on the stipulated workload replay.

RESUME_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure resumes a paused workload replay.

REUSE_REPLAY_FILTER_SET.descriptionText: This procedure reuses filters in the specified filter set as if each were added using the ADD_SCHEDULE_ORDERING Function. Each call adds one filter set, which is a collection of individual filters on various attributes. Also, a new filter rule can be added, and an existing filter can be deleted before invoking the CREATE_FILTER_SET Procedure to create a new filter set.

SET_ADVANCED_PARAMETER.descriptionText: This procedure sets an advanced parameter for replay besides the ones used with the PREPARE_REPLAY Procedure. The advanced parameters control aspects of the replay that are more specialized. The advanced parameters are reset to their default values after the replay has finished.

SET_REPLAY_DIRECTORY.descriptionText: This procedure sets a directory that contains multiple workload captures as the current replay directory.

SET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT (
   enabled       OUT  BOOLEAN DEFAULT TRUE, 
   min_delay     OUT  NUMBER DEFAULT 10,
   max_delay     OUT  NUMBER DEFAULT 120,
   delay_factor  OUT  NUMBER DEFAULT 8);
SET_REPLAY_TIMEOUT.descriptionText: This procedure sets the replay timeout setting. The purpose is to abort user calls that might make the replay much slower or even cause a replay hang.

SET_USER_MAPPING.bodyFullText:
DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_USER_MAPPING (
   schedule_cap_id      IN NUMBER,
   capture_user         IN VARCHAR2,
   replay_user          IN VARCHAR2);

DBMS_WORKLOAD_REPLAY.SET_USER_MAPPING (
   capture_user         IN VARCHAR2,
   replay_user          IN VARCHAR2);
SET_USER_MAPPING.descriptionText: This procedure sets a new schema or user name to be used during replay instead of the captured user.

START_CONSOLIDATED_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure starts the replay of a multiple-capture capture. It should be used only for consolidated replays.

START_REPLAY.descriptionText: This procedure starts the workload replay. All the external replay clients (WRC) that are currently connected to the replay database will automatically be notified, and those replay clients (WRC) will begin issuing the captured workload. It should only be used for consolidated replays.

USE_FILTER_SET.descriptionText: This procedure applies a filter set to a capture in the current replay schedule. The filter set must have been created by calling the CREATE_FILTER_SET Procedure.

ADD_COLORED_SQL.descriptionText: This procedure adds a colored SQL ID. If an SQL ID is colored, it will be captured in every snapshot, independent of its level of activities (so that it does not have to be a TOP SQL). Capture occurs if the SQL is found in the cursor cache at snapshot time.To uncolor the SQL, invoke the REMOVE_COLORED_SQL Procedure.

PURGE_SQL_DETAILS.descriptionText: This procedure purges SQL details, specifically rows from WRH$_SQLTEXT, WRH$_SQL_PLAN, and WRH$_SQL_BIND_METADATA that do not have corresponding rows (DBID, SQL_ID) in WRH$_SQLSTAT.

REMOVE_COLORED_SQL.descriptionText: This procedure removes a colored SQL ID. After a SQL is uncolored, it will no longer be captured in a snapshot automatically, unless it makes the TOP list.

   instance_num      IN NUMBER DEFAULT NULL)

SELECT_BASELINE_METRIC.descriptionText: This table function shows the values of the metrics corresponding to a baseline. The table function will return an object of the AWR_BASELINE_METRIC_TYPE Object Type.

UPDATE_OBJECT_INFO.descriptionText: This procedure updates rows of WRH$_SEG_STAT_OBJ table that represent objects in the local database. It attempts to determine the current names for all object belonging to the local database, except those with\'MISSIN\' and/or\'TRANSIEN\' values in the name columns. The amount of work performed at each invocation of this routine may be controlled by setting the input parameter.

DIST_TXN_SYNC.descriptionText: This procedure can be used to synchronize in-doubt transactions when one of the Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) instances fails.

XA_COMMIT.bodyFullText:

   xid       IN  DBMS_XA_XID,
   onePhase  IN  BOOLEAN)
RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
XA_COMMIT.descriptionText: This function commits the global transaction specified by xid.

XA_END.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XA.XA_END (
   xid   IN  DBMS_XA_XID,
   flag  IN  PLS_INTEGER)
RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
XA_END.descriptionText: This function disassociates the current session from the transaction branch specified by xid

XA_FORGET.descriptionText: This function informs the resource manager to forget about a heuristically committed or rolled back transaction branch.

XA_GETLASTOER.descriptionText: This function obtains the last Oracle error code, in case of failure of previous XA calls.

XA_PREPARE.descriptionText: This function prepares the transaction branch specified in xid for committing the transaction subsequently if possible.

XA_RECOVER.descriptionText: This function obtains a list of prepared or heuristically completed transaction branches from a resource manager.

XA_ROLLBACK.descriptionText: This function informs the resource manager to roll back work done on behalf of a transaction branch.

XA_SETTIMEOUT.descriptionText: This function sets the transaction timeout in seconds for the current session.

XA_START.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XA.XA_START (
   xid   IN  DBMS_XA_XID,    flag  IN  PLS_INTEGER)  RETURN PLS_INTEGER;
XA_START.descriptionText: This function associates the current session with a transaction branch specified by the xid.
