CLOB2FILE.descriptionText: This procedure writes content of a CLOB into a file.

FREEPROCESSOR.descriptionText: This procedure Frees a Processor object.

FREESTYLESHEET.descriptionText: This procedure frees a Stylesheet object.

NEWPROCESSOR.descriptionText: This function returns a new Processor instance. The function must be called before the default behavior of Processor can be changed and if other processor methods need to be used.

NEWSTYLESHEET.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSLPROCESSOR.NEWSTYLESHEET(
   xmldoc  IN   DOMDOCUMENT,
   ref     IN   VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN Stylesheet;
NEWSTYLESHEET.descriptionText: This function creates and returns a new Stylesheet instance. The options are described in the following table.

PROCESSXSL.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSLPROCESSOR.PROCESSXSL(
   p      IN   Processor,
   ss     IN   Stylesheet,
   xmldoc IN   DOMDOCUMENT), 
 RETURN DOMDOCUMENTFRAGMENT;
PROCESSXSL.descriptionText: This function transforms input XMLDocument. Any changes to the default processor behavior should be effected before calling this procedure. An application error is raised if processing fails.

READ2CLOB.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSLPROCESSOR.READ2CLOB(
   flocation     IN   VARCHAR2,
   fname         IN   VARCHAR2,
   csid          IN   NUMBER:=0)
 RETURN CLOB;
READ2CLOB.descriptionText: This function reads content of a file into a CLOB.

REMOVEPARAM.descriptionText: This procedure removes a top level stylesheet parameter.

RESETPARAMS.descriptionText: This procedure resets the top-level stylesheet parameters.

SELECTNODES.descriptionText: This function selects nodes which match the supplied path expression from a DOM tree, and returns the result of the selection.

SELECTSINGLENODE.descriptionText: This function selects the first node from the tree that match the supplied path expression, and returns that node.

SETERRORLOG.descriptionText: This procedure sets errors to be sent to the specified file.

SETPARAM.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSLPROCESSOR.SETPARAM(
   ss      IN   Stylesheet,
   name    IN   VARCHAR2,
   value   IN   VARCHAR2);
SETPARAM.descriptionText: This procedure sets a top level parameter in the stylesheet. The parameter value must be a valid XPath expression. Literal string values must be quoted.

SHOWWARNINGS.descriptionText: This procedure turns warnings on (TRUE) or off (FALSE).

TRANSFORMNODE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSLPROCESSOR.TRANSFORMNODE(
   n    IN  DOMNODE,
   ss   IN  Stylesheet)
 RETURN DOMDocumentFragment;
TRANSFORMNODE.descriptionText: This function transforms a node in a DOM tree using the given stylesheet, and returns the result of the transformation as a DOMDocumentFragment.

VALUEOF.descriptionText: This subprogram retrieves the value of the first node from the tree that matches the given pattern. You can use either a function or a procedure.

DROP_INBOUND.descriptionText: This procedure removes an inbound server configuration.

DROP_OUTBOUND.descriptionText: This procedure removes an outbound server configuration.

ENABLE_GG_XSTREAM_FOR_STREAMS.descriptionText: This procedure enables XStream optimizations and performance optimizations for Oracle Streams components.

IS_GG_XSTREAM_FOR_STREAMS.descriptionText: This function returns TRUE if XStream performance optimizations are enabled for Oracle Streams components, or this function returns FALSE if XStream performance optimizations are disabled for Oracle Streams components.

MERGE_STREAMS_JOB.descriptionText: This procedure determines whether the original capture process and the cloned capture process are within the specified merge threshold. If they are within the merge threshold, then this procedure runs the MERGE_STREAMS procedure to merge the two streams.

PURGE_SOURCE_CATALOG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSTREAM_ADM.PURGE_SOURCE_CATALOG(

   source_object_type  IN  VARCHAR2,
   source_root_name    IN  VARCHAR2);
PURGE_SOURCE_CATALOG.descriptionText: This procedure removes all Oracle Streams data dictionary information at the local database for the specified object. You can use this procedure to remove Oracle Streams metadata that is not needed currently and will not be needed in the future.

RECOVER_OPERATION.descriptionText: This procedure provides options for split and merge operations that stopped because they encountered an errors. This procedure either rolls forward the operation, rolls back the operation, or purges all of the metadata about the operation. Split and merge operations might be run in an XStream Out environment in which multiple outbound servers use the same capture process.

REMOVE_XSTREAM_CONFIGURATION.descriptionText: This procedure removes the XStream configuration at the local database.

SET_MESSAGE_TRACKING.descriptionText: Sets the tracking label for logical change records (LCRs) produced by the current session. This procedure affects only the current session. Any LCRs produced by the current session are tracked, including captured LCRs and persistent LCRs.

SET_TAG.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSTREAM_ADM.SET_TAG(
   tag  IN RAW  DEFAULT NULL);
SET_TAG.descriptionText: This procedure sets the binary tag for all redo entries subsequently generated by the current session. Each redo entry generated by DML or DDL statements in the current session will have this tag. This procedure affects only the current session.

START_OUTBOUND.descriptionText: This procedure starts an XStream outbound server. The outbound server streams out the LCRs to an XStream client application.

STOP_OUTBOUND.descriptionText: This procedure stops an XStream outbound server. The outbound server streams out the LCRs to an XStream client application.

GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyNoDefault:
grantee => $1
	, privilege_type => $2
	, grant_select_privileges => $3
	, do_grants => $4
	, file_name => $5
	, directory_name => $6
	, grant_optional_privileges => $7
	, container => $8

   do_grants                  IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   file_name                  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   directory_name             IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL
   grant_optional_privileges  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,

GRANT_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure either grants the privileges needed by a user to be an XStream administrator directly, or generates a script that grants these privileges.

GRANT_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure enables a remote XStream administrator to perform administrative actions at the local database by connecting to the grantee using a database link.

REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyNoDefault:
grantee => $1
	, privilege_type => $2
	, revoke_select_privileges => $3
	, do_revokes => $4
	, file_name => $5
	, directory_name => $6
	, revoke_optional_privileges => $7
	, container => $8
REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.bodyFullText:
DBMS_XSTREAM_AUTH.REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE(
   grantee                     IN  VARCHAR2,  
   privilege_type              IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT '*',
   revoke_select_privileges    IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE,
   do_revokes                  IN  BOOLEAN   DEFAULT TRUE,
   file_name                   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   directory_name              IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL
   revoke_optional_privileges  IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   container                   IN  VARCHAR2  DEFAULT 'CURRENT');
REVOKE_ADMIN_PRIVILEGE.descriptionText: This procedure either revokes XStream administrator privileges from a user directly, or generates a script that revokes these privileges.

REVOKE_REMOTE_ADMIN_ACCESS.descriptionText: This procedure disables a remote XStream administrator from performing administrative actions by connecting to the grantee using a database link.

STARTUP_EXTPROC_AGENT.descriptionText: This procedure starts up the extproc agent process in the session.This enables you to get the PID of the executing process. This PID is needed to be able to attach to the running process using a debugger.

ADDRESS.bodyFullText:
HTF.ADDRESS (
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
ADDRESS.descriptionText: This function generates the <ADDRESS> and </ADDRESS> tags which specify the address, author and signature of a document.

ANCHOR.bodyFullText:
HTF.ANCHOR (
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
ANCHOR.descriptionText: This function and the ANCHOR2 Function functions generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that the ANCHOR2 Function provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

ANCHOR2.bodyFullText:
HTF.ANCHOR2 (
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ctarget        in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
ANCHOR2.descriptionText: This function and the ANCHOR Function generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that this functions provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

APPLETCLOSE.descriptionText: This function closes the applet invocation with the </APPLET> tag. You must first invoke the a Java applet using APPLETOPEN Function

APPLETOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.APPLETOPEN (
   ccode          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cheight        IN       NUMBER,
   cwidth         IN       NUMBER,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
APPLETOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <APPLET> tag which begins the invocation of a Java applet. You close the applet invocation with APPLETCLOSE Function which generates the </APPLET> tag.

AREA.bodyFullText:
HTF.AREA (
   ccoords        IN       VARCHAR2
   cshape         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   chref          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnohref        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
AREA.descriptionText: This function generates the <AREA> tag, which defines a client-side image map. The <AREA> tag defines areas within the image and destinations for the areas.

BASE.bodyFullText:
HTF.BASE (
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BASE.descriptionText: This function generates the <BASE> tag which records the URL of the document.

BASEFONT.descriptionText: This function generates the <BASEFONT> tag which specifies the base font size for a Web page.

BGSOUND.bodyFullText:
HTF.BGSOUND (
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cloop          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BGSOUND.descriptionText: This function generates the <BGSOUND> tag which includes audio for a Web page.

BIG.bodyFullText:
HTF.BIG (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BIG.descriptionText: This function generates the <BIG> and </BIG> tags which direct the browser to render the text in a bigger font.

BLOCKQUOTECLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which mark the end of a section of quoted text. You mark the beginning of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTEOPEN Function.

BLOCKQUOTEOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.BLOCKQUOTEOPEN (
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BLOCKQUOTEOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <BLOCKQUOTE> tag, which marks the beginning of a section of quoted text. You mark the end of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTECLOSE Function.

BODYCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </BODY> tag which marks the end of a body section of an HTML document.You mark the beginning of a body section by means of the BODYOPEN Function.

BODYOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.BODYOPEN (
   cbackground    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BODYOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <BODY> tag which marks the beginning of the body section of an HTML document. You mark the end of a body section by means of the BODYCLOSE Function.

BOLD.bodyFullText:
HTF.BOLD (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BOLD.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which direct the browser to display the text in boldface.

BR.bodyFullText:
HTF.BR(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
BR.descriptionText:
This function generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the NL Function.

CENTER.descriptionText: This function generates the <CENTER> and </CENTER> tags which center a section of text within a Web page.

CENTERCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </CENTER> tag which marks the end of a section of text to center. You mark the beginning of a of a section of text to center by means of the CENTEROPEN Function.

CENTEROPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <CENTER> tag which mark the beginning of a section of text to center.You mark the beginning of a of a section of text to center by means of the CENTERCLOSE Function.

CITE.bodyFullText:
HTF.CITE (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
CITE.descriptionText: This function generates the <CITE> and </CITE> tags which direct the browser to render the text as a citation.

CODE.bodyFullText:
HTF.CODE (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
CODE.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font or however "code" is defined stylistically.

COMMENT.descriptionText: This function generates the comment tags.

DFN.descriptionText: This function generates the <DFN> and </DFN> tags which direct the browser to mark the text in italics or however "definition" is described stylistically.

DIRLISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </DIR> tag which ends a directory list section. You start a directory list section with the DIRLISTOPEN Function.

DIRLISTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <DIR> which starts a directory list section. You end a directory list section with the DIRLISTCLOSE Function.

DIV.bodyFullText:
HTF.DIV (
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
DIV.descriptionText: This function generates the <DIV> tag which creates document divisions.

DLISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </DL> tag which ends a definition list. You start a definition list by means of the DLISTOPEN Function.

DLISTDEF.bodyFullText:
HTF.DLISTDEF (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
DLISTDEF.descriptionText: This function generates the <DD> tag, which inserts definitions of terms. Use this tag for a definition list <DL>. Terms are tagged <DT> and definitions are tagged <DD>.

DLISTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.DLISTOPEN (
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
DLISTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <DL> tag which starts a definition list. You end a definition list by means of the DLISTCLOSE Function.

DLISTTERM.bodyFullText:
HTF.DLISTTERM (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
DLISTTERM.descriptionText: This function generates the <DT> tag which defines a term in a definition list <DL>.

EM.bodyFullText:
HTF.EM(
     ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
     cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
EM.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags, which define text to be emphasized. It performs the same task as the EMPHASIS Function.

EMPHASIS.bodyFullText:
HTF.EMPHASIS(
     ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
     cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
EMPHASIS.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags, which define text to be emphasized. It performs the same task as the EM Function.

ESCAPE_SC.descriptionText: This function replaces characters that have special meaning in HTML with their escape sequences. The following characters are converted:

ESCAPE_URL.descriptionText: This function replaces characters that have special meaning in HTML and HTTP with their escape sequences. The following characters are converted:

FONTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the</FONT> tag which marks the end of a section of text with the specified font characteristics. You mark the beginning of the section text by means of the FONTOPEN Function.

FONTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.FONTOPEN(
   ccolor         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cface          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FONTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <FONT> which marks the beginning of section of text with the specified font characteristics. You mark the end of the section text by means of the FONTCLOSE Function.

FORMAT_CELL.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMAT_CELL(
   columnValue          IN       VARCHAR2
   format_numbers       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL 
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMAT_CELL.descriptionText: This function formats column values inside an HTML table using the TABLEDATA Function. It allows for better control over the HTML tables.

FORMCHECKBOX.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMCHECKBOX(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'ON',
   cchecked       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMCHECKBOX.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="checkbox" which inserts a checkbox element in a form. A checkbox element is a button that the user toggles on or off.

FORMCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </FORM> tag which marks the end of a form section in an HTML document.You mark the beginning of the form section by means of the FORMOPEN Function.

FORMFILE.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMFILE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   caccept        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMFILE.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="file" which inserts a file form element. This is used for file uploading for a given page.

FORMHIDDEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMHIDDEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMHIDDEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="hidden", which inserts a hidden form element. This element is not seen by the user. It submits additional values to the script.

FORMIMAGE.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMIMAGE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMIMAGE.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="image" which creates an image field that the user clicks to submit the form immediately. The coordinates of the selected point are measured in pixels, and returned (along with other contents of the form) in two name/value pairs. The x coordinate is submitted under the name of the field with .x appended, and the y coordinate with .y appended. Any VALUE attribute is ignored.

FORMOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMOPEN(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cmethod        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'POST',
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cenctype       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <FORM> tag which marks the beginning of a form section in an HTML document. You mark the end of the form section by means of the FORMCLOSE Function.

FORMPASSWORD.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMPASSWORD(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cmaxlength     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMPASSWORD.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="password" which creates a single-line text entry field. When the user enters text in the field, each character is represented by one asterisk. This is used for entering passwords.

FORMRADIO.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMRADIO(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cchecked       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMRADIO.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="radio", which creates a radio button on the HTML form. Within a set of radio buttons, the user selects only one. Each radio button in the same set has the same name, but different values. The selected radio button generates a name/value pair.

FORMRESET.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMRESET(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'Reset',
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMRESET.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="reset" which creates a button that, when selected, resets the form fields to their initial values.

FORMSELECTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </SELECT> tag which marks the end of a Select form element. A Select form element is a listbox where the user selects one or more values. You mark the beginning of Select form element by means of the FORMSELECTOPEN Function.The values are inserted using FORMSELECTOPTION Function.

FORMSELECTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMSELECTOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cprompt        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   nsize          IN       INTEGER    DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMSELECTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <SELECT> tags which begins a Select form element. A Select form element is a listbox where the user selects one or more values. You mark the end of Select form element by means of the FORMSELECTCLOSE Function.The values are inserted using FORMSELECTOPTION Function.

FORMSELECTOPTION.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMSELECTOPTION(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cselected      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMSELECTOPTION.descriptionText: This function generates the <OPTION> tag which represents one choice in a Select element.

FORMSUBMIT.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMSUBMIT(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'Submit',
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMSUBMIT.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="submit" which creates a button that, when clicked, submits the form. If the button has a NAME attribute, the button contributes a name/value pair to the submitted data.

FORMTEXT.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMTEXT(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmaxlength     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMTEXT.descriptionText: This function generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="text", which creates a field for a single line of text.

FORMTEXTAREA.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMTEXTAREA(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMTEXTAREA.descriptionText: This function generates the <TEXTAREA> tag, which creates a text field that has no predefined text in the text area. This field enables entering several lines of text. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREA2 Function which in addition has the cwrap parameter that lets you specify a wrap style.

FORMTEXTAREA2.bodyNoDefault:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cwrap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
FORMTEXTAREA2.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMTEXTAREA2(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMTEXTAREA2.descriptionText: This function generates the <TEXTAREA> tag, which creates a text field that has no predefined text in the text area. This field enables entering several lines of text.The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREA Function except that in that case you cannot specify a wrap style.

FORMTEXTAREACLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </TEXTAREA> tag which ends a text area form element. You open a text area element by means of eitherFORMTEXTAREAOPEN Function or FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2 Function.

FORMTEXTAREAOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMTEXTAREAOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMTEXTAREAOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <TEXTAREA> which marks the beginning of a text area form element. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2 Function which in addition has the cwrap parameter that lets you specify a wrap style. You mark the end of a text area form element by means of the FORMTEXTAREACLOSE Function.

FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2.bodyNoDefault:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cwrap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2.bodyFullText:
HTF.FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2.descriptionText: This function generates the <TEXTAREA> which marks the beginning of a text area form element. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREAOPEN Function except that in that case you cannot specify a wrap style. You mark the end of a text area form element by means of the FORMTEXTAREACLOSE Function.

FRAME.bodyNoDefault:
csrc => $1
	, cname => $2
	, cmarginwidth => $3
	, cmarginheight => $4
	, cscrolling => $5
	, cnoresize => $6
	, cattributes => $7
FRAME.bodyFullText:
HTF.FRAME(
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmarginwidth   IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmarginheight  IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cscrolling     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnoresize      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FRAME.descriptionText: This function generates the <FRAME> tag which begins the characteristics of a frame created by a <FRAMESET> tag.

FRAMESETCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </FRAMESET> tag which ends a frameset section. You mark the beginning of a frameset section by means of the FRAMESETOPEN Function.

FRAMESETOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.FRAMESETOPEN(
   crows          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccols          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
FRAMESETOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <FRAMESET> tag which define a frameset section. You mark the end of a frameset section by means of the FRAMESETCLOSE Function.

HEADCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </HEAD> tag which marks the end of an HTML document head section. You mark the beginning of an HTML document head section by means of the HEADOPEN Function.

HEADER.bodyNoDefault:
nsize => $1
	, cheader => $2
	, calign => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, cclear => $5
	, cattributes => $6
HEADER.bodyFullText:
HTF.HEADER(
   nsize          IN       INTEGER,
   cheader        IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
HEADER.descriptionText:
This function generates opening heading tags (

to

) and their corresponding closing tags (
to ).

HEADOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <HEAD> tag which marks the beginning of the HTML document head section. You mark the end of an HTML document head section by means of the HEADCLOSE Function.

HR.bodyFullText:
HTF.HR(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
HR.descriptionText: This function generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document.This subprogram performs the same operation as the LINE Function.

HTMLCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </HTML> tag which marks the end of an HTML document. You use the HTMLOPEN Function to mark the beginning of an HTML document.

HTMLOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <HTML> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML document. You use the HTMLCLOSE Function to mark the end of the an HTML document.

IMG.bodyFullText:
HTF.IMG(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
IMG.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG2 Function performs the same operation but additionally uses the cusemap parameter.

IMG2.bodyNoDefault:
curl => $1
	, calign => $2
	, calt => $3
	, cismap => $4
	, cusemap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
IMG2.bodyFullText:
HTF.IMG2(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cusemap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
IMG2.descriptionText: This function generates the tag, which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG Function performs the same operation but does not use the cusemap parameter.

ISINDEX.bodyFullText:
HTF.ISINDEX(
   cprompt        IN       VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
ISINDEX.descriptionText: This function creates a single entry field with a prompting text, such as "enter value," then sends that value to the URL of the page or program.

ITALIC.bodyFullText:
HTF.ITALIC(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
ITALIC.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in italics.

KBD.bodyFullText:
HTF.KBD(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
KBD.descriptionText: This function generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KEYBOARD Function.

KEYBOARD.bodyFullText:
HTF.KEYBOARD(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
KEYBOARD.descriptionText: This function generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags, which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KBD Function.

LINE.bodyFullText:
HTF.LINE(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
LINE.descriptionText: This function generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document. This subprogram performs the same operation as the HR Function.

LINKREL.bodyFullText:
HTF.LINKREL(
   crel           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
LINKREL.descriptionText: This function generates the <LINK> tag with the REL attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the anchor to the target. This is only used when the HREF attribute is present. This is the opposite of LINKREV Function. This tag indicates a relationship between documents but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Function.

LINKREV.bodyFullText:
HTF.LINKREV(
   crev           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
LINKREV.descriptionText: This function generates the <LINK> tag with the REV attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the target to the anchor. This is the opposite of the LINKREL Function. This tag indicates a relationship between documents, but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Function.

LISTHEADER.bodyFullText:
HTF.LISTHEADER(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
LISTHEADER.descriptionText: This function generates the <LH> and </LH> tags which print an HTML tag at the beginning of the list.

LISTINGCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </LISTING> tags which marks the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGOPEN Function.

LISTINGOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <LISTING> tag which marks the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGCLOSE Function.

LISTITEM.bodyFullText:
HTF.LISTITEM(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
LISTITEM.descriptionText: This function generates the <LI> tag, which indicates a list item.

MAILTO.bodyFullText:
HTF.MAILTO(
   caddress       IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
MAILTO.descriptionText: This function generates the <A> tag with the HREF set to\'mailt\' prepended to the mail address argument.

MAPCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </MAP> tag which marks the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPOPEN Function.

MAPOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.MAPOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
MAPOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <MAP> tag which mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPCLOSE Function.

MENULISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </MENU> tag which ends a list that presents one line for each item. To begin a list of this kind, use the MENULISTOPEN Function. The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Function defines the list items in a menu list.

MENULISTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <MENU> tag which begins a list that presents one line for each item. To end a list of this kind, use the MENULISTCLOSE Function.The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Function defines the list items in a menu list.

META.bodyFullText:
HTF.META(
   chttp_equiv    IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   ccontent       IN       VARCHAR2)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
META.descriptionText: This function generates the <META> tag, which embeds meta-information about the document and also specifies values for HTTP headers. For example, you can specify the expiration date, keywords, and author name.

NL.bodyFullText:
HTF.NL(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
NL.descriptionText:
This function generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the BR Function.

NOBR.descriptionText: This function generates the <NOBR> and </NOBR> tags which turn off line-breaking in a section of text.

NOFRAMESCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </NOFRAMES> tag which marks the end of a no-frames section. To mark the beginning of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETOPEN Function. See also FRAME Function, FRAMESETOPEN Function and FRAMESETCLOSE Function.

NOFRAMESOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <NOFRAMES> tag which mark the beginning of a no-frames section. To mark the end of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETCLOSE Function. See also FRAME Function, FRAMESETOPEN Function and FRAMESETCLOSE Function.

OLISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which defines the end of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the beginning of a list of this kind, use the OLISTOPEN Function. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Function.

OLISTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.OLISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
OLISTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <OL> tag which marks the beginning of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the end of a list of this kind, use the OLISTCLOSE Function. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Function.

PARA.descriptionText:
This function generates the

tag which indicates that the text that comes after the tag is to be formatted as a paragraph. You can add attributes to the tag by means of the PARAGRAPH Function.

PARAGRAPH.bodyFullText:
HTF.PARAGRAPH(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
PARAGRAPH.descriptionText:
You can use this function to add attributes to the

tag created by the PARA Function.

PARAM.bodyFullText:
HTF.PARAM(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
PARAM.descriptionText: This function generates the <PARAM> tag which specifies parameter values for Java applets. The values can reference HTML variables. To invoke a Java applet from a Web page, use APPLETOPEN Function to begin the invocation. Use one PARAM Function for each desired name-value pair, and use APPLETCLOSE Function to end the applet invocation.

PLAINTEXT.bodyFullText:
HTF.PLAINTEXT(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
PLAINTEXT.descriptionText: This function generates the <PLAINTEXT> and </PLAINTEXT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in fixed-width type.

PRECLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which marks the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PREOPEN Function.

PREOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.PREOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwidth         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
PREOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <PRE> tag which marks the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PRECLOSE Function.

PRINT.descriptionText: These functions generate the specified parameter as a string terminated with the\\ newline character. The PRN Functions performs the same operation but does not terminate with a newline character.

PRN.descriptionText: These functions generate the specified parameter as a string. Unlike the PRINT Functions the string is not terminated with the\\ newline character.

S.bodyFullText:
HTF.S (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
S.descriptionText: This function generates the <S> and </S> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as STRIKE Function.

SAMPLE.bodyFullText:
HTF.SAMPLE (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
SAMPLE.descriptionText: This function generates the <SAMP> and </SAMP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in monospace font or however "sample" is defined stylistically.

SCRIPT.bodyFullText:
HTF.SCRIPT (
   cscript        IN       VARCHAR2,
   clanguage      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
SCRIPT.descriptionText: This function generates the <SCRIPT> and </SCRIPT> tags which contain a script written in languages such as JavaScript and VBscript.

SMALL.bodyFullText:
HTF.SMALL (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
SMALL.descriptionText: This function generates the <SMALL> and </SMALL> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround using a small font.

STRIKE.bodyFullText:
STRIKE (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
STRIKE.descriptionText: This function generates the <STRIKE> and </STRIKE> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as S Function.

STRONG.bodyFullText:
HTF.STRONG(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
STRONG.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in bold or however "strong" is defined.

STYLE.descriptionText: This function generates the <STYLE> and </STYLE> tags which include a style sheet in a Web page. You can get more information about style sheets at http://www.w3.org. This feature is not compatible with browsers that support only HTML versions 2.0 or earlier. Such browsers will ignore this tag.

SUB.bodyFullText:
HTF.SUB(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
SUB.descriptionText: This function generates the <SUB> and </SUB> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as subscript.

SUP.bodyFullText:
HTF.SUP(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
SUP.descriptionText: This function generates the <SUP> and </SUP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as superscript.

TABLECAPTION.bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLECAPTION(
   ccaption       IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
TABLECAPTION.descriptionText: This function generates the <CAPTION> and </CAPTION> tags which place a caption in an HTML table.

TABLECLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which marks the end of an HTML table. To define the beginning of an HTML table, use the TABLEOPEN Function.

TABLEDATA.bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2
	, cdp => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
TABLEDATA.bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEDATA(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   crowspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccolspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
TABLEDATA.descriptionText: This function generates the and tags which insert data into a cell of an HTML table.

TABLEHEADER.bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2
	, cdp => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
TABLEHEADER.bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEHEADER(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   crowspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccolspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
TABLEHEADER.descriptionText: This function generates the <TH> and </TH> tags which insert a header cell in an HTML table. The <TH> tag is similar to the <TD> tag except that the text in this case the rows are usually rendered in bold type.

TABLEOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEOPEN(
   cborder        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
TABLEOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <TABLE> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML table. To define the end of an HTML table, use the TABLECLOSE Function.

TABLEROWCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the </TR> tag which marks the end of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the beginning of a new row, use the TABLEROWOPEN Function.

TABLEROWOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.TABLEROWOPEN(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalign        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
TABLEROWOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <TR> tag which marks the beginning of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the end of a new row, use the TABLEROWCLOSE Function.

TELETYPE.bodyFullText:
HTF.TELETYPE(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
TELETYPE.descriptionText: This function generates the <TT> and </TT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in a fixed width typewriter font, for example, the courier font.

TITLE.descriptionText: This function generates the <TITLE> and </TITLE> tags which specify the text to display in the titlebar of the browser window.

ULISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This function generates the tag which marks the end of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the beginning of an unordered list, use the ULISTOPEN Function. Add list items with LISTITEM Function.

ULISTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTF.ULISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
ULISTOPEN.descriptionText: This function generates the <UL> tag which marks the beginning of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the end of an unordered list, use the ULISTCLOSE Function. Add list items with LISTITEM Function.

UNDERLINE.bodyFullText:
HTF.UNDERLINE(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
UNDERLINE.descriptionText: This function generates the <U> and </U> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround with an underline.

VARIABLE.bodyFullText:
HTF.VARIABLE(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN VARCHAR2;
VARIABLE.descriptionText: This function generates the <VAR> and </VAR> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in italics or however "variable" is defined stylistically.

WBR.descriptionText: This function generates the <WBR> tag, which inserts a soft line break within a section of NOBR text.

VALIDATE_FORMAT.bodyFullText:
HTF.VALIDATE_FORMAT(
        HASPLANSTATS IN PL/SQL BOOLEAN 
        FORMAT IN VARCHAR2 
        FORMAT_FLAGS OUT NUMBER 
)
return PL/SQL

HTITLE.bodyNoDefault:
CTITLE => $1
	, NSIZE => $2
	, CALIGN => $3
	, CNOWRAP => $4
	, CCLEAR => $5
	, CATTRIBUTES => $6

ADDRESS.bodyFullText:
HTP.ADDRESS (
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
ADDRESS.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <ADDRESS> and </ADDRESS> tags which specify the address, author and signature of a document.

ANCHOR.bodyFullText:
HTP.ANCHOR (
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
ANCHOR.descriptionText: This procedure and the ANCHOR2 Procedure procedures generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that the ANCHOR2 Procedure provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

ANCHOR2.bodyFullText:
HTP.ANCHOR2 (
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ctarget        in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
ANCHOR2.descriptionText: This procedure and the ANCHOR Procedure generate the and HTML tags which specify the source or destination of a hypertext link. The difference between these subprograms is that this procedures provides a target and therefore can be used for a frame.

APPLETCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure closes the applet invocation with the </APPLET> tag. You must first invoke the a Java applet using APPLETOPEN Procedure.

APPLETOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.APPLETOPEN (
   ccode          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cheight        IN       NUMBER,
   cwidth         IN       NUMBER,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
APPLETOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <APPLET> tag which begins the invocation of a Java applet. You close the applet invocation with APPLETCLOSE Procedure which generates the </APPLET> tag.

AREA.bodyFullText:
HTP.AREA (
   ccoords        IN       VARCHAR2
   cshape         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   chref          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnohref        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
AREA.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <AREA> tag, which defines a client-side image map. The <AREA> tag defines areas within the image and destinations for the areas.

BASE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BASE> tag which records the URL of the document.

BASEFONT.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BASEFONT> tag which specifies the base font size for a Web page.

BGSOUND.bodyFullText:
HTP.BGSOUND (
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cloop          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
BGSOUND.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BGSOUND> tag which includes audio for a Web page.

BIG.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BIG> and </BIG> tags which direct the browser to render the text in a bigger font.

BLOCKQUOTECLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which mark the end of a section of quoted text. You mark the beginning of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTEOPEN Procedure.

BLOCKQUOTEOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.BLOCKQUOTEOPEN (
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
BLOCKQUOTEOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BLOCKQUOTE> tag, which marks the beginning of a section of quoted text. You mark the end of a section of text by means of the BLOCKQUOTECLOSE Procedure.

BODYCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </BODY> tag which marks the end of a body section of an HTML document.You mark the beginning of a body section by means of the BODYOPEN Procedure.

BODYOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <BODY> tag which marks the beginning of the body section of an HTML document. You mark the end of a body section by means of the BODYCLOSE Procedure.

BOLD.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to display the text in boldface.

BR.descriptionText:
This procedure generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the NL Procedure.

CENTER.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CENTER> and </CENTER> tags which center a section of text within a Web page.

CENTERCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </CENTER> tag which marks the end of a section of text to center. You mark the beginning of a of a section of text to center by means of the CENTEROPEN Procedure.

CENTEROPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CENTER> tag which mark the beginning of a section of text to center.You mark the beginning of a of a section of text to center by means of the CENTERCLOSE Procedure.

CITE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CITE> and </CITE> tags which direct the browser to render the text as a citation.

CODE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font or however "code" is defined stylistically.

COMMENT.descriptionText: This procedure generates the comment tags.

DFN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DFN> and </DFN> tags which direct the browser to mark the text in italics or however "definition" is described stylistically.

DIRLISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </DIR> tag which ends a directory list section. You start a directory list section with the DIRLISTOPEN Procedure.

DIRLISTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DIR> which starts a directory list section. You end a directory list section with the DIRLISTCLOSE Procedure.

DIV.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DIV> tag which creates document divisions.

DLISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </DL> tag which ends a definition list. You start a definition list by means of the DLISTOPEN Procedure.

DLISTDEF.bodyFullText:
HTP.DLISTDEF (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
DLISTDEF.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DD> tag, which inserts definitions of terms. Use this tag for a definition list <DL>. Terms are tagged <DT> and definitions are tagged <DD>.

DLISTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DL> tag which starts a definition list. You end a definition list by means of the DLISTCLOSE Procedure.

DLISTTERM.bodyFullText:
HTP.DLISTTERM (
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
DLISTTERM.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <DT> tag which defines a term in a definition list <DL>.

EM.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags, which define text to be emphasized. It performs the same task as the EMPHASIS Procedure.

EMPHASIS.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags, which define text to be emphasized. It performs the same task as the EM Procedure.

ESCAPE_SC.descriptionText: This procedure replaces characters that have special meaning in HTML with their escape sequences. The following characters are converted:

FONTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the</FONT> tag which marks the end of a section of text with the specified font characteristics. You mark the beginning of the section text by means of the FONTOPEN Procedure.

FONTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.FONTOPEN(
   ccolor         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cface          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FONTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FONT> which marks the beginning of section of text with the specified font characteristics. You mark the end of the section text by means of the FONTCLOSE Procedure.

FORMCHECKBOX.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMCHECKBOX(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'ON',
   cchecked       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMCHECKBOX.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="checkbox" which inserts a checkbox element in a form. A checkbox element is a button that the user toggles on or off.

FORMCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </FORM> tag which marks the end of a form section in an HTML document.You mark the beginning of the form section by means of the FORMOPEN Procedure.

FORMFILE.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMFILE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   caccept        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMFILE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="file" which inserts a file form element. This is used for file uploading for a given page.

FORMHIDDEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMHIDDEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMHIDDEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="hidden", which inserts a hidden form element. This element is not seen by the user. It submits additional values to the script.

FORMIMAGE.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMIMAGE(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMIMAGE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="image" which creates an image field that the user clicks to submit the form immediately. The coordinates of the selected point are measured in pixels, and returned (along with other contents of the form) in two name/value pairs. The x coordinate is submitted under the name of the field with .x appended, and the y coordinate with .y appended. Any VALUE attribute is ignored.

FORMOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMOPEN(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cmethod        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'POST',
   ctarget        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cenctype       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FORM> tag which marks the beginning of a form section in an HTML document. You mark the end of the form section by means of the FORMCLOSE Procedure.

FORMPASSWORD.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMPASSWORD(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cmaxlength     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMPASSWORD.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="password" which creates a single-line text entry field. When the user enters text in the field, each character is represented by one asterisk. This is used for entering passwords.

FORMRADIO.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMRADIO(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cchecked       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMRADIO.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="radio", which creates a radio button on the HTML form. Within a set of radio buttons, the user selects only one. Each radio button in the same set has the same name, but different values. The selected radio button generates a name/value pair.

FORMRESET.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="reset" which creates a button that, when selected, resets the form fields to their initial values.

FORMSELECTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </SELECT> tag which marks the end of a Select form element. A Select form element is a listbox where the user selects one or more values. You mark the beginning of Select form element by means of the FORMSELECTOPEN Procedure.The values are inserted using FORMSELECTOPTION Procedure.

FORMSELECTOPEN.bodyFullText:
FORMSELECTOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cprompt        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   nsize          IN       INTEGER    DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMSELECTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SELECT> tags which creates a Select form element. A Select form element is a listbox where the user selects one or more values. You mark the end of Select form element by means of the FORMSELECTCLOSE Procedure.The values are inserted using FORMSELECTOPTION Procedure.

FORMSELECTOPTION.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMSELECTOPTION(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cselected      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMSELECTOPTION.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <OPTION> tag which represents one choice in a Select element.

FORMSUBMIT.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMSUBMIT(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'Submit',
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMSUBMIT.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="submit" which creates a button that, when clicked, submits the form. If the button has a NAME attribute, the button contributes a name/value pair to the submitted data.

FORMTEXT.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXT(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   csize          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmaxlength     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMTEXT.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <INPUT> tag with TYPE="text", which creates a field for a single line of text.

FORMTEXTAREA.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREA(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign      , IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMTEXTAREA.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> tag, which creates a text field that has no predefined text in the text area. This field enables entering several lines of text. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREA2 Procedure which in addition has the cwrap parameter that lets you specify a wrap style.

FORMTEXTAREA2.bodyNoDefault:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cwrap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
FORMTEXTAREA2.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREA2(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMTEXTAREA2.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> tag, which creates a text field that has no predefined text in the text area. This field enables entering several lines of text.The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREA Procedure except that in that case you cannot specify a wrap style.

FORMTEXTAREACLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </TEXTAREA> tag which ends a text area form element. You open a text area element by means of eitherFORMTEXTAREAOPEN Procedure or FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2 Procedure.

FORMTEXTAREAOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREAOPEN(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMTEXTAREAOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> which marks the beginning of a text area form element. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2 Procedure which in addition has the cwrap parameter that lets you specify a wrap style. You mark the end of a text area form element by means of the FORMTEXTAREACLOSE Procedure.

FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2.bodyNoDefault:
cname => $1
	, nrows => $2
	, ncolumns => $3
	, calign => $4
	, cwrap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2.bodyFullText:
HTP.FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2(
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   nrows          IN       INTEGER,
   ncolumns       IN       INTEGER,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FORMTEXTAREAOPEN2.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TEXTAREA> which marks the beginning of a text area form element. The same operation is performed by the FORMTEXTAREAOPEN Procedure except that in that case you cannot specify a wrap style. You mark the end of a text area form element by means of the FORMTEXTAREACLOSE Procedure.

FRAME.bodyNoDefault:
csrc => $1
	, cname => $2
	, cmarginwidth => $3
	, cmarginheight => $4
	, cscrolling => $5
	, cnoresize => $6
	, cattributes => $7
FRAME.bodyFullText:
HTP.FRAME(
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmarginwidth   IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cmarginheight  IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cscrolling     IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnoresize      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FRAME.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FRAME> tag which begins the characteristics of a frame created by a <FRAMESET> tag.

FRAMESETCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </FRAMESET> tag which ends a frameset section. You mark the beginning of a frameset section by means of the FRAMESETOPEN Procedure.

FRAMESETOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.FRAMESETOPEN(
   crows          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccols          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
FRAMESETOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <FRAMESET> tag which define a frameset section. You mark the end of a frameset section by means of the FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure.

HEADCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </HEAD> tag which marks the end of an HTML document head section. You mark the beginning of an HTML document head section by means of the HEADOPEN Procedure.

HEADER.bodyNoDefault:
nsize => $1
	, cheader => $2
	, calign => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, cclear => $5
	, cattributes => $6
HEADER.bodyFullText:
HTP.HEADER(
   nsize          IN       INTEGER,
   cheader        IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
HEADER.descriptionText:
This procedure generates opening heading tags (

to

) and their corresponding closing tags (
to ).

HEADOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HEAD> tag which marks the beginning of the HTML document head section. You mark the end of an HTML document head section by means of the HEADCLOSE Procedure.

HR.bodyFullText:
HTP.HR(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
HR.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document.This subprogram performs the same operation as the LINE Procedure.

HTMLCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </HTML> tag which marks the end of an HTML document. You use the HTMLOPEN Procedure to mark the beginning of an HTML document.

HTMLOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HTML> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML document. You use the HTMLCLOSE Procedure to mark the end of the an HTML document.

IMG.bodyFullText:
HTP.IMG(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
IMG.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG2 Procedure performs the same operation but additionally uses the cusemap parameter.

IMG2.bodyNoDefault:
curl => $1
	, calign => $2
	, calt => $3
	, cismap => $4
	, cusemap => $5
	, cattributes => $6
IMG2.bodyFullText:
HTP.IMG2(
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calt           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cismap         IN       VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   cusemap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
IMG2.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag, which directs the browser to load an image onto the HTML page. The IMG Procedure performs the same operation but does not use the cusemap parameter.

ISINDEX.descriptionText: This procedure creates a single entry field with a prompting text, such as "enter value," then sends that value to the URL of the page or program.

ITALIC.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text in italics.

KBD.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KEYBOARD Procedure.

KEYBOARD.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <KBD> and </KBD> tags, which direct the browser to render the text in monospace font. This subprogram performs the same operation as the KBD Procedure.

LINE.bodyFullText:
HTP.LINE(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
LINE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <HR> tag, which generates a line in the HTML document. This subprogram performs the same operation as the HR Procedure.

LINKREL.bodyFullText:
HTP.LINKREL(
   crel           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
LINKREL.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LINK> tag with the REL attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the anchor to the target. This is only used when the HREF attribute is present. This is the opposite of LINKREV Procedure. This tag indicates a relationship between documents but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Procedure.

LINKREV.bodyFullText:
HTP.LINKREV(
   crev           IN       VARCHAR2,
   curl           IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctitle         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
LINKREV.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LINK> tag with the REV attribute which delineates the relationship described by the hypertext link from the target to the anchor. This is the opposite of the LINKREL Procedure. This tag indicates a relationship between documents, but does not create a link. To create a link, use the ANCHOR Procedure.

LISTHEADER.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LH> and </LH> tags which print an HTML tag at the beginning of the list.

LISTINGCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </LISTING> tags which marks the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGOPEN Procedure.

LISTINGOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LISTING> tag which marks the beginning of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page. To mark the end of a section of fixed-width text in the body of an HTML page, use the LISTINGCLOSE Procedure.

LISTITEM.bodyFullText:
HTP.LISTITEM(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
LISTITEM.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <LI> tag, which indicates a list item.

MAILTO.bodyFullText:
HTP.MAILTO(
   caddress       IN       VARCHAR2,
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
MAILTO.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <A> tag with the HREF set to\'mailt\' prepended to the mail address argument.

MAPCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </MAP> tag which marks the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPOPEN Procedure.

MAPOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <MAP> tag which mark the beginning of a set of regions in a client-side image map. To mark the end of a set of regions in a client-side image map, use the MAPCLOSE Procedure.

MENULISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </MENU> tag which ends a list that presents one line for each item. To begin a list of this kind, use the MENULISTOPEN Procedure. The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Procedure defines the list items in a menu list.

MENULISTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <MENU> tag which begins a list that presents one line for each item. To end a list of this kind, use the MENULISTCLOSE Procedure.The items in the list appear more compact than an unordered list. The LISTITEM Procedure defines the list items in a menu list.

META.bodyFullText:
HTP.META(
   chttp_equiv    IN       VARCHAR2,
   cname          IN       VARCHAR2,
   ccontent       IN       VARCHAR2);
META.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <META> tag, which embeds meta-information about the document and also specifies values for HTTP headers. For example, you can specify the expiration date, keywords, and author name.

NL.descriptionText:
This procedure generates the
tag which begins a new line of text. It performs the same operation as the BR Procedure.

NOBR.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <NOBR> and </NOBR> tags which turn off line-breaking in a section of text.

NOFRAMESCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </NOFRAMES> tag which marks the end of a no-frames section. To mark the beginning of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETOPEN Procedure. See also FRAME Procedure, FRAMESETOPEN Procedure and FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure.

NOFRAMESOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <NOFRAMES> tag which mark the beginning of a no-frames section. To mark the end of a no-frames section, use the FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure. See also FRAME Procedure, FRAMESETOPEN Procedure and FRAMESETCLOSE Procedure.

OLISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which defines the end of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the beginning of a list of this kind, use the OLISTOPEN Procedure. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Procedure.

OLISTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.OLISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
OLISTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <OL> tag which marks the beginning of an ordered list. An ordered list presents a list of numbered items. To mark the end of a list of this kind, use the OLISTCLOSE Procedure. Numbered items are added using LISTITEM Procedure.

PARA.descriptionText:
This procedure generates the

tag which indicates that the text that comes after the tag is to be formatted as a paragraph. You can add attributes to the tag by means of the PARAGRAPH Procedure.

PARAGRAPH.bodyFullText:
HTP.PARAGRAPH(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
PARAGRAPH.descriptionText:
You can use this procedure to add attributes to the

tag created by the PARA Procedure.

PARAM.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <PARAM> tag which specifies parameter values for Java applets. The values can reference HTML variables. To invoke a Java applet from a Web page, use APPLETOPEN Procedure to begin the invocation. Use one PARAM Procedure for each desired name-value pair, and use APPLETCLOSE Procedure to end the applet invocation.

PLAINTEXT.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <PLAINTEXT> and </PLAINTEXT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in fixed-width type.

PRECLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which marks the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PREOPEN Procedure.

PREOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.PREOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwidth         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
