PREOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <PRE> tag which marks the beginning of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page. To mark the end of a section of preformatted text in the body of the HTML page, use the PRECLOSE Procedure.

PRINT.descriptionText: These procedures generate the specified parameter as a string terminated with the\\ newline character. The PRN Procedures performs the same operation but does not terminate with a newline character.

PRINTS.descriptionText: This procedure generates a string and replaces the following characters with the corresponding escape sequence.

PRN.descriptionText: These procedures generate the specified parameter as a string. Unlike the PRINT Procedures the string is not terminated with the\\ newline character.

PS.descriptionText: This procedure generates a string and replaces the following characters with the corresponding escape sequence.

S.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <S> and </S> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as STRIKE Procedure.

SAMPLE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SAMP> and </SAMP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in monospace font or however "sample" is defined stylistically.

SCRIPT.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SCRIPT> and </SCRIPT> tags which contain a script written in languages such as JavaScript and VBscript.

SMALL.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SMALL> and </SMALL> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround using a small font.

STRIKE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <STRIKE> and </STRIKE> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in strikethrough type. This performs the same operation as S Procedure.

STRONG.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in bold or however "strong" is defined.

STYLE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <STYLE> and </STYLE> tags which include a style sheet in a Web page. You can get more information about style sheets at http://www.w3.org. This feature is not compatible with browsers that support only HTML versions 2.0 or earlier. Such browsers will ignore this tag.

SUB.bodyFullText:
HTP.SUB(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
SUB.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SUB> and </SUB> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as subscript.

SUP.bodyFullText:
HTP.SUP(
   ctext          IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
SUP.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <SUP> and </SUP> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround as superscript.

TABLECAPTION.bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLECAPTION(
   ccaption       IN       VARCHAR2,
   calign         in       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
TABLECAPTION.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <CAPTION> and </CAPTION> tags which place a caption in an HTML table.

TABLECLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which marks the end of an HTML table. To define the beginning of an HTML table, use the TABLEOPEN Procedure.

TABLEDATA.bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2
	, cdp => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
TABLEDATA.bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEDATA(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   crowspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccolspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
TABLEDATA.descriptionText: This procedure generates the and tags which insert data into a cell of an HTML table.

TABLEHEADER.bodyNoDefault:
cvalue => $1
	, calign => $2
	, cdp => $3
	, cnowrap => $4
	, crowspan => $5
	, ccolspan => $6
	, cattributes => $7
TABLEHEADER.bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEHEADER(
   cvalue         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   crowspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccolspan       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
TABLEHEADER.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TH> and </TH> tags which insert a header cell in an HTML table. The <TH> tag is similar to the <TD> tag except that the text in this case the rows are usually rendered in bold type.

TABLEOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEOPEN(
   cborder        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
TABLEOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TABLE> tag which marks the beginning of an HTML table. To define the end of an HTML table, use the TABLECLOSE Procedure.

TABLEROWCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the </TR> tag which marks the end of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the beginning of a new row, use the TABLEROWOPEN Procedure.

TABLEROWOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.TABLEROWOPEN(
   calign         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cvalign        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdp            IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cnowrap        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
TABLEROWOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TR> tag which marks the beginning of a new row in an HTML table. To mark the end of a new row, use the TABLEROWCLOSE Procedure.

TELETYPE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TT> and </TT> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in a fixed width typewriter font, for example, the courier font.

TITLE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <TITLE> and </TITLE> tags which specify the text to display in the titlebar of the browser window.

ULISTCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the tag which marks the end of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the beginning of an unordered list, use the ULISTOPEN Procedure. Add list items with LISTITEM Procedure.

ULISTOPEN.bodyFullText:
HTP.ULISTOPEN(
   cclear         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cwrap          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cdingbat       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   csrc           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
ULISTOPEN.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <UL> tag which marks the beginning of an unordered list. An unordered list presents items with bullets. To mark the end of an unordered list, use the ULISTCLOSE Procedure. Add list items with LISTITEM Procedure.

UNDERLINE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <U> and </U> tags, which direct the browser to render the text they surround with an underline.

VARIABLE.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <VAR> and </VAR> tags which direct the browser to render the text they surround in italics or however "variable" is defined stylistically.

WBR.descriptionText: This procedure generates the <WBR> tag, which inserts a soft line break within a section of NOBR text.

NEXTID.bodyFullText:
HTP.NEXTID(
        CIDENTIFIER IN VARCHAR2 
)
return VARCHAR2

GET_DOWNLOAD_FILES_LIST.bodyFullText:
HTP.GET_DOWNLOAD_FILES_LIST(
        SFILESLIST OUT VARCHAR2 
        NCOMPRESS OUT BINARY_INTEGER 
)

GET_LINE.bodyFullText:
HTP.GET_LINE(
        IROWS OUT NUMBER 
)
return VARCHAR2

GET_PAGE.bodyFullText:
HTP.GET_PAGE(
        THEPAGE OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        IROWS IN/OUT NUMBER 
)

GET_PAGE_CHARSET_CONVERT.bodyFullText:
HTP.GET_PAGE_CHARSET_CONVERT(
        THEPAGE OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        IROWS IN/OUT NUMBER 
        CHARSET IN VARCHAR2 
)

GET_PAGE_RAW.bodyFullText:
HTP.GET_PAGE_RAW(
        THEPAGE OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        IROWS IN/OUT NUMBER 
)

HTITLE.bodyNoDefault:
CTITLE => $1
	, NSIZE => $2
	, CALIGN => $3
	, CNOWRAP => $4
	, CCLEAR => $5
	, CATTRIBUTES => $6

PRINT_HEADER.bodyFullText:
HTP.PRINT_HEADER(
        CBUF IN VARCHAR2 
        NLINE IN NUMBER 
)

DISABLE.descriptionText: This procedure disables the cache for this particular request.

GET_ETAG.descriptionText: This function returns the tag associated with the cached content. It is used in the Validation technique only.

GET_LEVEL.descriptionText: This returns the caching level. It is used in the Validation technique model only.

SET_CACHE.descriptionText: This sets up the cache headers for validation model cache type.

SET_EXPIRES.descriptionText: This procedure sets up the cache headers for expires model cache type.

SET_NOT_MODIFIED.descriptionText: This procedure sets up the headers for a not-modified cache hit. It is used in the Validation technique only.

SET_SURROGATE_CONTROL.descriptionText: This procedure sets the headers for a surrogate-control header for Web cache

GET.descriptionText: This function returns the values associated with the specified cookie. The values are returned in a OWA_COOKIE.COOKIE DATA TYPE.

GET_ALL.bodyFullText:
OWA_COOKIE.GET_ALL(
   names          OUT      vc_arr,
   vals           OUT      vc_arr,
   num_vals       OUT      INTEGER);
GET_ALL.descriptionText: This procedure returns all cookie names and their values from the clien\'s browser. The values appear in the order in which they were sent from the browser.

REMOVE.bodyFullText:
OWA_COOKIE.REMOVE(
   name           IN       VARCHAR2,
   val            IN       VARCHAR2,
   path           IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
REMOVE.descriptionText: This procedure forces a cookie to expire immediately by setting the "expires" field of a Set-Cookie line in the HTTP header to "01-Jan-1990". This procedure must be called within the context of an HTTP header.

SEND.bodyNoDefault:
name => $1
	, value => $2
	, expires => $3
	, path => $4
	, domain => $5
	, secure => $6
SEND.bodyFullText:
OWA_COOKIE.SEND(
   name           in       varchar2,
   value          in       varchar2,
   expires        in       date       DEFAULT NULL,
   path           in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   domain         in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL,
   secure         in       varchar2   DEFAULT NULL);
SEND.descriptionText: This procedure generates a Set-Cookie line, which transmits a cookie to the client. This procedure must occur in the context of an HTTP header.

AUTHORIZE.descriptionText: This function is used when PLSQL Agen\'s authorization scheme is set to GLOBAL or CUSTOM when there is no overriding OWA_CUSTOM package.

GET_X.descriptionText: This function returns the X coordinate of the point where the user clicked on an image map.

GET_Y.descriptionText: This function returns the Y coordinate of the point where the user clicked on an image map.

CHECKSUM.bodyFullText:
OWA_OPT_LOCK.CHECKSUM(
   p_buff        IN       VARCHAR2) 
 RETURN NUMBER;

OWA_OPT_LOCK.CHECKSUM(
   p_owner       IN      VARCHAR2,
   p_tname       IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_rowid       IN       ROWID) 
  RETURN NUMBER;
CHECKSUM.descriptionText: This function returns a checksum value for a specified string, or for a row in a table. For a row in a table, the function calculates the checksum value based on the values of the columns in the row. This function comes in two versions.

GET_ROWID.descriptionText: This function returns the ROWID datatype from the specified OWA_OPT_LOCK.VCARRAY DATA TYPE.

STORE_VALUES.bodyFullText:
OWA_OPT_LOCK.STORE_VALUES(
   p_owner        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_tname        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_rowid        IN       ROWID);
STORE_VALUES.descriptionText: This procedure stores the column values of the row that you want to update later. The values are stored in hidden HTML form elements.

VERIFY_VALUES.descriptionText: This function verifies whether values in the specified row have been updated since the last query. Use this function with the STORE_VALUES Procedure.

AMATCH.bodyFullText:
OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER,
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER
   pat            in       varchar2
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.AMATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2
   from_loc       IN       INTEGER
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;
AMATCH.descriptionText: This function specifies if a pattern occurs in a particular location in a string. There are four versions to this function:

CHANGE.bodyFullText:
OWA_PATTERN.CHANGE(
   line           IN OUT    VARCHAR2,
   from_str       IN        VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN        VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN        VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.CHANGE(
   line           IN OUT   VARCHAR2,
   from_str       IN       VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);

owa_pattern.change(
   mline          IN OUT   owa_text.multi_line,
   from_str       IN       VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;

OWA_PATTERN.CHANGE(
   mline          IN OUT   owa_text.multi_line,
   from_str       IN       VARCHAR2,
   to_str         IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
CHANGE.descriptionText: This function or procedure searches and replaces a string or multi_line datatype. If multiple overlapping strings match the regular expression, this subprogram takes the longest match.

GETPAT.descriptionText: This procedure converts a VARCHAR2 string into an OWA_PATTERN.PATTERN DATA TYPE.

MATCH.bodyFullText:
owa_pattern.match(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

owa_pattern.match(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

owa_pattern.match(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

OWA_PATTERN.MATCH(
   line           IN       VARCHAR2,
   pat            IN OUT   PATTERN,
   backrefs       OUT      owa_text.vc_arr,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

owa_pattern.match(
   mline          IN       owa_text.multi_line,
   pat            IN       VARCHAR2,
   rlist          OUT      owa_text.row_list,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;

OWA_PATTERN.MATCH(
   mline          IN       owa_text.multi_line,
   pat            IN OUT   pattern,
   rlist          OUT      owa_text.row_list,
   flags          IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
MATCH.descriptionText: This function determines if a string contains the specified pattern. The pattern can contain regular expressions. If multiple overlapping strings can match the regular expression, this function takes the longest match.

GET_CLIENT_HOSTNAME.descriptionText: This function returns the hostname of the client.

GET_CLIENT_IP.descriptionText: This function returns the IP address of the client.

GET_PASSWORD.descriptionText: This function returns the password that the user used to log in.

GET_USER_ID.descriptionText: This function returns the username that the user used to log in.

SET_AUTHORIZATION.descriptionText: This procedure, called in the initialization portion of the OWA_CUSTOM package, sets the authorization scheme for the PL/SQL Gateway. This implements your authorize function, which authorizes the user before his requested procedure is run. The placement of the authorize function depends on the scheme you select.

SET_PROTECTION_REALM.descriptionText: This procedure sets the realm of the page that is returned to the user. The user enters a username and login that already exist in the realm.

ADD2MULTI.bodyFullText:
OWA_TEXT.ADD2MULTI(
   stream         IN       VARCHAR2,
   mline          IN OUT   multi_line,
ADD2MULTI.descriptionText: This procedure adds content to an existing MULTI_LINE DATA TYPE.

NEW_ROW_LIST.descriptionText: This function or procedure creates a new OWA_TEXT.ROW_LIST DATA TYPE. The function version uses no parameters and returns a new empty row_list. The procedure version creates the row_list datatype as an output parameter.

PRINT_MULTI.descriptionText: This procedure uses the PRINT Procedures or the PRN Procedures to print the "rows" field of the OWA_TEXT.MULTI_LINE DATA TYPE.

PRINT_ROW_LIST.descriptionText: This procedure uses the PRINT Procedures or the PRN Procedures to print the "rows" field of the OWA_TEXT.ROW_LIST DATA TYPE.

STREAM2MULTI.descriptionText: This procedure converts a string to a multi_line datatype.

INIT.bodyFullText:
OWA_TEXT.INIT(
        P_HTBUF IN/OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        P_ROWS_IN IN/OUT NUMBER 
)

BIND_VARIABLES.bodyNoDefault:
theQuery => $1
	, bv1Name => $2
	, bv1Value => $3
	, bv2Name => $4
	, bv2Value => $5
	, bv3Name => $6
	, bv3Value => $7
	...
	, bv25Name => $8
	, bv25Value => $9
BIND_VARIABLES.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.BIND_VARIABLES(
   theQuery       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv1Name        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv1Value       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv2Name        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv2Value       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv3Name        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv3Value       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
        ...
   bv25Name       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bv25Value      IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN INTEGER;
BIND_VARIABLES.descriptionText: This function prepares a SQL query by binding variables to it, and stores the output in an opened cursor. Use this function as a parameter to a procedure sending a dynamically generated query. Specify up to 25 bind variables.

CALENDARPRINT.descriptionText: These procedures creates a calendar in HTML with a visible border. Each date in the calendar can contain any number of hypertext links.

CELLSPRINT.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.CELLSPRINT(
   p_colCnt          IN    INTEGER,
   p_resultTbl       IN    vc_arr,
CELLSPRINT.descriptionText: This procedure generates an HTML table from the output of a SQL query. SQL atomic data items are mapped to HTML cells and SQL rows to HTML rows. You must write the code to begin and end the HTML table. There are nine versions of this procedure:

CHOOSE_DATE.descriptionText: This procedure generates three HTML form elements that allow the user to select the day, the month, and the year.

GET_CGI_ENV.descriptionText: This function returns the value of the specified CGI environment variable.

GET_OWA_SERVICE_PATH.descriptionText: This function returns the full virtual path of the PL/SQL Gateway that is handling the request.

GET_PROCEDURE.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the procedure that is being invoked by the PL/SQL Gateway.

HTTP_HEADER_CLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure generates a newline character to close the HTTP header.

LISTPRINT.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.LISTPRINT(
   p_theQuery     IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_cname        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_nsize        IN       NUMBER,
   p_multiple     IN       BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE);

OWA_UTIL.LISTPRINT(
   p_theCursor    IN    INTEGER,
   p_cname        IN       VARCHAR2,
   p_nsize        IN       NUMBER,
   p_multiple     IN       BOOLEAN   DEFAULT FALSE);
LISTPRINT.descriptionText: This procedure generates an HTML selection list form element from the output of a SQL query. There are two versions of this procedure.

MIME_HEADER.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.MIME_HEADER(
   ccontent_type    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT 'text/html',
   bclose_header    IN       BOOLEAN    DEFAULT TRUE,
   ccharset         IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL);
MIME_HEADER.descriptionText: This procedure changes the default MIME header that the script returns. This procedure must come before any HTP.PRINT or HTP.PRN calls to direct the script not to use the default MIME header.

PRINT_CGI_ENV.descriptionText: This procedure generates all the CGI environment variables and their values made available by the PL/SQL Gateway to the stored procedure.

REDIRECT_URL.descriptionText: This procedure specifies that the application server is to visit the specified URL. The URL may specify either a Web page to return or a program to execute.

SHOWPAGE.descriptionText: This procedure prints out the HTML output of a procedure in SQL*Plus. The procedure must use the HTP or HTF packages to generate the HTML page, and this procedure must be issued after the HTP or HTF page-generating subprogram has been called and before any other HTP or HTF subprograms are directly or indirectly called.

SHOWSOURCE.descriptionText: This procedure prints the source of the specified procedure, function, or package. If a procedure or function which belongs to a package is specified, then the entire package is displayed.

SIGNATURE.descriptionText: This procedure generates an HTML line followed by a signature line on the HTML document. If a parameter is specified, the procedure also generates a hypertext link to view the PL/SQL source for that procedure. The link calls the SHOWSOURCE Procedure.

STATUS_LINE.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.STATUS_LINE(
   nstatus        IN       INTEGER,
   creason        IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   bclose_header  IN       BOOLEAN    DEFAULT TRUE);
STATUS_LINE.descriptionText: This procedure sends a standard HTTP status code to the client. This procedure must come before any htp.print or htp.prn calls so that the status code is returned as part of the header, rather than as "content data".

TABLEPRINT.bodyNoDefault:
ctable => $1
	, cattributes => $2
	, ntable_type => $3
	, ccolumns => $4
	, cclauses => $5
	, ccol_aliases => $6
	, nrow_min => $7
	, nrow_max => $8
TABLEPRINT.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.TABLEPRINT(
   ctable         IN       VARCHAR2,
   cattributes    IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ntable_type    IN       INTEGER    DEFAULT HTML_TABLE,
   ccolumns       IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT '*',
   cclauses       IN    VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   ccol_aliases   IN       VARCHAR2   DEFAULT NULL,
   nrow_min       IN       NUMBER     DEFAULT 0,
   nrow_max       IN       NUMBER     DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN BOOLEAN;
TABLEPRINT.descriptionText: This function generates either preformatted tables or HTML tables (depending on the capabilities of the use\'s browser) from database tables.

TODATE.descriptionText: This function converts the DATETYPE Datatype to the standard Oracle DATE type.

WHO_CALLED_ME.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.WHO_CALLED_ME(
   owner          OUT      VARCHAR2,
   name           OUT      VARCHAR2,
   lineno         OUT      NUMBER,
   caller_t       OUT      VARCHAR2);
WHO_CALLED_ME.descriptionText: This procedure returns information (in the form of output parameters) about the PL/SQL code unit that invoked it.

COMMA_TO_IDENT_ARR.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.COMMA_TO_IDENT_ARR(
        LIST IN VARCHAR2 
        ARR OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        LENARR OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        ARRLEN OUT NUMBER 
)

DESCRIBE_COLS.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.DESCRIBE_COLS(
        CTABLE IN VARCHAR2 
        CCOLUMNS IN VARCHAR2 
        COL_NAMES OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        COL_DTYPES OUT PL/SQL TABLE 
        NNUM_COLS OUT NUMBER 
)

ITE.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.ITE(
        TF IN PL/SQL BOOLEAN 
        YES IN VARCHAR2 
        NO IN VARCHAR2 
)
return VARCHAR2

NAME_RESOLVE.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.NAME_RESOLVE(
        CNAME IN VARCHAR2 
        O_PROCOWNER OUT VARCHAR2 
        O_PROCNAME OUT VARCHAR2 
)

RESOLVE_TABLE.bodyFullText:
OWA_UTIL.RESOLVE_TABLE(
        COBJECT IN VARCHAR2 
        CSCHEMA IN VARCHAR2 
        RESOLVED_NAME OUT VARCHAR2 
        RESOLVED_OWNER OUT VARCHAR2 
        RESOLVED_DB_LINK OUT VARCHAR2 
)

BACKTRACE_DEPTH.descriptionText: This function returns the number of backtrace items in the backtrace.

BACKTRACE_LINE.descriptionText: This function returns the line number of the unit at the specified backtrace depth.

BACKTRACE_UNIT.descriptionText: This function returns the name of the unit at the specified backtrace depth.

CONCATENATE_SUBPROGRAM.descriptionText: This function returns a concatenated form of a unit-qualified name.

CURRENT_EDITION.descriptionText: This function returns the current edition name of the unit of the subprogram at the specified dynamic depth.

DYNAMIC_DEPTH.descriptionText: This function returns the number of subprograms on the call stack.

ERROR_DEPTH.descriptionText: This function returns the number of errors on the error stack.

ERROR_MSG.descriptionText: This function returns the error message of the error at the specified error depth.

ERROR_NUMBER.descriptionText: This function returns the error number of the error at the specified error depth.

LEXICAL_DEPTH.descriptionText: This function returns the lexical nesting level of the subprogram at the specified dynamic depth.

OWNER.descriptionText: This function returns the owner name of the unit of the subprogram at the specified dynamic depth.

SUBPROGRAM.descriptionText: This function returns the unit-qualified name of the subprogram at the specified dynamic depth.

UNIT_LINE.descriptionText: This function returns the line number of the unit of the subprogram at the specified dynamic depth.

IS_LOCATOR.descriptionText: This function determines whether a collection item is actually a locator or not.

ISOPEN.descriptionText: This function checks to see if the handle to a piecewise (un)compress context is open or closed.

LZ_COMPRESS.bodyFullText:
UTL_COMPRESS.LZ_COMPRESS (
   src       IN           RAW,
   quality   IN           BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 6) 
 RETURN RAW;
LZ_COMPRESS.descriptionText: These functions and procedures compress data using Lempel-Ziv compression algorithm.

LZ_COMPRESS_ADD.bodyFullText:
UTL_COMPRESS.LZ_COMPRESS_ADD (
   handle IN             BINARY_INTEGER, 
   dst    IN OUT NOCOPY  BLOB, 
   src    IN             RAW);
LZ_COMPRESS_ADD.descriptionText: This procedure adds a piece of compressed data.

LZ_COMPRESS_CLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure closes and finishes piecewise compress operation.

LZ_COMPRESS_OPEN.bodyFullText:
UTL_COMPRESS.LZ_COMPRESS_OPEN (
   dst       IN OUT NOCOPY BLOB, 
   quality   IN            BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 6) 
 RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
LZ_COMPRESS_OPEN.descriptionText: This function initializes a piecewise context that maintains the compress state and data.

LZ_UNCOMPRESS.descriptionText: This procedure accepts as input a RAW, BLOB or BFILE compressed string, verifies it to be a valid compressed value, uncompresses it using Lempel-Ziv compression algorithm, and returns the uncompressed RAW or BLOB result.

LZ_UNCOMPRESS_CLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure closes and finishes the piecewise uncompress.

LZ_UNCOMPRESS_EXTRACT.descriptionText: This procedure extracts a piece of uncompressed data.

LZ_UNCOMPRESS_OPEN.descriptionText: This function initializes a piecewise context that maintains the uncompress state and data.

BASE64_DECODE.descriptionText: This function reads the base 64-encoded RAW input string and decodes it to its original RAW value.

BASE64_ENCODE.descriptionText: This function encodes the binary representation of the RAW value into base 64 elements and returns it in the form of a RAW string.

MIMEHEADER_DECODE.descriptionText: This function accepts as input an "encoded word" of the form:

MIMEHEADER_ENCODE.bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.MIMEHEADER_ENCODE (
   buf            IN  VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS, 
   encode_charset IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   encoding       IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN string VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET buf%CHARSET;
MIMEHEADER_ENCODE.descriptionText: This function returns as an output an "encoded word" of the form:

QUOTED_PRINTABLE_DECODE.descriptionText: This function reads the varchar2 quoted printable format input string and decodes it to the corresponding RAW string.

QUOTED_PRINTABLE_ENCODE.descriptionText: This function reads the RAW input string and encodes it to the corresponding quoted printable format string.

TEXT_DECODE.bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.TEXT_DECODE(
   buf            IN  VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS, 
   encode_charset IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   encoding       IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN string VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET buf%CHARSET;
TEXT_DECODE.descriptionText: This function converts the input text to the target character set as specified by the encode_charset parameter, if not NULL. The encoded text is converted to the base character set of database, as follows:

TEXT_ENCODE.bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.TEXT_ENCODE (
   buf            IN  VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS, 
   encode_charset IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   encoding       IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
 RETURN string VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET buf%CHARSET;
TEXT_ENCODE.descriptionText: This function converts the input text to the target character set as specified by the encode_charset parameter, if not NULL. The text is encoded to either base64 or quoted-printable format, as specified by the encoding parameter. Quoted-printable is selected as a default if ENCODING is NULL.

UUDECODE.descriptionText: This function reads the RAW uuencode format input string and decodes it to the corresponding RAW string. See "UUENCODE Function" for discussion of the cumulative nature of UUENCODE and UUDECODE for data streams.

UUENCODE.bodyFullText:
UTL_ENCODE.UUENCODE (
   r          IN RAW,
   type       IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   filename   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   permission IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL) RETURN RAW;
UUENCODE.descriptionText: This function reads the RAW input string and encodes it to the corresponding uuencode format string. The output of this function is cumulative, in that it can be used to encode large data streams, by splitting the data stream into acceptably sized RAW values, encoded, and concatenated into a single encoded string.

FCLOSE.descriptionText: This procedure closes an open file identified by a file handle.

FCLOSE_ALL.descriptionText: This procedure closes all open file handles for the session. This should be used as an emergency cleanup procedure, for example, when a PL/SQL program exits on an exception.

FCOPY.bodyNoDefault:
src_location => $1
	, src_filename => $2
	, dest_location => $3
	, dest_filename => $4
	, start_line => $5
	, end_line => $6
FCOPY.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FCOPY (
   src_location    IN VARCHAR2,
   src_filename    IN VARCHAR2,
   dest_location   IN VARCHAR2,
   dest_filename   IN VARCHAR2,
   start_line      IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   end_line        IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
FCOPY.descriptionText: This procedure copies a contiguous portion of a file to a newly created file. By default, the whole file is copied if the start_line and end_line parameters are omitted. The source file is opened in read mode. The destination file is opened in write mode. A starting and ending line number can optionally be specified to select a portion from the center of the source file for copying.

FFLUSH.descriptionText: FFLUSH physically writes pending data to the file identified by the file handle. Normally, data being written to a file is buffered. The FFLUSH procedure forces the buffered data to be written to the file. The data must be terminated with a newline character.

FGETATTR.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FGETATTR(
   location     IN VARCHAR2, 
   filename     IN VARCHAR2, 
   fexists      OUT BOOLEAN, 
   file_length  OUT NUMBER, 
   block_size   OUT BINARY_INTEGER);
FGETATTR.descriptionText: This procedure reads and returns the attributes of a disk file.

FGETPOS.descriptionText: This function returns the current relative offset position within a file, in bytes.

FOPEN.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FOPEN (
   location     IN VARCHAR2,
   filename     IN VARCHAR2,
   open_mode    IN VARCHAR2,
   max_linesize IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1024) 
  RETURN FILE_TYPE;
FOPEN.descriptionText: This function opens a file. You can specify the maximum line size and have a maximum of 50 files open simultaneously. See also FOPEN_NCHAR Function.

FOPEN_NCHAR.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FOPEN_NCHAR (
   location     IN VARCHAR2,
   filename     IN VARCHAR2,
   open_mode    IN VARCHAR2,
   max_linesize IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1024) 
RETURN FILE_TYPE;
FOPEN_NCHAR.descriptionText: This function opens a file in national character set mode for input or output, with the maximum line size specified. You can have a maximum of 50 files open simultaneously. With this function, you can read or write a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set.

FREMOVE.descriptionText: This procedure deletes a disk file, assuming that you have sufficient privileges.

FRENAME.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FRENAME (
   src_location     IN   VARCHAR2,
   src_filename     IN   VARCHAR2, 
   dest_location    IN   VARCHAR2,
   dest_filename    IN   VARCHAR2,
   overwrite        IN   BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
FRENAME.descriptionText: This procedure renames an existing file to a new name, similar to the UNIX mv function.

FSEEK.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.FSEEK (
   file             IN OUT  UTL_FILE.FILE_TYPE,
   absolute_offset  IN      PL_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   relative_offset  IN      PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
FSEEK.descriptionText: This procedure adjusts the file pointer forward or backward within the file by the number of bytes specified.

GET_LINE.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.GET_LINE (
   file        IN  FILE_TYPE,
   buffer      OUT VARCHAR2,
   len         IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
GET_LINE.descriptionText: This procedure reads text from the open file identified by the file handle and places the text in the output buffer parameter. Text is read up to, but not including, the line terminator, or up to the end of the file, or up to the end of the len parameter. It cannot exceed the max_linesize specified in FOPEN.

GET_LINE_NCHAR.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.GET_LINE_NCHAR (
   file        IN  FILE_TYPE,
   buffer      OUT NVARCHAR2,
   len         IN  PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
GET_LINE_NCHAR.descriptionText: This procedure reads text from the open file identified by the file handle and places the text in the output buffer parameter. With this function, you can read a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set.

GET_RAW.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.GET_RAW (
   file       IN            UTL_FILE.FILE_TYPE, 
   buffer     OUT NOCOPY    RAW, 
   len        IN            PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
GET_RAW.descriptionText: This procedure reads a RAW string value from a file and adjusts the file pointer ahead by the number of bytes read. UTL_FILE.GET_RAW ignores line terminators.

IS_OPEN.descriptionText: This function tests a file handle to see if it identifies an open file. IS_OPEN reports only whether a file handle represents a file that has been opened, but not yet closed. It does not guarantee that there will be no operating system errors when you attempt to use the file handle.

NEW_LINE.descriptionText: This procedure writes one or more line terminators to the file identified by the input file handle. This procedure is separate from PUT because the line terminator is a platform-specific character or sequence of characters.

PUT.descriptionText: PUT writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle. The file must be open for write operations. No line terminator is appended by PUT; use NEW_LINE to terminate the line or use PUT_LINE to write a complete line with a line terminator. See also "PUT_NCHAR Procedure".

PUT_LINE.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUT_LINE (
   file      IN FILE_TYPE,
   buffer    IN VARCHAR2,
   autoflush IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
PUT_LINE.descriptionText: This procedure writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle. The file must be open for write operations. PUT_LINE terminates the line with the platform-specific line terminator character or characters.

PUT_LINE_NCHAR.descriptionText: This procedure writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle. With this function, you can write a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set. This procedure is equivalent to the PUT_NCHAR Procedure, except that the line separator is appended to the written text. See also PUT_LINE Procedure.

PUT_NCHAR.descriptionText: This procedure writes the text string stored in the buffer parameter to the open file identified by the file handle.

PUT_RAW.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUT_RAW (
   file          IN    UTL_FILE.FILE_TYPE,
   buffer        IN    RAW, 
   autoflush     IN    BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
PUT_RAW.descriptionText: This procedure accepts as input a RAW data value and writes the value to the output buffer.

PUTF.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUTF (
   file    IN FILE_TYPE,
   format  IN VARCHAR2,
   [arg1   IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   . . .  
   arg5    IN VARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL]);
PUTF.descriptionText: This procedure is a formatted PUT procedure. It works like a limited printf(). See also PUTF_NCHAR Procedure.

PUTF_NCHAR.bodyFullText:
UTL_FILE.PUTF_NCHAR (
   file    IN FILE_TYPE,
   format  IN NVARCHAR2,
   [arg1   IN NVARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL,
   . . .  
   arg5    IN NVARCHAR2  DEFAULT NULL]);
PUTF_NCHAR.descriptionText: This procedure is a formatted version of a PUT_NCHAR Procedure. Using PUTF_NCHAR, you can write a text file in Unicode instead of in the database character set. It accepts a format string with formatting elements\\ and %s, and up to five arguments to be substituted for consecutive instances of %s in the format string. The expected datatype of the format string and the arguments is NVARCHAR2.

ADD_COOKIES.descriptionText: This procedure adds the cookies either to a request context or to the UTL_HTTP packag\'s session state.

ASSIGN_WALLET_ACL.descriptionText: This procedure assigns an access control list (ACL) to a wallet.

BEGIN_REQUEST.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.BEGIN_REQUEST (
   url               IN  VARCHAR2,
   method            IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'GET',
   http_version      IN  VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   request_context   IN  request_context_key DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN req;
BEGIN_REQUEST.descriptionText: This functions begins a new HTTP request. UTL_HTTP establishes the network connection to the target Web server or the proxy server and sends the HTTP request line. The PL/SQL program continues the request by calling some other interface to complete the request. The URL may contain the username and password needed to authenticate the request to the server. The format is

CLEAR_COOKIES.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CLEAR_COOKIES (
   request_context  IN  request_context_key DEFAULT NULL);
CLEAR_COOKIES.descriptionText: This procedure clears all the cookies maintained either in a request context or in the UTL_HTTP packag\'s session state.

CLOSE_PERSISTENT_CONN.descriptionText: This procedure closes an HTTP persistent connection maintained by the UTL_HTTP package in the current database session.

CLOSE_PERSISTENT_CONNS.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CLOSE_PERSISTENT_CONNS (
   host        IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   port        IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   proxy_host  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   proxy_port  IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   ssl         IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT NULL);
CLOSE_PERSISTENT_CONNS.descriptionText: This procedure closes a group of HTTP persistent connections maintained by the UTL_HTTP package in the current database session. This procedure uses a pattern-match approach to decide which persistent connections to close.

CREATE_REQUEST_CONTEXT.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.CREATE_REQUEST_CONTEXT (
 wallet_path          IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
 wallet_password      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
 enable_cookies       IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT TRUE,
 max_cookies          IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 300,
 max_cookies_per_site IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 20)
RETURN request_context_key;
CREATE_REQUEST_CONTEXT.descriptionText: This function creates a request context. A request context is a context that holds a wallet and a cookie for private use in making a HTTP request. This allows the HTTP request to use a wallet and a cookie table that will not be shared with other applications making HTTP requests in the same database session.

DESTROY_REQUEST_CONTEXT.descriptionText: This procedure destroys a request context in UTL_HTTP. A request context cannot be destroyed when it is in use by a HTTP request or response.

END_REQUEST.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.END_REQUEST (
   r  IN OUT NOCOPY req);
END_REQUEST.descriptionText: This procedure ends the HTTP request. To terminate the HTTP request without completing the request and waiting for the response, the program can call this procedure. Otherwise, the program should go through the normal sequence of beginning a request, getting the response, and closing the response. The network connection will always be closed and will not be reused.

END_RESPONSE.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.END_RESPONSE (
   r  IN OUT NOCOPY resp);
END_RESPONSE.descriptionText: This procedure ends the HTTP response. It completes the HTTP request and response. Unless HTTP 1.1 persistent connection is used in this request, the network connection is also closed.

GET_AUTHENTICATION.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_AUTHENTICATION(
   r          IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   scheme     OUT VARCHAR2,
   realm      OUT VARCHAR2,
   for_proxy  IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE);
GET_AUTHENTICATION.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the HTTP authentication information needed for the request to be accepted by the Web server as indicated in the HTTP response header.

GET_BODY_CHARSET.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the default character set of the body of all future HTTP requests.

GET_COOKIE_COUNT.descriptionText: This function returns the number of cookies maintained either in a request context or in the UTL_HTTP packag\'s session state.

GET_COOKIE_SUPPORT.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_COOKIE_SUPPORT (
   enable                OUT BOOLEAN,
   max_cookies           OUT PLS_INTEGER,
   max_cookies_per_site  OUT PLS_INTEGER);
GET_COOKIE_SUPPORT.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the current cookie support settings.

GET_COOKIES.descriptionText: This function returns all the cookies maintained either in a request context or in the UTL_HTTP packag\'s session state.

GET_DETAILED_EXCP_SUPPORT.descriptionText: This procedure checks if the UTL_HTTP package will raise a detailed exception or not.

GET_DETAILED_SQLCODE.descriptionText: This function retrieves the detailed SQLCODE of the last exception raised.

GET_DETAILED_SQLERRM.descriptionText: This function retrieves the detailed SQLERRM of the last exception raised.

GET_FOLLOW_REDIRECT.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the follow-redirect setting in the current session

GET_HEADER.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_HEADER (
   r      IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   n      IN PLS_INTEGER,
   name   OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2,
   value  OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2);
GET_HEADER.descriptionText: This procedure returns the nth HTTP response header name and value returned in the response.

GET_HEADER_BY_NAME.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_HEADER_BY_NAME(
   r      IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   name   IN VARCHAR2,
   value  OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2,
   n      IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1);
GET_HEADER_BY_NAME.descriptionText: This procedure returns the HTTP response header value returned in the response given the name of the header.

GET_HEADER_COUNT.descriptionText: This function returns the number of HTTP response headers returned in the response.

GET_PERSISTENT_CONN_COUNT.descriptionText: This function returns the number of network connections currently kept persistent by the UTL_HTTP package to the Web servers.

GET_PERSISTENT_CONNS.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.get_persistent_conns (
   connections  IN OUT NOCOPY connection_table);
GET_PERSISTENT_CONNS.descriptionText: This procedure returns all the network connections currently kept persistent by the UTL_HTTP package to the Web servers.

GET_PROXY.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the current proxy settings.

GET_RESPONSE.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.GET_RESPONSE (
   r                       IN OUT NOCOPY req,
   return_info_response    IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE) 
RETURN resp;
GET_RESPONSE.descriptionText: This function reads the HTTP response. When the function returns, the status line and the HTTP response headers have been read and processed. The status code, reason phrase, and the HTTP protocol version are stored in the response record. This function completes the HTTP headers section.

GET_RESPONSE_ERROR_CHECK.descriptionText: This procedure checks if the response error check is set or not.

GET_TRANSFER_TIMEOUT.descriptionText: This procedure retrieves the default timeout value for all future HTTP requests.

READ_LINE.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.READ_LINE(
   r            IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   data         OUT NOCOPY  VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   remove_crlf  IN  BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
READ_LINE.descriptionText: This procedure reads the HTTP response body in text form until the end of line is reached and returns the output in the caller-supplied buffer. The end of line is as defined in the function read_line of UTL_TCP. The end_of_body exception will be raised if the end of the HTTP response body is reached. Text data is automatically converted from the response body character set to the database character set.

READ_RAW.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.READ_RAW(
   r     IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   data  OUT NOCOPY RAW,
   len   IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
READ_RAW.descriptionText: This procedure reads the HTTP response body in binary form and returns the output in the caller-supplied buffer. The end_of_body exception will be raised if the end of the HTTP response body is reached.

READ_TEXT.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.READ_TEXT(
   r     IN OUT NOCOPY resp,
   data  OUT NOCOPY VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   len   IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL);
READ_TEXT.descriptionText: This procedure reads the HTTP response body in text form and returns the output in the caller-supplied buffer. The end_of_body exception will be raised if the end of the HTTP response body is reached. Text data is automatically converted from the response body character set to the database character set.

REQUEST.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.REQUEST (
   url              IN VARCHAR2,
   proxy            IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL, 
   wallet_path      IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL,
   wallet_password  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
RETURN VARCHAR2;
REQUEST.descriptionText: This function returns up to the first 2000 bytes of data retrieved from the given URL. This function can be used directly in SQL queries. The URL may contain the username and password needed to authenticate the request to the server. The format is

SET_AUTHENTICATION.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.SET_AUTHENTICATION(
   r         IN OUT NOCOPY req,
   username  IN VARCHAR2,
   password  IN VARCHAR2,
   scheme    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'Basic',
   for_proxy IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE);
SET_AUTHENTICATION.descriptionText: This procedure sets HTTP authentication information in the HTTP request header. The Web server needs this information to authorize the request.

SET_AUTHENTICATION_FROM_WALLET.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.SET_AUTHENTICATION_FROM_WALLET(
   r         IN OUT NOCOPY req,
   alias     IN VARCHAR2,
   scheme    IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT 'Basic',
   for_proxy IN BOOLEAN  DEFAULT FALSE);
SET_AUTHENTICATION_FROM_WALLET.descriptionText: This procedure sets the HTTP authentication information in the HTTP request header needed for the request to be authorized by the Web server using the username and password credential stored in the Oracle wallet.

SET_BODY_CHARSET.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.SET_BODY_CHARSET (
   charset  IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL);
SET_BODY_CHARSET.descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The description of different functionality is located alongside the syntax declarations.

SET_COOKIE_SUPPORT.descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The description of different functionality is located alongside the syntax declarations.

SET_DETAILED_EXCP_SUPPORT.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.SET_DETAILED_EXCP_SUPPORT (
   enable  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
SET_DETAILED_EXCP_SUPPORT.descriptionText: This procedure sets the UTL_HTTP package to raise a detailed exception. By default, UTL_HTTP raises the request_failed exception when an HTTP request fails. Use GET_DETAILED_SQLCODE and GET_DETAILED_SQLEERM for more detailed information about the error.

SET_FOLLOW_REDIRECT.descriptionText: This procedure sets the maximum number of times UTL_HTTP follows the HTTP redirect instruction in the HTTP response to this request, or future requests, in the GET_RESPONSE function.

SET_HEADER.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.SET_HEADER (
   r      IN OUT NOCOPY req,
   name   IN VARCHAR2,
   value  IN VARCHAR2);
SET_HEADER.descriptionText: This procedure sets an HTTP request header. The request header is sent to the Web server as soon as it is set.

SET_PERSISTENT_CONN_SUPPORT.descriptionText: This procedure is overloaded. The description of different functionality is located alongside the syntax declarations.

SET_PROXY.descriptionText: This procedure sets the proxy to be used for requests of the HTTP or other protocols, excluding those for hosts that belong to the domain specified in no_proxy_domains.no_proxy_domains is a comma-, semi-colon-, or space-separated list of domains or hosts for which HTTP requests should be sent directly to the destination HTTP server instead of going through a proxy server.

SET_RESPONSE_ERROR_CHECK.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.SET_RESPONSE_ERROR_CHECK (
   enable  IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE);
SET_RESPONSE_ERROR_CHECK.descriptionText: This procedure sets whether or not GET_RESPONSE raises an exception when the Web server returns a status code that indicates an errora status code in the 4xx or 5xx ranges. For example, when the requested URL is not found in the destination Web server, a 404 (document not found) response status code is returned.

SET_TRANSFER_TIMEOUT.descriptionText: This procedure sets the default time out value for all future HTTP requests that the UTL_HTTP package should attempt while reading the HTTP response from the Web server or proxy server. This time out value may be used to avoid the PL/SQL programs from being blocked by busy Web servers or heavy network traffic while retrieving Web pages from the Web servers.

SET_WALLET.descriptionText: This procedure sets the Oracle wallet used for all HTTP requests over Secured Socket Layer (SSL), namely HTTPS. When the UTL_HTTP package communicates with an HTTP server over SSL, the HTTP server presents its digital certificate, which is signed by a certificate authority, to the UTL_HTTP package for identification purpose. The Oracle wallet contains the list of certificate authorities that are trusted by the user of the UTL_HTTP package. An Oracle wallet is required to make an HTTPS request.

UNASSIGN_WALLET_ACL.descriptionText: This procedure unassigns the access control list (ACL) currently assigned to a wallet.

WRITE_LINE.descriptionText: This procedure writes a text line in the HTTP request body and ends the line with new-line characters (CRLF as defined in UTL_TCP). As soon as some data is sent as the HTTP request body, the HTTP request headers section is completed. Text data is automatically converted from the database character set to the request body character set.

WRITE_RAW.descriptionText: This procedure writes some binary data in the HTTP request body. As soon as some data is sent as the HTTP request body, the HTTP request headers section is completed.

WRITE_TEXT.descriptionText: This procedure writes some text data in the HTTP request body. As soon as some data is sent as the HTTP request body, the HTTP request headers section is completed. Text data is automatically converted from the database character set to the request body character set.

TRUNCATE_NUMBER.bodyFullText:
UTL_HTTP.TRUNCATE_NUMBER(
        VALUE IN NUMBER 
        NO_OF_DIGITS IN NUMBER 
)
return NUMBER

ESCAPE_REFERENCE.bodyFullText:
UTL_I18N.ESCAPE_REFERENCE(
    str            IN VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
    page_cs_name   IN VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NULL)
 RETURN VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET str%CHARSET;
ESCAPE_REFERENCE.descriptionText: This function converts a text string to its character reference counterparts for characters that fall outside the character set used by the current document. Character references are mainly used in HTML and XML documents to represent characters independently of the encoding of the document.Character references may appear in two forms, numeric character references and character entity references. Numeric character references specify the Unicode code point value of a character, while character entity references use symbolic names to refer to the same character. For example, å is the numeric character reference for the small letter "a" with a ring above, whereas å is the character entity reference for the same character. Character entity references are also used to escape special characters, as an example, < represents the < (less than) sign. This is to avoid possible confusion with the beginning of a tag in Markup languages.

GET_COMMON_TIME_ZONES.descriptionText: This function returns a listing of the most commonly used time zones. This list contains a subset of the time zones that are supported in the database.

GET_DEFAULT_CHARSET.bodyFullText:
UTL_I18N.GET_DEFAULT_CHARSET( 
   language  IN VARCHAR2,
   context   IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT GENERIC_CONTEXT,
   iswindows IN BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
GET_DEFAULT_CHARSET.descriptionText: This function returns the default Oracle character set name or the default e-mail safe character set name from an Oracle language name.

GET_DEFAULT_ISO_CURRENCY.descriptionText: This function returns the default ISO 4217 currency code for the specified territory.

GET_DEFAULT_LINGUISTIC_SORT.descriptionText: This function returns the most commonly used Oracle linguistic sort for the specified language.

GET_LOCAL_LANGUAGES.descriptionText: This function returns the local language names for the specified territory.

GET_LOCAL_LINGUISTIC_SORTS.descriptionText: This function returns a list of the Oracle linguistic sort names that are appropriate for the specified language. A BINARY sort is included for all languages.

GET_LOCAL_TERRITORIES.descriptionText: This function returns the local territory names for the specified language.

GET_LOCAL_TIME_ZONES.descriptionText: This function returns the local time zone IDs for the specified territory.

GET_MAX_CHARACTER_SIZE.descriptionText: This function returns the maximum character size of a given character set.

GET_TRANSLATION.bodyFullText:
UTL_I18N.GET_TRANSLATION ( 
   parameter        IN VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET ANY_CS,
   trans_language   IN VARCHAR2 'AMERICAN',
   flag             IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT LANGUAGE_TRANS)
RETURN VARCHAR2 CHARACTER SET parameter%CHARSET;
GET_TRANSLATION.descriptionText: This function returns the translation of the language and territory name in the specified translation language.

MAP_CHARSET.bodyFullText:

MAP_LANGUAGE_FROM_ISO.descriptionText: This function returns an Oracle language name from an ISO locale name.

MAP_LOCALE_TO_ISO.bodyFullText:
UTL_I18N.MAP_LOCALE_TO_ISO (

   ora_territory  IN VARCHAR2)
 RETURN VARCHAR2;
MAP_LOCALE_TO_ISO.descriptionText: This function returns an ISO locale name from an Oracle language name and an Oracle territory name. A valid string must include at least one of the following: a valid Oracle language name or a valid Oracle territory name.

MAP_TERRITORY_FROM_ISO.descriptionText: This function returns an Oracle territory name from an ISO locale.

MAP_TO_SHORT_LANGUAGE.descriptionText: This function maps an Oracle language name to an Oracle short language name.

GET_HOST_NAME.descriptionText: This function retrieves the name of the local or remote host given its IP address.

   wr      IN OUT   UTL_NLA_ARRAY_DBL,
   wi      IN OUT   UTL_NLA_ARRAY_DBL,

   ldvs    IN       POSITIVEN,
   info    OUT      INTEGER,
   pack    IN       flag DEFAULT 'C');

   jobvs   IN       flag,
   n       IN       POSITIVEN,
   a       IN OUT   UTL_NLA_ARRAY_FLT,
   lda     IN       POSITIVEN,
   wr      IN       OUT UTL_NLA_ARRAY_FLT,
   wi      IN       OUT UTL_NLA_ARRAY_FLT,
   vs      IN OUT   UTL_NLA_ARRAY_FLT,
   ldvs    IN       POSITIVEN,
   info    OUT      integer,
   pack    IN       flag DEFAULT 'C');
LAPACK_GEES.descriptionText: This procedure computes for an n by n real nonsymmetric matrix A, the eigenvalues, the real Schur form T, and, optionally, the matrix of Schur vectors Z. This gives the Schur factorization A = Z*T*(Z**T).

LAPACK_GESDD.descriptionText: This procedures computes the singular value decomposition (SVD) of a real m by n matrix A, optionally computing the left and right singular vectors. If singular vectors are desired, it uses a divide-and-conquer algorithm that makes mild assumptions about floating point arithmetic.

BIT_AND.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.BIT_AND (
   r1 IN RAW,
   r2 IN RAW) 
RETURN RAW;
BIT_AND.descriptionText: This function performs bitwise logical "and" of the values in RAW r1 with RAW r2 and returns the "anded" result RAW.

BIT_COMPLEMENT.descriptionText: This function performs bitwise logical "complement" of the values in RAW r and returns the complemen\'ed result RAW. The result length equals the input RAW r length.

BIT_OR.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.BIT_OR (
   r1 IN RAW,
   r2 IN RAW) 
  RETURN RAW;
BIT_OR.descriptionText: This function performs bitwise logical "or" of the values in RAW r1 with RAW r2 and returns the o\'d result RAW.

BIT_XOR.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.BIT_XOR (
   r1 IN RAW,
   r2 IN RAW) 
  RETURN RAW;
BIT_XOR.descriptionText: This function performs bitwise logical "exclusive or" of the values in RAW r1 with RAW r2 and returns the xo\'d result RAW.

CAST_FROM_NUMBER.descriptionText: This function returns the RAW binary representation of a NUMBER value.

CAST_TO_BINARY_FLOAT.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.CAST_TO_BINARY_FLOAT (

   endianess  IN PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 1)

CAST_TO_BINARY_INTEGER.bodyFullText:

   r          IN RAW

RETURN BINARY_INTEGER;
CAST_TO_BINARY_INTEGER.descriptionText: This function casts the RAW binary representation of a BINARY_INTEGER into a BINARY_INTEGER.

CAST_TO_NUMBER.descriptionText: This function casts the RAW binary representation of a NUMBER into a NUMBER.

CAST_TO_NVARCHAR2.descriptionText: This function converts a RAW value represented using some number of data bytes into an NVARCHAR2 value with that number of data bytes.

CAST_TO_RAW.descriptionText: This function converts a VARCHAR2 value represented using some number of data bytes into a RAW value with that number of data bytes. The data itself is not modified in any way, but its datatype is recast to a RAW datatype.

CAST_TO_VARCHAR2.descriptionText: This function converts a RAW value represented using some number of data bytes into a VARCHAR2 value with that number of data bytes.

COMPARE.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.COMPARE (
   r1  IN RAW,
   r2  IN RAW,
   pad IN RAW DEFAULT NULL) 
  RETURN NUMBER;
COMPARE.descriptionText: This function compares two RAW values. If they differ in length, then the shorter is extended on the right according to the optional pad parameter.

CONCAT.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.CONCAT (  
   r1  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r2  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r3  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r4  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r5  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r6  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r7  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r8  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r9  IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r10 IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r11 IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   r12 IN RAW DEFAULT NULL) 
  RETURN RAW;
CONCAT.descriptionText: This function concatenates up to 12 RAWs into a single RAW. If the concatenated size exceeds 32K, then an error is returned

CONVERT.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.CONVERT (
   r            IN RAW,
   to_charset   IN VARCHAR2,
   from_charset IN VARCHAR2) 
  RETURN RAW;
CONVERT.descriptionText: This function converts RAW r from character set from_charset to character set to_charset and returns the resulting RAW.

COPIES.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.COPIES (
   r IN RAW,
   n IN NUMBER) 
  RETURN RAW;
COPIES.descriptionText: This function returns n copies of r concatenated together.

LENGTH.descriptionText: This function returns the length in bytes of a RAW r.

OVERLAY.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.OVERLAY (
   overlay_str IN RAW,
   target      IN RAW,
   pos         IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
   len         IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL,
   pad         IN RAW            DEFAULT NULL) 
  RETURN RAW;
OVERLAY.descriptionText: This function overlays the specified portion of target RAW with overlay_str RAW, starting from byte position pos of target and proceeding for len bytes.

REVERSE.descriptionText: This function reverses a byte sequence in RAW r from end to end. For example, \'0102F\' would be reversed to \'F3020\', and\'xy\' would be reversed to\'zy\'.The result length is the same as the input RAW length.

SUBSTR.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.SUBSTR (
   r   IN RAW,
   pos IN BINARY_INTEGER,
   len IN BINARY_INTEGER DEFAULT NULL) 
  RETURN RAW;
SUBSTR.descriptionText: This function returns len bytes, starting at pos from RAW r.

TRANSLATE.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.TRANSLATE (
   r        IN RAW,
   from_set IN RAW,
   to_set   IN RAW) 
  RETURN RAW;
TRANSLATE.descriptionText: This function translates the bytes in the input RAW r according to the bytes in the translation RAWs from_set and to_set. If a byte in r has a matching byte in from_set, then it is replaced by the byte in the corresponding position in to_set, or deleted.

TRANSLITERATE.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.TRANSLITERATE (
   r        IN RAW,
   to_set   IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   from_set IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   pad      IN RAW DEFAULT NULL)
  RETURN RAW;
TRANSLITERATE.descriptionText: This function converts the bytes in the input RAW r according to the bytes in the transliteration RAWs from_set and to_set. Successive bytes in r are looked up in the from_set, and, if not found, copied unaltered to the result RAW. If found, then they are replaced in the result RAW by either corresponding bytes in the to_set, or the pad byte when no correspondence exists.

XRANGE.bodyFullText:
UTL_RAW.XRANGE (
   start_byte IN RAW DEFAULT NULL,
   end_byte   IN RAW DEFAULT NULL) 
  RETURN RAW;
XRANGE.descriptionText: This function returns a RAW value containing the succession of one-byte encodings beginning and ending with the specified byte-codes. The specified byte-codes must be single-byte RAW values. If the start_byte value is greater than the end_byte value, then the succession of resulting bytes begins with start_byte, wraps through \'F\' back to \'0\', then ends at end_byte.

RECOMP_PARALLEL.bodyFullText:

   schema   IN   VARCHAR2    DEFAULT NULL,
   flags    IN   PLS_INTEGER DEFAULT 0);

RECOMP_SERIAL.descriptionText: This procedure recompiles invalid objects in a given schema or all invalid objects in the database.

UPDATE_OBJECT.descriptionText: This procedure updates an object given a reference. The referenced object is updated with the value contained in the PL/SQL variable\'objec\'. The semantic of this subprogram is similar to the following SQL statement:

   username   IN            VARCHAR2,
   password   IN            VARCHAR2,
   schemes    IN            VARCHAR2 DEFAULT NON_CLEARTEXT_PASSWORD_SCHEMES);
AUTH.descriptionText: This subprogram sends the AUTH command to authenticate to the SMTP server. The UTL_SMTP package goes through the use\'s choices of authentication schemes, skips any that is not supported by the SMTP server and uses the first supported. To determine the schemes the SMTP server supports from its EHLO reply, the user must call the EHLO Function and Procedure. Otherwise, UTL_SMTP uses the first scheme in the list.

CLOSE_CONNECTION.descriptionText: This procedure closes the SMTP connection, causing the current SMTP operation to terminate. Use this procedure only to cancel an e-mail in the middle of the data session. To end the SMTP connection properly, use the QUIT Function and Procedure.

CLOSE_DATA.descriptionText: This subprogram ends the e-mail message by sending the sequence <CR><LF>.<CR><LF> (a single period at the beginning of a line).
